case.state: ...Happy Valentine's Day, ~player~. Yes, Mejare celebrates that.
The least I could do on Valentine's Day is try to be cheerful. I hear the men of Tarak don't even celebrate it.
Happy Valentine's Day. I'm not one for holidays, but our male prisoners told me Tarak doesn't even have any.
If Mejare can claim anything over Tarak, it's that we celebrate holidays. Christmas, Halloween...Valentine's.
Here I am in rare form, ~player~...actually being festive. Happy Valentine's Day from Mejare.
Haven't I mentioned Mejarians form couples? Of course we have Valentine's Day.
I've played plenty of poker with our quartermaster...but never the strip version.
Strip poker...that's not how I thought I'd learn about this planet.
Strip poker. Let's see if there's any men here...or how the women act with them around.
Poker is nothing new to me...but men are.
I'm a long way from my home planet, Mejare...so I expect to learn something tonight.
Men and women coexist on this planet, correct? ...I'll keep that in mind.
I can't believe I agreed to this...but I could learn quite a bit about Earth from a strip game.
...Now, back to work. I'm dressed as a Cupid, by the way...winged messengers of love.
This is an elaborate outfit compared to my suit, yes? I'm a Cupid...a Mejarian messenger of love.
Are you familiar with the Cupids of Monster Girl Encyclopedia? Well...Tarak considers women to be monsters.
The Cupids of Mejarian lore are quiet and stoic...they facilitate others' love, but struggle to express it themselves. It seemed fitting.
...I think the dealer was referring to us, Jessie. He was simply mistaken about us being aliens.
You shouldn't trust an Earth dealer, and a man at that, for information on Mejarians' humanity, Jessie.
Both Earthlings and men have a history of dehumanizing Mejarians, Jessie, so the dealer's account is not surprising.
...We're both human women, Jessie, but I understand his confusion. Earth has labeled its extraplanetary colonies as aliens for some time.
...That would depend upon your definition of "alien." Do you mean a non-Earthling, or an actual nonhuman species?
...As I've come to understand it, Jessie, Earth defines an "alien" as a human not born on Earth. Do you?
...Earth has already seen fit to attack Mejarians for being "aliens." But I look human because we are human.
Don't trust an Earth man for a description of Mejare, Jessie. Earth's colonies have long been unfairly labeled as "aliens."
Jura, don't annoy the other players. ...Or have you not noticed her jumping at you?
...You're already making a scene. That takes the attention away from me, at least.
...I believe that's Shimakaze, Jura. Not the robot--the girl climbing on your back.
That robot does look like Pyoro. I think she wants him back...though he doesn't seem to mind.
...Zone-tan's gossip is of no concern. But that is not a playful look in her eyes.
...By the look in her eyes, she does not have our interests in mind. Stay clear of her, Jura.
...It seems she's brought a partner of her own--~player~. And that grin of hers looks far from innocent.
..."Zone-tan" has a look as if she knows something we don't, Jura. Don't get too friendly with her.
...Excuse me? I don't tolerate children ranting at me.
...Daria, was it? You're a bit hostile for a young girl.
...A word of advice, Daria. If you want answers, ask questions politely, and one at a time.
...I just got here. Are you going to continue to pester me with nonsense, Daria?
...Evidently, she thinks some man wants to know about us. Daria, if you have something to say, say it.
Feel free to make comments to our faces, Daria. I don't value a coward's opinion.
We're right here...Daria, yes? If you have comments you'd like to make, do it face-to-face.
...Is something the matter with us, Daria? You look irritated by our presence.
Yes, we know each other. Jura is my subordinate on our crew...she wanted to come to this planet.
...Yes, Penny. We're crewmates. Jura wanted to learn about Earth, and she knew I'd keep it quiet.
And you are..."Penny"? Yes, Jura and I have known each other for a while now. We're both from Mejare.
We're colleagues, Penny. I command the pilot squadron Jura is a part of...and we share a homeworld.
...Second page? I haven't even sat down, and this place is full of insane women.
...Who are you talking to? What roster?
...Is there something you want to say..."Nugi-chan"? What's this about a roster?
...I walk over, and I'm greeted with a maid talking about dead girls and rosters. This was a bad idea.
...Kamina, was it? Are you referring to me?
...Well, I am a mech pilot...and I do have blue hair.
Cute? I--I don't want any men accosting me.
...Cute is a strong term, but they may have meant me, Kamina.
Cute? Don't think you can try anything funny.
...Are you referring to me, Misato? Your outfit isn't far off from a "plugsuit," either.
..."She" being me, Misato? Mejare doesn't call these plugsuits...you're showing off your form, too.
...You're "Misato," correct? You're wearing about half of a "plugsuit" yourself.
Are you addressing me..."Misato"? I can see the outline of your breasts and hips, so perhaps we're both wearing one.
...An astute observation, and one many of my pilots share.
...Many rookies feel the same way about me. They will still follow orders.
...Yes. I would be a poor leader otherwise, despite my pilots' protests.
...That is the opinion of many of my subordinates. Until their first dogfight.
..."Witch"? Witch is the term used on Mejare for man-sympathizers. What would an Earth woman know about that?
I'm not sure what you're referring to, Sayaka. On Mejare, witch means a woman who doesn't despise men.
What exactly is an Earth woman's concept of witches? I assume you like men...and that's what it means to be a witch on Mejare.
I'm sure Mejare's government thinks it has a big witch problem, since a witch there means "man-sympathizer."
...Are you staying by me? Fine...I'd rather not lose track of you anyway.
Sticking together is for the best...I don't want you running off with some Earth girl.
...OK, Jura, this is the place. I'm not doing you another favor like this again.
...Are you sure you want this, Jura? Knowing what we do about Earthlings...
I'll be there in a moment, Jura...don't rush me.
Maybe I can get some work done in the meantime...yes, Jura, I'm coming...
This armor is feeling tighter than usual...I can't believe you actually managed to get me here, Jura.
Planet Earth...at least I have a crewmate with me.
...OK. Let's go.
...Well, don't keep me waiting.
...I'd best get comfortable.
...Maybe I can get some work done between rounds.
...Planet Earth...I never thought I'd be here.
Planet Earth...the homeworld of my ancestors.
I shouldn't be goofing off here...
...Is everyone ready yet?
Tch! Employees pretending everything's fine--I'll handle this!
Jura--! Watch out, she's trying something else!
Damn it, there's so much commotion! If I just had a clear shot--Jura, look out!
...Cards? Damn it, don't you see what she did to my crewmate? That Tharja woman is the aggressor here--!
I don't adopt a stoic demeanor to win people over. I'm not surprised your viewers don't care for me.
Leaders need to keep a cool head. I'm sorry that's not more exciting, Streaming-chan.
"Blue hair"...so it is exotic on this planet, for you to point mine out.
It's a leader's job to be respected, not popular. Tell that to your viewers.
I would assume strangers would like that...now my shoulders are visible.
The way you're slavishly devoted to their opinions...it reminds me of the paparazzi.
Are you sure? I could be in better shape, certainly...
That's surprising...this is just training gear, not anything sensual.
I don't plan on showing the rest, Streaming-chan, if I can help it.
Tch...I thought three or four people might see me naked tonight, not hundreds.
...I'm not trying to move in a sexual way. Except for stretching, maybe...
...The press used to call me beautiful as a little girl. This is a strange twist on that, later in life...
...I'm fine.

You're taking notes? I'm doing some scheduling myself...what else have you written down about us?
...All-female race? We're descendants of Earth colonists, Beatrix. Fully human.

It seems you should've studied Earth history closer, Beatrix. Mejare is an Earth colony, and we're no different from other human women. Not a unique race.
I know you're proud of your beauty, Jura, but this hand might make you a little jealous.
Can't complain. Well, maybe I could.

My Fama always told me to open my heart. At least I'm wearing plenty of them.

I've always found it strange how my crewmates come to me for relationship advice...
Would you consider this more titillating than my bodysuit? I get enough comments about my backside already.
Yes, this is the sort of thing women wear on Mejare, even in children's books. With no men around, nudity is no concern.
My Oma and Fama were usually busy in their laboratories on Valentine's...I wonder how they fell in love.
Hmm...you can see my nipples straight through this top. This really is more provocative than my suit...
Now I can play as I please. But since it's Valentine's Day, I'll try to smile more.
What a hassle that outfit was. I can't believe Jura wears all that jewelry every day.
Ah...form-fitting is the Mejarian way. And failing that, just your form by itself...
I think that's enough celebration. Luckily, Gascogne and the captain take all the Christmas suits for themselves...
Hmm...well, leading the squadron can be stressful, but I'd rather serve under Magno Vivan than Eros the Love Goddess.
You're wearing some tight clothing yourself, Misato. It's perfectly normal on my homeworld to do so...
Your own dress isn't far off from a "plugsuit," Misato. I'm happy to see Mejarian fashion represented on this planet.
I wasn't expecting such like-minded fashion on Earth myself, Misato. Even your outfit shows off your figure.
Perhaps the tight-fitting fashion of Mejare isn't as unique as I thought. Your own dress is hugging your hips, as well, Misato.
You're wearing some tight clothing yourself, Misato. It's perfectly normal on my homeworld to do so...
Your own dress isn't far off from a "plugsuit," Misato. I'm happy to see Mejarian fashion represented on this planet.
I wasn't expecting such like-minded fashion on Earth myself, Misato. Even your outfit shows off your figure.
Perhaps the tight-fitting fashion of Mejare isn't as unique as I thought. Your own dress is hugging your hips, as well, Misato.
You're wearing some tight clothing yourself, Misato. It's perfectly normal on my homeworld to do so...
Your own dress isn't far off from a "bodysuit," Misato. I'm happy to see Mejarian fashion represented on this planet.
I wasn't expecting such like-minded fashion on Earth myself, Misato. Even your outfit shows off your figure.
Perhaps the tight-fitting fashion of Mejare isn't as unique as I thought. Your own dress is hugging your hips, as well, Misato.
...Jura, is this a roundabout way of matchmaking me and Sei? Now she's going and including the child...
...Jura, I understand that you want me to either date Sei or admit I'm interested in men, but she's dragging Rin into this.
I am not about to date this woman, Jura, even if you bring up men by comparison. Look how she's bringing children into the mix.
...What's this really about, Jura? Is bringing up men supposed to make Sei look better by comparison? She wants some bizarre threesome with me and Rin.
...Jura, is this a roundabout way of matchmaking me and Sei? Some of the men we know are more upstanding than she is...
...Jura, I understand that you want me to date Sei, but bringing up men just makes them look better. Male soldiers seem disciplined.
I am not about to date this woman, Jura, even if you bring up men by comparison. In fact, I might actually prefer a man...they're more principled.
...What's this really about, Jura? Are you trying to compare Sei to a man? Because my opinion of male soldiers has actually improved lately...
...I can witness explosions back home. In any case, it's nice to hear that, Misato.
...And some Earth women feel the need to interject. I'm glad you're open to meeting other women, Misato.
...Try to ignore her, Misato. You're very attractive, even by my Mejarian standards.
...And blow each other up with explosion magic, yes. If you ever decide men aren't worth the trouble, Misato, you'd fit in on Mejare.
...I did that to put Revy in her place, Alice. Not to feed your barbaric bloodlust.
...That exchange was all we needed, Alice. You'll have to picture us wrestling on the ground.
...I'm sorry to disappoint you, Alice, but that should do it. Human women don't take sexual pleasure in fighting.
...I suppose if either of us drew blood, you'd use it as lubricant. A "Monster Girl" indeed.
...If "Monster Girls" live lives of violence, then perhaps we're similar than I thought, Alice.
...You seem to pride yourself on your life of fighting. Pirate or monster, then, we're still women at heart.
...Perhaps a pirate's life isn't much different from a Monster Girl's, Alice. Everything leads back to violence...
...Monsters and pirates both live by the sword, it seems. Are you sure you're not a human woman deep down?
...That's correct, Dust. Men tend to have a more curious reaction to hearing that...
...Mejare was intentionally settled by only women, Dust, so yes. You look somewhat frightened by that fact...
...Hm. When we've told other non-Tarakkian men that Mejare has no women, they get excited at the prospect...not scared.
...Do you prefer other men's company, Dust? Men typically perk up when they hear that Mejare is all women...
J-Jura, are you alright? I warned you that woman is insane--! (...If she makes another move, yes, I agree.)
You're...large again? Do you feel the same? (...We can't just kill her on a hostile planet, Jura. Not unless we have to.)
Damn it, now what--oh, you're...back to normal? (If she reaches for that book again, I agree. She's too dangerous.)
...Oh, she fixed them. It was strange, having larger than breasts than you for a moment there...(if she attacks again, there's no other choice.)
...It doesn't speak to your confidence that you waited for someone else to challenge her, Aella.
...Is that why you told me to "get her back," Aella? Why not do the job yourself if she's nothing to you?
...Is that so, Aella? You seemed awfully hopeful I'd knock her out for you.
...I compared you to Gascogne, Aella, but she used to break up my fights, not use them as a confidence-builder.
...History remembers those who take action, Aella. Not those who claim they could've...but didn't.
...Actually, my arm's gone numb just from blocking that. If you're content on the sidelines, then don't claim victory.
...A truly strong woman has no need to boast, Aella. She'd know speculation is pointless.
Cowards speculate about strength, Aella. The strong fight when they must, no matter who they face.
...When you're fighting to survive, Aella, it doesn't matter who's "probably stronger." You simply overcome.
..."Probably stronger." That kind of ranking is useless on a battlefield...where anything can happen.
...Earth's Harvest fleet is "probably stronger" than our ship, the Nirvana. That's not the mindset of a warrior.
...You call yourself a warrior, and you're worried about who's stronger? There will always be someone stronger--and you'll have to face them all the same.
...What is the purpose of this challenge? This game already demands we cast away our privacy.
...I would consider stripping nude to a reveal of one's secrets in its own right. Why are you posing this?
I came prepared to answer probing questions about my homeworld...and to field threats of being probed. Why do you want more?
...What do you stand to gain from such a challenge? Is it simply coupling our phyiscal secrets with emotional ones?
...We'll see how your challenge plays out. Just be aware you're negotiating with a pirate.
...Know that I'm a pirate, Mulan. I will honor your terms...if it's convenient for me.
...With how our people dress, I'm at a disadvantage already. We'll see if a pirate honors your challenge.
...The "Chinese" would honor that challenge, wouldn't you? Well, I am a pirate...and "honor" is whatever benefits me.
"Against monsters"...I suppose so. As long as you're sure who's the monster.
...You sound so confident about identifying monsters, Aella. On Mejare, that's what a pirate would be called...
In the eyes of authority, criminals often are the "monsters." Is that not what you mean by it, Aella?
Against "monsters"? The men of Tarak call me a monster....and the ruling women on Mejare would, too.
...Are you all that concerned for the welfare of two strangers, Aella? And pirates, at that.
...What were you so worried about, Aella? Most women couldn't care less if pirates knocked each other out.
...Where I'm from, Aella, two pirates fighting is good news for law-abiding women. What do you care if we fight?
...It's no big deal, Aella...I used to fight all the time. I'm surprised you care at all.
...Is this a warrior's sympathy, Aella? I've never met a civilian who cared if two criminals killed each other.
...I really thought Earth women wouldn't care about men seeing them naked. You live around them all the time, don't you?
...My planet sees men as aliens. I understand Mejarians getting defensive, but I figured Earth women were used to men.
...I see even here, there's a clear divide between the sexes. I figured Earth women were so used to men that nudity was little issue.
Well, Blake, Mejare is at war with men. I assumed Earth women, who live and work with men, wouldn't care much if they saw them naked...
You don't think you sound like her? Jura's even been directing her attention towards men lately--like an Earth woman.
I would've hesitated to make the comparison, Misato, but you're both interested in men. Against Jura's upbringing, even.
Any woman who showers men with affection starts to sound the same to Mejarians, Misato. Jura's getting more Earthlike every day.
Well, the way Jura has turned her charms towards men reminds me of how an Earth woman would act--an Earth woman like you, Misato.
...I should've known men would find some sort of pleasure in seeing women fight in the nude...
...Men really are barbaric. Two women try to kill each other, and you salivate over our nude bodies...
...I know a few women who might cheer a nude fistfight, but a man doing so doesn't surprise me in the slightest.
..."So hot"? Leave it to a man to see only bouncing breasts when women trade punches...
...If that's true, Chazz, then maybe men aren't the brainless brutes my homeworld paints them as. You play card games in place of fighting wars?
...If you really settle all disputes with card games, Chazz, then men are more civilized than I've given them credit for.
...Somehow I doubt Revy would be satisfied with a card game. So much for Mejare's stereotypes--violent women, civilized men.
...Do you mean you fight with weapons, Chazz, or is everything a card game? Compared to that, the women of Mejare are savages.
I may not like Jura's attitude, but she does her job. She didn't get her position on nepotism.
There's no need to insult a woman's skills because you think she's vain. Jura earned her second-in-command position...somehow.
I know I criticize her, Daria, but you are not in the same position to do so. Jura is a fine pilot, despite her vanity.
If I were unhappy with Jura's skills as a pilot, I would've demoted her. Don't criticize my subordinates just because I do.
...We don't live in space, Misato. No more so than Earth does--I could ask you where you get alcohol, too.
Why do Earth women see everyone from other planets as being "from space"? Mejare has alcohol, too.
Is Earth less of a space planet than Mejare is, Misato? We have alcohol there, too...pumped full of estrogen for good measure.
...Misato, Mejare has alcohol like any other human planet. We don't live in space...well, our headquarters are in low orbit.
...As much as I don't understand the threats, she might prove capable of carrying them out. You should've armed yourself better.
Maybe you shouldn't tease her, Jura...we don't know what she's capable of. This is why you should've brought your laser ring.
It's clear this girl is working with forces we don't understand...and now she's making threats. I told you you should've come armed...with a gun.
This is the sort of thing I brought my laser ring for...a woman wielding powers we don't understand, making threats over teasing.
...I'm fine, Haru. Nothing to worry about...and I started it as much as Revy did.
Hoo...I wasn't sure I could still do that. Just relax, Haru--I instigated it, too.
...I think Revy and I have settled our differences, Haru. I'm equally at fault for that...
...Relax, Haru, it's over. I called Revy out...and we connected.
...My arm's a bit numb, Haru, but that's what I get for calling Revy out. It seems she's strong, after all.
...I'm fine, Haru. In fact, I think Revy and I both feel better... perhaps we could spar sometime.
...I'm fine, Haru. I can handle myself in a fight--and so can Revy. Maybe more than I can...
...Don't worry about me, Haru. That was all Revy and I needed...I hope.
I'm not hurt, Haru...luckily. I hate to say it, but Revy would probably overpower me in the end.
...No, Haru, it's fine. I think we're finished now...which is probably lucky for me.
...I think that's all the fighting we needed, Haru. I called Revy a coward, and she proved she wasn't.
...I think we're finished, Haru. Our guns are still nearby, so I suggest you leave the owners out of this.
...There's no need to call the owners, Haru. We're done... and I'd rather not have the police ruin my stay on Earth.
Take it easy, Haru...the fighting's over. Better we did it now, without our weapons.
...Revy and I understand each other much better now, Haru. Be glad it wasn't a shootout.
Just relax, Haru...this is the way pirates tend to settle things. At least we didn't have our guns on hand.
...It's fine, Haru. That could've been a shootout had we fought any sooner--I'll take a numbed arm.
...I think Revy and I both needed that, Haru. The way we live, it's either guns or fists...be happy with the latter.
The life of a pirate doesn't stop for games, Ryuji. But I think things are settled for now.
Yes...we're playing poker. Violence follows a criminal wherever she goes...but it's done. For now.
Tch...I didn't think a man would be lecturing me on being violent...but I guess that's a pirate's life.
...It's alright, Ryuji. That was all Revy and I needed. Poker or not, our whole lives have been about fighting.
...A man, telling me to stop fighting? I suppose I've never met a civilian man before...my life's too violent for that.
...You're right, Magician Girl, that wasn't a duel. Just an old-fashioned fistfight...
...I don't know much about a Magician Girl's experience, but Revy and I have "dueled" our whole lives.
...Don't fret, Magician Girl. Our duel is over...for now, anyway.
...For a Dark Magician Girl, you're quite concerned about others. But that little "duel" was all we needed...
...It's alright, Florina. I think Revy and I understand each other much better now.
...No need to worry, Florina. I think that was all we needed... until the game ends, maybe.
...Florina. I can't speak for Revy, but I think this makes us even. Perhaps we'll finish it later.
...Don't worry, Florina. I have no intention of taking this further...and I don't think Revy does, either.
...I'm sorry to disappoint, Franziska, but I think we're both more conscious than ever.
...That was false hope, Franziska. I can already tell that Revy knows how to stay on her feet.
...Revy can hit pretty hard, Franziska. She wouldn't go down in one punch, even if I might.
...I'm out of practice. But I'm still on my feet--to the dismay of two women here.
...I hope we satisfied your desire for brawls, Futaba. You're not the type I'd expect to take that in stride.
...I'm surprised a tech-minded girl took that so lightly. Our ship's engineer Parfet would've panicked.
...Do you see fistfights all the time, Futaba? I thought you were a shut-in...I have fellow pirates who hate fighting.
...Well, Futaba, there were plenty of boobs brawling just now. You didn't even mind... our ship's tech expert would have dove for cover.
...I'm sure you've kept some secrets from me, too, Jura.
...I try not to tell what women don't ask, Jura. It's all in the past...or it will be, once I can feel my arm again.
...I didn't want the crew thinking less of me, Jura. Or rookie pilots trying to start fights.
...You never did ask about my past very much, Jura. I didn't spring from the womb like this.
...I prefer blows to the stomach over hair-pulling, Kyu. But it's not the fight you're really interested in.
..."Fist my butt," Kyu? If you'd rather Revy and I had sex, there's no need for the pretense.
..."Fisting a woman's butt" usually doesn't happen in a fight, Kyu. You may have something else in mind.
...I'm not so sure that fight would have evolved into "fisting my butt," Kyu. Even if you wanted it to.
...Revy's ponytail would've made pulling her hair easy. But it's clear you wanted that fight to go in a different direction.
...Fistfights are common on Gensokyo, Miko? Well...it seems all societies have their underbelly.
...I wouldn't expect a noble to know about the fistfights common women partake in. Japan really is like Mejare.
...Does the leader of Japan regularly get in fistfights? I guess it has its dark side, too...like Mejare.
...I'm sorry to disappoint, Miko, but I think that's all we needed. Enjoy your nation's regular fistfights.
...You may have to head back to Gensokyo, Miko. I think Revy and I are done...for now.
...Were you saying something, Misato? I just had to settle my differences with Revy...
...I'm sorry about that interruption, Misato. Were you trying to tell me something?
...Were you warning me about something, Misato? Sometimes bombs need to be detonated before they get any bigger.
...I'm glad that's taken care of. Now, Misato, you wanted my attention? It's yours...
...What exactly were your expectations of me, Penny? I told you I'm a criminal.
...Didn't I mention I lived on the streets, Penny? I don't know what you expected of me.
...I'm sorry to shatter your illusions, Penny, but there's no such thing as a pirate who's above violence.
...Fighting is how criminals settle things, Penny. Why you expected anything else from me, I can't imagine.
...Did you have frequent issues with in-gang fighting, Saki? You ought to be a better leader.
...You should work on your leadership skills if you had women fighting amongst themselves, Saki.
Both in your gang? I fought random women on the streets...you need to keep your subordinates in line.
...I would never tolerate fighting among my pilots. You need to help them redirect their anger towards their enemies.
...That may be true, Sakura, but we're not part of Franchouchou. I think the violence is over for now.
...Did you say something, Sakura? Revy and I had a personal dispute...and we resolved it the way we know.
...Franchouchou may not be about violence, Sakura, but some women's lives are. And we settle things that way.
...Don't look so shocked, Sakura. Your life is about singing...a pirate's life is about violence.
...I'm sorry, Streaming-chan, but I think that's all the fighting we needed for now. We'll still be naked, at least.
...I'm sorry to disappoint your viewers, but our fight is over... temporarily. I suggest you zoom in on our breasts.
It seems I finally provided what your audience was looking for, Streaming-chan...at least for a while.
...Well, then. All it took to win over your audience was for me to act like a typical pirate for once...not that it lasted.
...I think we've called a truce for now, Streaming-chan. That's good for me...but your viewers probably like blood.
...Fistfighting in a bar to drunken jeers...just like old times.
...Fighting for a crowd of half-nude women. I never thought Earth and Mejare could be so similar.
...I have more than enough experience fighting bar thugs for jeering drunks.
...Half-nude, drunken women cheering on a fistfight is just another day on the underbelly of Mejare.
...Would those two be men on your ship, Nami? I would expect as much from them...but women can be just as violent.
...Men fight on your ship, Nami? Ours get along just fine...it's the women who are always fighting.
...I'm sorry if you thought that men were the only ones prone to violence, Nami. In my experience, they fight less...
...I'm sorry about that, Nami. Perhaps men fight more on this planet...Mejare will teach you how brutal women can be.
...I'm sorry to shatter any illusions you had of humans being a peaceful race, Caulifla. Though you seem to prefer it this way.
...I'm sure you're proud of your race's violent tendencies, Caulifla...but humans are no strangers to that, either.
...Perhaps humans and Saiyans aren't so different after all, Caulifla. I'm glad you're feeling at home on this planet.
...I may boast about humanity's engineering, Caulifla, but some humans survive on violence...like Saiyans do, yes?
...So, explosions of violence make Earth feel like home for a Saiyan. The same is true for me...and many humans.
...There's no need to intervene, Starfire. That should be all we needed.
...That won't be necessary, Starfire. Revy and I understand each other a little better now.
...I fail to see how you forcing us apart would help matters, Starfire. I think we've worked things out.
...I'm sure you're anxious to exert your strength, Starfire, but Revy and I needed to settle that alone.
...I'm sorry to have instigated that in our friendly card game, Jessie. But it's how younger women can be.
...You'd best stay out of this, Jessie. I'm sure you're past the age where you settle things this way.
...An older woman chastizing me for fighting? It's like I never left the ship.
...This is where age has matured you, Jessie. I still fight to solve my problems.
Earth has made a habit of invading Mejare, Jessie. And I am defending myself, as usual.
I believe Revy was the aggressor here, Jessie. That's typical of Earth and Mejare's diplomacy.
...You don't need to worry about a Mejarian invasion, Jessie. Earth, as usual, is the aggressor here.
...Revy is doing her best to invade me, Jessie. So it goes for Earth and Mejare, as well.
...I should've known men would find some sort of pleasure in seeing women fight in the nude...
...Men really are barbaric. Two women try to kill each other, and you salivate over our nude bodies...
...I know a few women who might cheer a nude fistfight, but a man doing so doesn't surprise me in the slightest.
..."So hot"? Leave it to a man to see only bouncing breasts when women trade punches...
...I'm sorry you had to see this, Rin. Some women have to live lives of violence to survive.
...Are you alright, Rin? Make sure you stay in school...so you don't make your living fighting thugs in the nude.
...It's a shame we had to do this in front of a schoolgirl. Focus on your art, Rin--don't end up like Revy and me.
...Rin. If you ever feel like you don't fit in, remember that you haven't sunk to nude barfighting. Revy and I are the ones who don't belong.
...At least this bar is clean and comfortable. I don't care for bright lights...or constant chatter.
I can appreciate this bar, at least. I wasn't expecting a dim alcove for us to play in...
At least this place had the courtesy to seclude us. I couldn't get work done in a crowded casino hall, much less strip naked...
...I have to admit, the space they gave us to play in is perfect. Secluded...dim...quiet.
..."The Inventory." What are they stockpiling here to give a bar that name?
Perhaps we should raid this place before we leave, Jura...calling it "the Inventory" is tempting.
Hmm...I was actually worried they'd make us strip in a large hall with tables everywhere. This is much better...

condition.saying: Number Two is actually our leader

case.state: Saki is your leader? She doesn't seem mature enough for that...unless she just shouted the others down.
...Was Saki chosen to be your leader? She seems more likely to shout at you for crying than boost morale.
...Saki is your group's leader? She does seem like the type to appoint herself...and you seem like the type to let her.
...Saki? She reminds me more of my pilot Barnette...too proud to accept others' views. Did you all agree to this?
...I don't think it's healthy to be so ashamed of your body, Florina. There's no harm in a picture with another woman...
...Well, this is meant to be a social event, Florina. Is it men who've taught you to be so ashamed?
...I'm doing my best to loosen up a bit, Florina. Mahiru is at least a woman--I wouldn't have accepted a man's invitation.
...I'm not thrilled about it, Florina, but I doubt it'll reach the crew. Why are you so embarrassed? Men's influence?
...Clearly. I feel as if we're missing a lot of context for the things you talk about, Miko.
You feel very strongly about your homeworld and relationships, Miko. ...So much so, I can't keep up.
...Just who are you, Miko? Everything you say seems to be...complicated.
I have to say, Miko, your world is a confusing one...at least, from the brief details you've given.
Haven't we mentioned the Harvest, Revy? We hate Earth because it established Mejare just to be an organ farm--like breasts and uteri.
Of course they're real. Mejare's women tend to be selected for healthy reproductive organs...so Earth can harvest them.
Mejare is meant to be Earth's colony for producing high-quality female organs, Revy. Of course Jura's breasts are real.
Earth wouldn't have much use for Mejare as a colony if our breasts were fake, Revy. It wants to harvest us.
Earth would've destroyed Mejare long ago if we weren't providing fresh, genuine organs, Revy. That includes breasts--we are the woman planet.
...I do not have time for relationships. Leading the Dread team cannot be mixed with private matters.
...For the continued success of our squadron, and to avoid potential biases as leader, I do not pursue romantic relationships.
...I am not looking for a partner. I wish to remain professional... perhaps you would not consider my fellow pirates honorable.
...Those indeed sound like good qualities in a partner. But I choose to avoid dating crew members...
...You haven't mapped out your entire planet? Space travel is one thing, but you don't even have satellites?
...First Earth's leaders hide the existence of space travel from you, and now satellite imagery? Mapping out this planet would take several days at most.
...Satellites should have mapped out this planet centuries ago, Nami. I can show you what it looks like from space.
...You're kidding. They've even hid satellite imagery from you...we could give you a shuttle craft and have you map the planet from orbit.
...Your name is Veran now? ...Nayru was much more pleasant.
...I should've known a sweet, tranquil woman sticking around would be too much to ask for.
...Right. You're "Veran" now. And far less pleasant...of course.
Oh, for God's sake...dabble in magic, and this is the result. A sweet woman possessed by...something less sweet.
For once, a kind, gentle woman, and she gets overtaken by shadow. Tch...back to work.
...Coffee. Black.
...I don't drink. Does this bar serve coffee?
...Coffee. I don't like being unfocused.
...Is there coffee here? Though it's late...so perhaps water.
A-anal? You really are drunk...don't tell me men put their tubes up there, too.
Anal? You can't be serious--it's one thing for a Mejarian to say that, but one of those male rods would split me in two...!
...Mejarian sex might involve some anal play by simple proximity...but we're gentle. You don't let men shove their tubes up there, do you?
...Earth women are interested in anal sex? Men's tubes look like a tight enough fit for the vagina, but to put them up there...!
...You mean anal sex with other women, don't you? A man's rod couldn't fit in my--backside.
By the way, watch where you put your fingers, Sei. You're without your precious gauntlets.
By the way: "Finger in my butt," Sei? Don't tell me that's an Earthling's idea of how to pleasure a fellow woman.
By the way: "Finger in my butt," Sei? Earth women are so vulgar. It must be from living around men.
By the way, Sei--I don't know much about Earth, but I'm sorry if a "finger in your butt" is your idea of pleasure.
By the way: watch where you put your mouth, Sei. You're without your precious gauntlets.
By the way: "Mouth on my pussy," Sei? I see Mejarian sex got its inspiration from Earth women.
By the way: "Mouth on my pussy," Sei? Earth women are so vulgar. It must be from living around men.
By the way, Sei--putting your "mouth on my pussy" is considered very romantic on Mejare. It's rather selfless.
...I see. But I have no interest in fighting you...unless you adopt Revy's aggression.
I agree you have the size advantage--a lot like our quartermaster. But there was no need to "put that to the test." Not with you.
I'd rather not test my strength unnecessarily. My quarrel is with Revy, not you...so don't speculate on the sidelines.
...And if you're not willing to initiate that "test," then don't interject. This was an issue between me and Revy.
...As in, knife-collecting is a hobby you adopted after you died? What did you used to do?
I suppose you'd need to fill the time, Spooky. Have you continued your hobbies from your time alive?
...I suppose being dead would give one a fascination with implements of death. And you didn't collect knives when you were alive?
...I can only imagine how being dead would skew my priorities. Did you have any hobbies from when you weren't a ghost?
If you really are doing that in real time, I might believe you're an android.
Earth has the resources to build near-perfect androids and send them to strip poker games...and still they Harvest us.
The Pod itself doesn't impress me...Pyoro is similar, and he can talk. But if you're the machine you say you are, that's something else...
Our ship robot Pyoro can do much of the same, and he too acts human. You, meanwhile, are on another level...if you're not lying.
...I see. There are times where I wish that was all Pyoro did...though it can also be nice to speak to a non-human.
Hmm...not all that different from Pyoro's function. Though the fusion accident that made our ship also gave him a personality.
Hm. Well, it seems your Pod really does resemble Pyoro in function...it can't talk back to you, can it?
I see. Our ship's robot assistant, Pyoro, has performed many similar roles, then. But he can voice his opinion about them.
Has it ever cradled a child? Our ship's robot helper, Pyoro, considers that his main function when he's not acting like your Pod.
...I see you'd rather use natural advantages than take your loss with any dignity intact.
I assure you, being seen naked will not devalue you as a person. Cheating, on the other hand, does.
...That's better than killing us, I suppose, but it's still pathetic to stave off a loss like this.
Can't you just accept defeat with your honor intact? That would actually give me some respect for you.
Even naked, you still had a chance. This isn't even cheating to avoid total defeat.
...I get it, but...maybe I just don't have a sense of humor.
...If your job is to make people laugh, then maybe the problem lies with me.
...That was clever. Maybe my crewmates are right in that I'm just humorless...
...Hm. When a woman says her job is telling jokes, maybe not laughing reflects worse on the listener...
...You're eating it. Unsanitary is that is, it's better than wasting it.
I'll give you the benefit of the doubt and assume you had that banana in a sterile pocket.
I fail to see how ruining a banana, then eating it anyway, is entertaining.
I'll be honest, Joey, this banana act is more irritating than amusing.
I hope there'd be something, yes. Maybe a clown's style of humor just isn't for me...
...For the record, Joey, I do want to laugh. I'm actually off-duty for once...
...Yes, there should be something that'll make me laugh. Though I'm not sure what it might be...
...Don't take it too harshly, Joey. Perhaps it's just me being humorless...it's part of my job.
Hm? Oh...I'm sorry. I feel as if I should appreciate your efforts...like when the crew throws me surprise parties.
...Well, I wouldn't want you distracting women on our crew, Joey, but you're free to be a clown elsewhere. I'm sorry.
...If it makes you feel better, Joey, no crew member has ever made me laugh, either. Some try every meeting.
Hm? ...Well, don't think less of yourself for it. I haven't laughed in a long time...
Hm? Oh, of course...I should've explained. When two women on Mejare have children, they're called an Oma and Fama.
..."Phamaz"? Oh, Famas. Omas and Famas are Mejarian terms for women who have children together.
...You're right. I suppose I should be explaining things as a guest. When Mejarian women have children, they're called an Oma and Fama.
...That's true, Jolyne. Omas and Famas are Mejarian parents...the Oma donates and egg, and the Fama carries the child.
...I see. So your planet isn't united as a people...each of Earth's colonies has one society.
...So you're that kind of politician. I don't know you well enough to argue...besides, Earth's colonies are each united on their respective planets.
...Your planet has factions, then? That's the one benefit of Earth's colonies...Mejare, for instance, is one united society.
...Hm. Warlord or not, I can appreciate efforts to unite a planet. Earth's colonies are all unique societies, but they aren't splintered individually.
...I'm sorry. Embarrassment is a major motivation for taking care of ourselves on Mejare... since we dress so revealingly.
...Hm. My body is always on display in that suit, so I must just be accustomed to embarrassment as a motivator.
...I'm sorry, Misato. This must be a cultural issue...Mejarians aren't shy about our bodies. Or calling each other out.
Embarrassing? Hmm...so it's impolite on Earth to just criticize a woman like that. Mejare has no qualms about it.
...I apologize, Misato. It must be a pirate's bluntness coming out...with the way Mejarians dress, we're quick to criticize.
...Hmm. So not only do Earth women cover more, but they aren't as quick to criticize each other. I'm sorry.
I'm surprised a man would wear armbands. So does Jura.
A man wearing armbands? That's Mejarian fashion.
It seems there's overlap between Mejarian and Earth fashion, with those armbands of yours.
...Men really are full of surprises.
...So you can't fly with those wings? Why does your species have them?
I think I read about angels as a girl...but they sure weren't depicted as winged men.
I must say, Pit, you're a new experience for me. I never knew men could experience shyness.
I just don't see what the issue is, Pit. Aren't you proud of your body?
Why are you so embarrassed? You don't seem to have any deformities...not that I'm an expert on male anatomy.
Life gets a lot worse than nudity, Pit. Hold your head high.
...Visor? This is a decorative eyepiece. You can inspect it if you want.
As do I. If you're so distrusting of me, you can inspect this for electronics.
I should've expected Earth women to be xenophobic. If you're so convinced I'm cheating, I can show you it has no function.
Oh, please. I don't need to cheat, and you're free to check my eyepiece if you're so inclined.
I guess you're not too concerned with winning...
Talking to you is exhausting...
Well, at least one of us is having a good time.
I like to stay sober...in every sense of the word.
Expensive...? On Mejare, you're told where to live...and you live there.
And what do everyone's lives need saving from, exactly?
Surely you can think of a better insult than buzzkill.
I can't help but kill the buzz when a woman can't keep my interest.
Nanobots? In your...blood?
Bluenette? Is that the Earth term for it?
...I'm not sure what a nanobot is, but it doesn't belong in the bloodstream.
Nanobots? Our crew is a little touchy when it comes to robots and body parts.
I see you have some sort of robot assistant, Shimakaze. Our ship does, as well...Pyoro is his name.
First, she issues damage reports, and now she has a robot helper like Pyoro. This girl can't help but remind me of the Nirvana...
How are you feeling, Shimakaze? I noticed your robot came back...it reminds me of Pyoro, the Nirvana's helper.
Rensouhou-chan, you called that thing? It flies and talks...just like Pyoro, our helper robot. You're nothing if not a reminder of home.
...I would expect a dead woman to have thirty knives lying around.
Am I wrong in assuming you died by tripping in your knife-collection room?
...Right. Thirty. I'll bring up the dead woman I met on Earth the next time Barnette brags about her gun collection.
...Thirty. Even in death, introspection can elude some women.
Well, it certainly means a lot to you. Perhaps my squadron could use a rallying cry.
I wish I could say I'm above silly catchphrases, but you're certainly in good spirits.
Well, it's making an embarrassed girl like you feel at ease, so perhaps there's value in catchphrases.
It boosts morale that much, huh? Maybe my pilots would perform better with a rallying cry.
Hm...you're stronger than I thought. That might've knocked me over...if you weren't a smoker.
...Your form is a little weak, Revy. But you're certainly stronger than me...I hate that.
...That made my hand numb. You're not just talk after all...part of me is glad about that.
...Well, you are strong...I can barely feel my hand. If you had some discipline, maybe you'd make a good pilot.
I told you I used to fistfight, Revy...and you're no trained soldier. But you're definitely a cut above Mejarian street thugs.
...Sometimes words fail us...you're stronger than I gave you credit for. My arm's already bruised...
...I think that was all we needed to say. You know, Revy, I could use a strong sparring partner...but you'd never accept, would you?
...I'm glad I got some warning for that. You are strong...wild, but strong.
You're not going to knock me out with an approach that obvious. But you're stronger than me...I have to admit that.
...I can't feel my hand. You're strong...if you didn't have a crew, I'd invite you to join ours.
...Tch. I was planning to knock you out, and one punch nearly took the wind out of me...you're more than I gave you credit for.
...You're easy to read. You're also very strong...which complicates things.
...I hope you didn't think that was going to be all it took. You need better form to match all that strength.
...Trying to overpower your opponent...with no technique to speak of. But you certainly have the strength.
...At least you weren't really a coward. I'd rather have a numb arm than a pathetic opponent.
...I shouldn't have called you a coward. If you want to finish this...I can't claim innocence.
Tch...I hope you're proud of yourself. I was planning to counter that, but it took all I had just to hold you off...
...Ngh. You've got the form of an ordinary thug, but your strength is beyond that. I won't misjudge you again.
...Agh. One punch, and my arm goes numb. I'm starting to believe you're the killer you say you are...
...Ngh. You're not like the thugs I used to fight...it's nice to meet one who can back up her words for once.
"Relaxing" isn't how Jura sold this to me, Nayru. She told me we'd learn about men here...
I'm only here because Jura said we'd learn about Earth and men, Nayru. She just hopes I'll relax.
I appreciate the invitation to relax, Nayu. Jura wants to me relax, but I'm here to see what men look like.
I usually relax in our spa...poker doesn't relax me, Nayru. Jura got me here by playing to our curiosity about men.
You would have to put a baby in me. It's quite clear you lack the responsbility to carry it.
I would accept me being the Fama between us. I shudder to think how you'd handle carrying a child.
Well, I would certainly never put a baby in you. You'd probably drink while pregnant.
If it were between the two of us, you should absolutely put the baby in me. You're too drunk to be Fama material.
Babies are delicate things, Sei. I'm certainly more fit to carry one than you are.
On Mejare, couples have to choose who carries the baby. She'd be much better off with me.
If you tell me to leave, D.Va, then yes, I'll do that.
What are you, some kind of sex pervert? I'm not taking side bets.
...My hair? What a polite woman...all I do is brush it away from my eyes.
Er...thank you. It's not often my hair gets complimented...I don't do much with it.
...You're very polite, Elizabeth. All I do is brush it. For the record, yours looks nice, too.
My hair? I brush it out of my eyes, that's all...usually women compliment my backside.
You dragged me away from work, Jura. I couldn't leave this to Barnette...she doesn't know how I organize things.
I'm playing the game, aren't I? Don't drag me here and then demand I behave how you want.
I'll do my best to note all the nudity when it comes. Otherwise, scheduling is a more productive use of my time.
If this game is really so thrilling, I'll naturally start to ignore this. For now, I need to schedule ahead.
I can multitask just fine, Jura. Besides...if work distracts me, then I'll end up naked soon. I assume you want that.
...Jura. Did you not come here with a laser ring? I would be much more comfortable if you were armed, as well.
...Jura, did you come here armed with only your sword? We've spent months fighting Earthlings--you should've brought your laser ring!
...Jura, that rapier is the only weapon you brought, isn't it? We're on a hostile foreign planet and you forgot your laser ring?
...Jura. I can't stress how important it is to bring your laser ring on a ground operation like this. These people could be hostile.
...Jura, did you really neglect to bring your laser ring here? Think about your own safety--and mine.

condition.saying: Number Two is actually our leader

case.state: ...I've always seen keeping a cool head as the most important way to boost morale. But I don't lead an idol group...
In a Dread team, anyone can boost morale...its leader should do so by staying calm. Singing must be different.
Is that so? One of my pilots-in-training has a knack for boosting morale...I just keep everyone calm. But that's flying...
You have nothing but praise for your teammates...like Dita. In a dogfight, a leader can boost morale with just a level head.
Early...'80s? Is that an Earth era? Mejarian history books only briefly describe woman's evolution before escaping to Mejare.
...I'm not sure when the "early '80s" were. If you read Mejarian history, we were terrorized by men on Earth before settling Mejare.
The...early '80s"? Those must be Earth years...Mejarian history begins with an angel leading women away from Earth and men.
...How many years ago was the "early '80s"? All we were ever told about Earth was that women fled it to settle Mejare...
...Well, Mahiru, how'd it come out? Reminds me of my family's run-ins with paparazzi...
Well, the press certainly took a lot of photos of me and my family as a girl...but I wasn't naked for any of them.
...God, how many years has it been since a stranger took my photo? The paparazzi used to hound my family...
...At least you're not as pushy as the photographers who used to surround my family's house as a girl.
If only you were a Silent Sister.
Mother...? Oh, right...Earth Famas. It's a shame she didn't teach you the value of silence.
...Right. I've often taught my own pilots to be Silent Sisters...you could use that.
...Mother? Wait...like a Fama. If only you got those silent genes.
...Yes, Beatrix, that'd be for the best.
...Not resorting to violence over casual snark. How very gracious of you, Beatrix.
Making threats to unfamiliar women is never a good idea, Beatrix. So yes, you should forget.
If only I knew the significance of their name. You're right, Beatrix...you shouldn't start fights.
...What's "English"? Is that what Earth calls the common tongue?
...Mejarians speak the common tongue, as do all Earth colonies. What's "English"?
..."English"? Mejare speaks the common tongue...even Tarakkian men do.
It's not coincidence that descendants of Earth colonists speak an Earth language. You may call it "English," but we call it the "common tongue."
I didn't expect that level of respect from you. I'm not exactly an average Mejarian citizen, but feel free to ask questions.
Addressing me by name? I didn't think you'd extend that courtesy...I'm a pirate on Mejare, but I can still tell you about its culture.
I didn't know you had enough humility to say women's names. Ask anything you'd like...though I'm not a law-abiding Mejarian citizen.
How respectful of you, Remilia. I know Mejare's underbelly more than its shell, so to speak...but don't be afraid to ask.
...A man, apologizing? Earth is strange indeed...
...You're certainly nothing like a Tarakkian man. Apologizing to a woman so readily...
...The only men I've ever known were Tarakkians--who still see me as the enemy. For a man to apologize like that is strange...
...Men are taught to be polite to women here, aren't they? A Tarakkian wouldn't back off so quickly...
...Well, I do have stronger reasons to feel bad. It's better to just obsess over breast size.
If I weren't anxious about my breast size, I'd just be dwelling on pilots who've died. It's better this way.
Remembering my time on the streets makes me feel bad, too. Size anxiety isn't nearly as...crippling.
I'm fine, Misato. I just obsess over my breasts because...it doesn't affect my job. Unlike some other things I could dwell on...
I'm not sure what that's supposed to mean. Don't I look like any other woman?
Alien? I'm a human, same as you...unless there's something I should know about you.
Why do you keep calling me an alien, Elizabeth? Earth wouldn't harvest our organs if we weren't human.
Alien this, alien that...you're awfully xenophobic. I'm a woman, just like you.
...Jura, don't lump me in with your man-chasing. Those rods of theirs look like they'd split a woman in two.
...I have no interest in chasing men. I've seen pictures of those tubes of theirs, and you're in over your head if you think one will fit.
...Direct any advice to Jura alone. I still have my doubts that those male rods can actually fit inside me...
...Do you really want to seduce a man, Jura? Those tubes look like they'd stuff us to the brim...
...Jura, I've been reading about those rods of men. It looks painful...some Earth women apparently let them use "other holes."
Mejare's colonists must have separated from men for a reason. If you seduce a man, don't complain when he stuffs his rod into you.
Those "sexual reproduction" textbooks look like men's rods stretch women to the brim. Leave me out of any seduction.
One-on-one. Don't leave your crewmate disappointed, Jura...or your enemy alive.
You're my second-in-command, Jura...you should be equal to me in every way. Show me what you're made of.
Better not lose to me when I'm like this, Jura. I don't like it when a pilot can't finish the job...
Finish off your opponent, Jura...that's all I am to you here.
You may have the superior body, but I've never lost to you in poker...this would be a bad time to start.
I'm not going to give you the satisfaction of making me masturbate, Jura...not after you lied to me about it.
You might have a better body, Jura, but I'm not afraid to face you down like this.
Ready to beat me, Jura? If not...maybe Barnette deserves a promotion.
Well, Jura, here we go. No different from our games on the ship...besides the stripping.
You haven't impressed me so far, Jura. Just the two of us now, so get it together.
OK, Jura...just you and me. Now focus on winning for once.
Good, no more distractions. Give me a challenge, Jura.
Alright, soldier. Let's see what you're made of.
I'd say we're on pretty even footing, Sei. So let's get right into it.
Think you can take me alone, soldier?
Just you and me, Sei. Ready?
A soldier can appreciate a good showdown. Right, Sei?
Alright, soldier. Sober up and focus for a moment.
You'd better sober up, Sei. It's just you and me now.
Do you think you can take me alone, Sei? Perhaps if you were sober.
It's just you and me, Sei. Make this worth it for me.
A soldier should be able to appreciate a good showdown, even when she's drunk.
Half-naked and half in the bag. Things aren't looking good for you, Sei.
I smell an easy kill. And it smells like alcohol.
Now would be a good time for those nanobots to sober you up, Sei.
Just you and me, Sei...but not for long.
Forgive me for not being worried about this showdown.
OK, Jura, give me a good show here. You know what kind of mood losing my eyepiece has put me in.
I'm a little miffed right now, as you know. So don't waste my time.
This had better be good. At least it came down to the two of us, so you have that.
Don't disappoint me, Jura...not one-on-one like this. It's bad enough that you lied to me.
One-on-one...no different from our practice games in the regisystem anymore, is it?
I won't disrespect you by going easy on you, Jura. Now don't go easy on me.
One-on-one...going to make me show skin, Jura? I know you're a fan of that.
You can handle a challenge from your own leader, right? I should hope so.
And then there were two...two women who know each other a little too well.
One-on-one...think you can finish me off? I hope so...
I'll be very impressed if you can beat me alone like this, Jura...give me a good show.
I'm not as intimidating in my underwear, right? Surely you can finish me off like this...all alone.
A showdown between crewmates...this is all I could have hoped for.
And then there were two...you'll remember, of course, that I've never lost to you.
Alright, soldier. Let's see if you can finish me off.
You've got the upper hand on me, Sei. Let's see if you can use it.
Don't count me out yet, soldier.
Just you and me, Sei. And I'm not finished yet.
Come on, Sei. I like playing at a disadvantage.
Alright, soldier. Let's see if you can finish me off before I can do the same.
We're just about even, Sei. Let's see if you can take control.
Don't count me out yet, soldier. I've got sobriety on my side.
Just you and me, Sei. And you're not doing much better.
You've drank yourself into a disadvantage, Sei.
It would reflect rather poorly on me to lose to a woman in your state, Sei.
We're just about even, Sei. Besides your rather groggy state.
Can you fight through your drunken stupor to give me a challenge for a moment?
Hey, soldier. Time for a showdown, if you can stay awake long enough.
Counting my sobriety, Sei, I'd say your chances are slim.
One-on-one...I don't have much left, Jura. You can do it.
Finishing off a weakened target should be easy enough for my second-in-command to do herself, right?
Can't rely on me forever, Jura...time for you to take command and win this.
A showdown between crewmates...I'd prefer to be better dressed for the occasion, but that's my own fault.
You're certainly not the type to be distracted by breasts, Jura...so that's not going to help me in this little showdown.
...Sei, maybe I'd relax if you stopped pestering me.
...This tiny woman is going to prod me all night, isn't she?
My crewmates have been telling me to relax for a long time, Sei. Leave me alone...
Sei, I'm not relaxing when I could be getting work done. Stop bothering me.
Mejare, Sei. My home planet. One of Earth's colonies...the planet of women.
I said Mejare, Sei. Mejare is the planet I'm from...populated only by women.
Weren't you listening, Sei? I'm from planet Mejare, which is known for being all-female.
...Mejare, Sei. It's the all-female planet where I was born...you should listen if you're going to ask questions.
Leave it to a soldier to brag about her expensive armor. You make me sick.
Public money well-spent, Sei. I'm sure the average citizen appreciates you absorbing shells.
Mejarian soldiers had a tendency to brag about their equipment, too, Sei. One did it before she beat me.
I'm not interested in your equipment, Sei. The most use it gets is probably crushing innocent street urchins.
Their--penis? ...Mejare sees men as monsters. Until recently, I didn't even know they had tubes between their legs...
...Penis? Oh...you mean that tube-shaped organ men have. Mejare portrays men as sexless, vicious animals...
I really meant their fangs, Sakura. All of my planet's media is devoted to demonizing men. What's a "peni"--oh. The tube...
I--I'm not equipped to discuss men's--penises, is the word? Growing up, I was taught they were lumbering beasts...
...I don't understand. Why wouldn't you have the freedom to change your hair, Elizabeth? Who's restricting you?
...Elizabeth, what do you mean you lack the freedom to change your hair color? Are you some kind of prisoner?
...Elizabeth, you're speaking as if you're trapped. Why can't you dye your hair? Is someone trying to control you?
...Elizabeth, I don't know your situation, but you shouldn't be so resigned to a lack of freedom. If you want to dye your hair, then stand up for yourself.
You're not sure what men's tubes can do? ...Well, to be fair, you're not a human woman.
Hm...I suppose asking a small blue fairy woman for human anatomy lessons was foolish.
...I have a feeling men might keep any tube-stretching abilities under wraps. I'll have to ask a human woman...
I suppose you're not the right woman to ask about men's tubes, considering you're a...fairy.
Hm...well, I'm sure there's more experienced women here to ask about male anatomy. More human, as well...
...Hello to you, Nayru. It's nice to see another blue-haired woman...perhaps you'll be sweet enough for both of us.
Hello, Nayru. I think you may represent the tranquility of blue-haired woman over the coldness.
...Pleased to meet you, Nayru. Was it our blue hair that inspired greeting me specifically? You're much more personable...
It's a pleasure, Nayru. It's good to see another blue-haired woman on Earth...and you seem to bring the kindness I lack.
What are you talking abo--o-oh. Oh. Now I see what it does...perhaps I should grow my hair out like yours.
I think you're overreac--mm! I--I see. That's indeed...appropriate for a stripping game. You squirmed in such a cute way...
Are you feeling alright, Nay--mm. I see now...and I see that you're a beautiful woman.
It's just a song--oh. Oh...Nayru, I'm never this forward, but the way your hair flowed as you played your harp...was something else.
W-what is that? Like a deformed decoy...I won't doubt your magic again.
...Your music really is magical. Making a decoy could actually be very useful for a pilot.
...A magical song indeed. It'd be nice to have a silent decoy of myself for Jura to bother.
Is that...some magical doll of yourself? Like a soulless husk of a woman...
Piloting is thrilling...especially with a man. I've sat right up against Hibiki in my Vandread--wait, why'd I say that?
I...don't like tight spaces, but I feel safe in my Dread. Safe enough to masturba--w-what am I saying?
...So the song's effect is that you reveal secrets? I'd never say how I've masturbated to the thought of men's--mm!
I flew a long way here, after all. I'm curious what men's seed tastes like--d-did I just say that out loud?
Don't bother, "Veran." I'm not interested in prostrating myself before some strange shadow.
Do you expect me to kneel at your feet, "Veran"? Displays of power don't impress me--I've seen plenty from the Mejarian empire.
You must think you have some authority over me, "Veran." There a few women I answer to, and you're not one of them.
Flattery? I'm a pirate, "Veran." I don't kneel before the first woman to claim authority.
...Pirates must think alike. The Magno Family operates out of Mejare's asteroid belt...I imagine Earth's government can't reach Roanapur, either.
...Is Roanapur hidden from the reach of the authorities, Revy? It would make sense for a pirate to live there...we hide in Mejare's asteroids.
...I have no intention of visiting crime dens, Revy. But if you work in "Roanapur," it must be hidden away--our HQ is in Mejare's orbit on the same principle.
...I'm not looking to fight here, Revy, nor to cut into your business in Roanapur. We live on outskirts known for crime, as well--Mejare's orbiting debris.
My suit? ...So, men enjoy seeing the female form, too. For an Earth woman, you have a low opinion of them...
...Hm. If I regard men as beasts, you seem to think of them as little more than perverts. I thought Earth women liked them...
...Have men wronged you in the past, Revy? You're much more cynical about them than I expected of the women here...
...So even after centuries of contact, men lust after women's bodies, and women assume them perverts. Unless that's just you...
I am not interested in throwing away my humanity. And I don't think you are, either--just in scaring women into leaving you alone.
...Is that really what you want? You still have enough humanity to come here...strip naked...and ask us questions.
...No sane woman could ever take that much pleasure in killing. But pretending to is certainly a good defense mechanism.
...Some of my pilots do try to act sadistic. But we can tell it's a front...and in time, they admit their vulnerability.
...Sei, are you saying Earth women can get pregnant by accident? Men are more trouble than they're worth...
Why would you want to stop pregnancy? On Mejare, getting pregnant is a conscious, informed decision.
...Sei...with a man, then, you can sometimes unintentionally get pregnant? Just another reason to avoid them...
...If I'm interpreting this correctly, Sei, then Earth women can have accidental pregnancies. ...Unthinkable on Mejare.
...Twilight, you asked earlier about this. I use it to map out flight patterns and keep records on our pilots' performance.
...You commented on my tablet earlier, Twilight? At the moment, I'm comparing our pilots' target elimination rates...
...Twilight, you wanted to know about my tablet. It's just a personal data tool...I make sure the squadron is being efficient.
...This is the tablet you wanted to see earlier, Twilight. I'm analyzing my team's shot accuracy and fuel usage rates.
..."Condoms"? What are those? Something that controls birth?
...What's a condom? Why are you all hushed up about it?
...No, I don't know. You could be more considerate of a woman who isn't from Earth and doesn't know what condoms are.
...What is it about sex with men that makes Earth women get all quiet? And what's a condom?
...I'm not sure what you mean, Nayru, but holding onto the past is a horrible way to live. What's lost is lost.
That's a strange mindset, Nayru...never letting go of anything. I tried that, and it made me miserable.
I think it may be better to not hold onto false hope, Nayru. Whatever powers you have, losing things helps you grow.
Are you saying you possess some sort of power, Nayru? That sounds dangerous...never having to let anything go.
You shouldn't be so quick to judge others, Raven, but then I suppose my stoicism didn't do me any favors.
Perhaps it's my own fault for being unfriendly, Raven. But it's not in my nature to back down.
It's alright, Raven. I know I don't exude much approachability...nor do I mean to.
It takes a strong woman to admit she was wrong, Raven. Besides...I acted just as callously. Just my job spilling over...
...What are you implying, Ochako? I was not the product of some cynical experiment like these Quirk Marriages.
Are you implying I was bred, Ochako? I don't know what "Quirk Marriages" are, but Mejarians are not eugenicists.
My parents loved me, Ochako. I was not the product of a "Quirk Marriage," or whatever you call eugenics on Earth...
..."Quirk Marriages"? My parents were together by love, not eugenics, Ochako. Don't you dare imply otherwise.
These "Quirk Marriages" sound exactly like the cruel conduct I expect from Earth. And I resent the notion that women can't fall in love...
Typical of Earth to reduce children to something so cynical...I assure you, Ochako, women can be together without a "Quirk Marriage."
I should've known Earth would conduct cruel experiments and call them "Quirk Marriages." Love between two women can run deeper than that...
At least you see the cruelty in Earth's methods, Ochako. Still, you seem convinced women can't fall in love without it being a "Quirk Marriage."
I've learned to respect some men, Elizabeth. As for injustices...well, the first man I ever saw was a dead one.
Mejare's government has hurt me more than a man ever did, Elizabeth. Actually, the first man I ever saw in person was a corpse.
Elizabeth, I have a...complicated relationship with men. It wasn't until I joined the pirates that I saw one...a dead one.
I've fought plenty of men, Elizabeth, but the same is true of women. The first man I ever saw in person was a dead soldier.
Is that so? I think you've been interested in me this entire time, Sei...I have more deniability.
You can try to turn this around on me, Sei, but I haven't been drinking and flirting all night.
"In a few drinks" shouldn't take much time at all, Sei. That's why I don't like you very much.
You're not interested in me after I show the slightest interest back? And you accuse me of playing hard-to-get...
..."Murders." Do you have something more to share about this place, Ini?
...Are "murders" the only reason you know about that temple, Ini?
...You recommended me the site of a recent murder. I shouldn't bother speaking to you.
...Murders must have been quite devastating to your community. But apparently not to you.
...Tomoko. You said something about "boys" on this planet? Why should I be concerned with male children?
...Tomoko. What did you mean by suggesting I go see "boys"? Do women mate with men much younger than them?
...What did you say earlier, Tomoko? "Boys" are male children, correct? That seems...inappropriate.
...I meant landmarks to see on Earth, Tomoko, not men. ...Actually, aren't "boys" child men? Are women not meant to date men their age?
...Tomoko, what did you recommend earlier? "Anuh-may"? I used to watch animation when I was a girl, if that's what you mean... Mejarian superwomen.
"Anuh-may," you said, Tomoko? If that's Earth slang for animation, I watched cartoons as a girl. Mostly starring brave fighter pilots...
...Did you mean to say "animation" earlier, Tomoko? That reminds me of the cartoons I watched as a girl... brave forces of women foiling men's plans.
...Tomoko, what is that "anuh-may" you told me about? Mejare has animation for young girls, if you meant that...heroic women in starfighters.
...I agree with what you said earlier, Tomoko. This game will prove interesting--but I meant sights outside of nudity. Landmarks and such.
Do you know of any Earth landmarks, Tomoko? I played this game to see the "other" sights you brought up.
...I'm aware of the "sights" strip poker can offer, Tomoko. I came here for a reason...men's tubes and such. But what about the planet itself?
...This is your homeworld, Tomoko. Surely there's more to it than the nude bodies of its people--which I'm already experiencing.
...I don't have any idea what music is played on Earth today. I know classical music was composed here...and I enjoy that.
...Suggestions? Earthlings composed many of the classical tracks that survive even on Mejare. I've never cared for much else...
Classical music is best for both relaxing and working. I know Earthlings composed much of it, as well...play that.
...You wouldn't happen to know the song "Somedays," would you? Never mind...play classical music. That's been Earth's legacy for centuries.
...You're much too trusting. My one hope is that if men need to be seduced, then perhaps they're not too eager to "stuff" us.
Hmm...it's surprising that men even need to be seduced. Up until now, I had thought they constantly pursued Earth women...
...The one silver lining of this is that you need to seduce men. If they wanted to seduce us, it would cement how painful those rods must be.
...Just thinking of one of those pulsing tubes is unnerving. But if you're asking for seduction advice, then at least men aren't quick to use them.
...It's best to not get attached to any particular food source as a pirate. But I do enjoy fish...and anything is better than the pills men eat.
...Fish is a good lean source of protein when it's available to us. Men on Tarak get all their nutrition from pills... even I'm not that practical.
I enjoy eating fish when we manage to steal some. I've enjoyed all food more after trying those tasteless pellets Tarakkians eat.
It's funny you ask that. Tarakkians eat tasteless nutrition pellets, so our prisoners have never eaten better in their lives. As for me...fish.
...Killing comes with the territory of being a pirate. But being a pilot removes some discomfort over it--you can't see the victim's face.
...Yes, I've killed people. That's easier to stomach in a Dread's cockpit than facing someone down with a laser ring.
...There are many girls in the Magno Family who are quicker to pull the trigger when piloting than on a ground raid. I'm sure you can imagine why.
...I don't enjoy killing people, but yes. Part of leading my squadron is convincing girls to get over it--which is easier in a cockpit than on the ground.
...Piloting dehumanizes the enemy, which makes it easier to kill them. Of course, we already thought men weren't human.
...Any combat crew member gets put on our next raid mission to learn to get over killing someone. Piloting makes it easier...I had to shoot a foot soldier.
...One of our hardest jobs is convincing new crew members to kill a person--"a person" meaning another woman. But it's easier in a Dread.
...One cannot serve a combat role on a pirate crew without killing. There's an emotional disconnect to it when piloting a Dread.
...Classical music keeps me focused. It's strange to think how men from Earth may have composed much of it...
...Classical music is best for both work and relaxation. I knew Earthlings composed it, but imagine my surprise when I learned it was Earth men...
...I prefer classical music, but somehow I doubt you do. Then again, Earth men wrote much of it, and I thought them beasts...
...Classical music was one of the few pieces of Earth Mejare's colonists brought with them. Of course, they didn't mention how men wrote much of it...
...Yes, Tomoko? You're staring at me.
...If you have something to say to me, Tomoko, say it.
...I hope you don't think you're disguising your intentions, Tomoko. What do you want to say to me?
...Do you have a question, Tomoko? You've been watching me for some time...while avoiding eye contact.
...What is it, Tomoko? You look concerned about me.
...Is something wrong, Tomoko? You've been staring at me, and then you looked away.
...Tomoko, I don't appreciate being stared at. Either speak up, or stop avoiding eye contact.
...Yes, Tomoko? You keep avoiding my sight.
...Tomoko, why are you avoiding my line of sight and grinning to yourself?
...Are you plotting some kind of prank, Tomoko? You're looking at me and smiling.
...If you have something to funny to share with me, Tomoko, I would prefer that over trying to sneak glances at me.
...Is there something funny about me, Tomoko? I don't appreciate your constant glances.
...Tomoko, why are you avoiding my line of sight and grinning to yourself?
...Are you plotting some kind of prank, Tomoko? You're looking at me and smiling.
...If you have something to funny to share with me, Tomoko, I would prefer that over trying to sneak glances at me.
...Is there something funny about me, Tomoko? I don't appreciate your constant glances.
...Yes, Mejare is made up of all women, Tomoko. But I'm not sure what "lesbos" means.
...I understand if it's a shock for an Earth girl to picture life without men. Apparently "lesbos" is your word for it?
"Les"..."bos"? I'm not familiar with that term, Tomoko...but yes, you're correct. No men live on my homeworld.
Don't think that men aren't close by, Tomoko...we are at war with a planet of them. Does "lesbos" mean women isolated from men?
...A "prejudice against introverts." How did you come to this conclusion? No one is obligated to pay you any attention.
...Introverted women tend not to stand up for themselves, Tomoko. That may be why you feel discriminated against.
...Is that so, Tomoko? Mejare has a prejudice against pirates--and in either case, the only solution is for women to stand up for themselves.
...I assume you've experienced this prejudice firsthand. I understand being reserved, but there is a time and a place to act.
..."Otoh-may"? That may be Earth slang I'm not familiar with... and what's this about virtual male children?
..."Virtual boys"? I might require some more context for what an "otoh-may" game is...
...Is "otoh-may" a variety of card game? We do have virtual versions of poker and such, but..."virtual boys"?
...Tomoko, stop throwing Earth words around like "otoh-may" and "boys" without explaining them. I can't make sense of this.
...I appreciate the compliment, Tomoko, but what would you have me do? Intentionally throw hands?
Thank you, Tomoko...I suppose. Poker is meant to be a game of intelligence, you know.
...Thank you. I always appreciate it when my crewmates say I'm smart...are you telling me to sabotage myself for fairness?
...I can't change how intelligent how I am, Tomoko. But I appreciate you saying so...it's more experience than anything.
...Your room, Tomoko? Surely you know more about your own homeworld. What about the town you live in?
...You really don't leave your house at all, Tomoko? Where on this planet is your home located?
You left your house to come here, Tomoko. You must know about other places--what about your hometown?
...I'm sure your room is nice, Tomoko, but even you felt compelled to leave it for this place. What region do you live in, exactly?
...Mejare is quite familiar with humiliation, Tomoko. Women do not stop judging each others' hip measurements once they leave Earth.
...Mejarians are very much still human women, Tomoko. Humiliation is a part of our culture--such as for being out of shape or poor.
...Mejare's women brought humiliation with them from Earth, Tomoko. Ask any girl whose bust fails to measure up.
...Humiliation is universal among humans, Tomoko. A Mejarian girl can still be shamed for her parents' mistakes...or a scrawny build.
...Space travel did not eliminate embarrassment in our culture, Tomoko. Though with how Earthlings dress, I can see how you'd think that...
...Don't treat me like an alien, Tomoko. Mejarians feel embarrassment, despite our preference for tight clothing.
...Are you implying a Mejarian woman would not understand embarrassment? There is more to embarrassment than revealing clothing.
...My suit may put my body on display, Tomoko, but I still understand embarrassment. Earth doesn't have a monopoly on emotions.
...You two know each other? You're wearing the same uniform...but Monika actually looks like an adult.
...Monika, don't bring your younger classmates to strip poker games. This is for adults.
The same uniform? ...Don't tell me this is some kind of perverted school field trip. Natsuki doesn't even look old enough.
I was about to comment on the look in your eyes, Monika, but I'm more worried about your underage schoolmate.
Seduction would be the proper word for your influence on Rin. Schoolgirls should have more regard for life.
..."Seduce" means to "lead astray." There's no better way to describe your effect on a young schoolgirl.
Seducing schoolgirls...at least I'm an adult. You should be guiding her, not trying to sleep with her.
...You can't be serious. You're seducing Rin? A schoolgirl doesn't need to participate in--orgies!
I'm not sure which schoolgirl fits in less here...the one who doesn't act mature, or the one who doesn't look mature.
