Just what this table needed--two classmates that either look like children or act like children.
I'm not sure who tell to leave first--Natsuki, who looks underage, or Sayori, who acts underage.
I was afraid I'd get stuck with Earth schoolgirls in over their heads. Natsuki, you don't look like an adult. Sayori, you seem far too naive for this game.
...Being eighteen does not suddenly make you mature, Natsuki. Besides, you look malnourished...
...For a supposed eighteen-year-old girl, Natsuki, you look underdeveloped. Have you been eating enough food?
Eighteen years old...you don't look it, Natsuki. Even ignoring height, you come off as malnourished.
...Natsuki, you're being defensive. You may be eighteen, but you clearly need to put on some weight.
I think you're a bit mistaken, Daria. We're descendants from Earth people who colonized other planets.
Daria, how do you think we got to Mejare? Our ancestors were people from Earth who colonized it.
Jura and I are not inhuman, Daria. The first women on Mejare were settlers from Earth.
Daria, do you think we simply sprung up on Mejare? We're descendants of its original Earth colonists.
You think we haven't seen each other nude? The ship has one shower and one spa.
Nude women aren't exactly startling to Mejarians...especially crewmates with communal showers.
I wish I wasn't so comfortable seeing Jura nude.
We're not friends. We're colleagues...and pirates don't get private showers.
Show up to flight practice on time, and I couldn't care less what you tell her.
Jura is a lot more eager to be here. I would've given her permission if she cared to ask for it.
By all means, Jura, you don't need my go-ahead. Keep Daria busy while I work.
This is a perfect arrangement. You answer Daria's questions about Mejare, and I get some scheduling done.
Come home with--tch. You should try disavowing your military and working for us. That way you'd help women.
Nothing will make me come home with you, Sei. Your technological experience would make you a good asset for us, however.
Tch. Perhaps I'd warm up to you if you cast off your loyalties...our crew could use a tech-proficient medic.
...You should come home with us. We need more medical staff, and you could work with a clean conscience.
Great...they swarmed us with men. Happy now, Jura?
More men than I bargained for...wasn't hoping for more than one, out of sheer curiosity.
All men? I'm not afraid of you. Keep your sword ready, Jura.
The three men on our ship are enough for me. And they don't try to get us naked, or strip themselves.
Well, Jura, plenty of men's tubes to go around. Ready to collect that seed you want so badly?
I would've liked to meet an Earth woman here. But no, of course not.
Earth women would have been alien enough. You didn't arrange this on purpose, did you, Jura?
Something bothering you, Jura? Not what you had hoped for?
Oh, good, now we're both annoyed.
Perfect. Now neither of us want to be here.
I really didn't want to see a man's tube anyway...not in a seedy place like this.
I'd call this your comeuppance, but we still need to see this game through.
Men would have been a distraction anyway. This way we can focus on learning about Earth from the women here.
Exactly what you deserve, dragging me here. Have fun.
Just one man...well, Jura, I hope you're happy with him.
Watch yourself. Jura is looking for a man to have a child with...
You'd best take care. Jura's going to be needling you with questions all game.
A man? I'll try not to ask too many questions...Jura will do that for me.
A man? Well, Jura, looks like we'll be getting the anatomy lesson you wanted.
This one man had better be impressive enough for us to come all the way here.
Try to ignore Jura, the taller woman. She can be a little...forward.
Well, Jura, this is what you wanted. Satisfied with the crowd?
Meia Gisborn. The blonde is Jura Basil Elden.
Meia Gisborn, age twenty. I'll let my crewmate here do the talking.
Meia Gisborn. The taller woman is Jura, my crewmate...this was her idea.
Pleased to meet you. Jura here will be happy to speak for both of us.
Meia Gisborn. The taller woman is my crewmate, and she's a lot more excited to be here, if you couldn't tell.
Thanks for the compliment, but I didn't pick it out. Squadron leaders all wear this.
Yours looks a little sleeker, honestly.
Expand your wardrobe? Bodysuits are as sensible as it gets.
...I'm sorry, what? Do I know you?
Gorgeous? That's...a new one.
...Blue hair is nothing special.
"Corps"? ...I'm a pirate...from planet Mejare.
...Sei, was it? I wouldn't call my armor "modern." We use whatever we can pilfer from Mejarian outposts.
...I wouldn't call my armor "modern"...but I wouldn't call yours "comfortable."
...You're Sei, correct? We do both have blue hair. Can't Earth women's hair be naturally blue?
Fun? ...I hope so. Jura wouldn't stop pestering me about this...
...I am Jura's superior officer, not her girlfriend. Do not misinterpret my coming here as more than security.
I am not Jura's girlfriend. Earth is a known hostile planet, and so I accompanied her here as a safety measure.
It would be foolish for Jura to have come here alone--she is an outlaw, and Earth is hostile territory. As Dread team leader, she is my reponsibility.
This was Jura's idea--I am only here to protect her. As long as her romantic life does not compromise squadron dynamics, it is none of my business.
Jura is my second-ranking pilot--I came here with her for her own safety. Her lax approach to fidelity is beside the point.
...That's correct, N. I understand if you, as a man, might feel wary.
...Men still exist near my homeworld, N...on our sister planet, Tarak. But I have no intention of attacking you.
...N, was it? That's correct...but you have nothing to fear. We have enough male prisoners on our ship as it is.
...Yes, I imagine a man would find that interesting...or concerning. But I mean you no harm.
What the--an alien, here? No question. ...Meia Gisborn, home planet Mejare. Junior officer aboard the Nirvana.
F-floating? Are you addressing me? ...Meia Gisborn, of Mejare. Dread team leader...not that we've explored the "Vega" system.
Ah--! ...Meia Gisborn, junior officer and Dread team leader for the Magno Family. To meet a girl so obviously alien--!
V-Vega system? Just how much alien contact has Earth had? ...Meia Gisborn, junior officer. Mejarian...
...A strange aura? I'll be honest...you look rather plain.
Are you sure it's not my bodysuit, Elizabeth? You're dressed more conservatively...
Is that so? ...Elizabeth, right? You seem normal to me...I've never heard someone say I have an aura.
...As far as I know, Mejarian bodysuits are rather risque on Earth. Since you're much more covered, maybe that's my aura.
Space woman? Mejarians are no more residents of space than Earthlings are.
Earth and Mejare are both planets. What exactly makes me a space woman and you not?
Why exactly is a Mejarian a space woman and an Earth one isn't? ...Never mind. You don't seem very sharp.
I'm a space woman, and Earthlings aren't? ...Well, this is the perfect game to treat me as an exhibit.
...To me, Ini, you're the space woman. It's a rather subjective point to make.
No, thank you, Jin. I have to stay fit...and I wouldn't take food from a man.
I appreciate the show of peace, Jin, but I'm not about to accept food from a man.
I have a bad relationship with men...and an even worse one with Earth. Please understand if I don't want to accept food, Jin.
...Thank you, Jin, but I have several reasons to not take food from a man, particularly an Earth one.
I have to watch my weight to pilot, Jin. Besides...taking food from a man is a little too comfortable.
Natsuki...that's you, right? Young schoolgirls shouldn't be here.
What a diminuitive girl...I assume you snuck in here. You should leave.
The sign out front says "Adults Only," Natsuki. Granted, I don't know how Earth defines adults...
...I don't feel comfortable playing a stripping game with children, Earthling or not.
...Listen, Natsuki, you should stay in school. Don't go sneaking off to bars when you're still a child.
...I'm sorry, Sayaka, but I have no clue what you're talking about in the slightest.
...Are you making fun of me by saying nonsense, Sayaka? That's not a friendly welcome to this planet.
....Whatever you're saying, Sayaka, it's beyond my knowledge--unless you're just taunting me.
No, Sayaka, I haven't seen anything like that...I have no idea what you're even talking about.
...I didn't think a girl would bombard me with questions as soon as I got here. Or that I'd have no clue what she was asking.
...My Oma was the woman who donated her eggs to splice with my Fama's. My Fama carried me.
Mejare is all women, Misato. Omas donate eggs, and they're spliced with those of the Fama, who carries the baby.
An Oma is an egg donator, versus the egg acceptor of the Fama. I understand that two women being parents is strange to Earthlings.
Both my parents were women, like everyone on Mejare. The Oma donates the egg...and the Fama carries the child.
I'm afraid books aren't the typical thing we're able to steal. There might be a few left over in the older sections of the Nirvana...
...Hm. Perhaps I should check the older sections of the ship...that's where Duero found his anatomy book.
I read a lot of books as a girl...but the ship doesn't have many now. Perhaps there's some in the old storage sections...
I know there's parts of the Nirvana from the original colonists' ships. Perhaps there's books there I could read...
If you don't mind giving them away, I'd love some books. Failing that...the Nirvana's older sections might have a few from the old colonists.
...I see. Well, I appreciate the compliments--and take it from a Mejarian that you're very beautiful.
So Earth culture isn't as rigidly man-focused as I thought. Well, Misato, you're very attractive yourself.
I can see why you're popular with men, Misato. If you were more willing to flirt with women, you'd be popular on Mejare, too.
Perhaps Earth isn't so foreign after all, then. Whether that was flirting or just compliments, you're quite beautiful yourself.
...For a man, you're very polite, Steve.
Didn't expect this kind of politeness from a man. Maybe there's depths to your sex yet.
I was expecting a more rugged personality from a soldier, and a male one at that.
I can't believe you talked me into this, Jura.
Happy I'm here, Jura? You're getting next patrol duty for this.
How did I let you convince me to come here?
I'm not mad at you for talking me into coming here, Jura...I'm mad at myself for being unable to talk you out of it.
Is that a style for Earth men, or just part of your profession?
Didn't think men could be that interested in fashion.
I see. And you probably acquired it legally, unlike me.
I see. Everything I know about Earth, I know from old books on the ship...and that Earthlings want us dead.
I'll admit my experience with Earth has been limited to fending off its attacks.
Mejare isn't shy about sex, so I'm just inferring.
I see. One look at Jura or Barnette would put you in a coma, then.
Bodysuits are pretty typical on Mejare, yes...both my pilots and the soldiers we face wear them. I don't know how men feel about that.
I wear it for practical reasons, but yes, it's common to show your figure on Mejare. All the more reason to exercise regularly.
Maybe that's how the fashion trends on Mejare got started, but I couldn't care less what men think of my body.
And men are constantly judging you on Earth, then? Mejarians are equally guilty...but we certainly don't feel as much shame.
...Thank you, Nagisa.
...They must really value politeness where you come from, Nagisa.
...I suppose they're only small for Mejare's standards. But Mejare's standards are my standards.
Whatever you just called me, Marinette, I've heard worse from Mejarian soldiers...and in the common language, too.
I thought superheroes were supposed to be brave, but apparently you don't have the nerve to insult me in a language I understand, Marinette.
You know what I do respect, Marinette? A woman who can look me in the eye and use insults I understand.
Feel free to continue insulting me in the common language, Marinette. Or you could just be a coward.
...Perhaps we're thinking of different technology. I'll make a note of this, but learning about Earth is my mission here.
...This soul-fusion business is too complex for a reconnaissance mission. I'm no engineer...maybe Parfet can make sense of it.
I'm glad you're willing to share all this, Dust, but it's a lot to take in at a strip game...I'll make a note of it for our engineers.
...I can only parse so much about this soul technology. I'm a pilot, not an engineer...we can talk later.
"The City of the Sun"...if one can learn about magic, I should bring the entire crew there. It would be a useful asset.
...Is there a potential to learn magic itself from a city with a "rich history" of it? We need every advantage we can get.
...A city with a "history of magic"...perhaps the crew could all learn to use it. We'll organize a raid team.
...Magic seems like a useful resource. It is a pirate's way to claim such for herself...I should bring the crew to "San Miguel."
...I'm totally lost. She said something about controlled birth?
I'm lost. Earth women control birth? I think Tarak does something like that...
I'm lost here. What exactly is "birth control"? How would you control birth?
Protection? I have armor, but...you'd wear that during sex?
Protection? What the hell do men try to do to you?
Protection? You need protection during sex? I thought she was talking about birth.
A snowy temple? That sounds quite nice, actually...it hardly snows on Mejare at all.
Hakazura Temple, Ini? Hm...Mejare is actually very climate-controlled, so I've barely seen snow. I might go see it.
You said it snows at that temple, Ini? I've hardly seen snow in person, with how temperate Mejare is...
Haka...zura Temple. Mejare has little snow, so that sounds like a treat to see...thank you, Ini.
...I thought you might like sightseeing, Jura. This Earth is in much better condition than the mechanized one we know.
...I hoped you'd appreciate vacation destinations, Jura. Flying is something we both enjoy--and I can call it reconnaissance.
...I figured we'd both find a flying tour of Earth more agreeable than I would strip poker, Jura. Earth's ecosystem still seems healthy in this world.
I was happy to see that this Earth is not covered in gears like ours, Jura. Deserts, icecaps...we can tour the planet from orbit.
What? Of course I can hear you, Kizuna. Anyway, can you tell me more about this Japan region?
You're speaking at perfect volume, Kizuna--I can hear you. Do you have more information about "Japan"?
"Japan"...for some reason, I recall hearing that many of the women here are from that place. Can you tell me more, Kizuna?
...Yes, I can hear you, Kizuna. This isn't the first I've heard of this "Japan"...could you tell me more about it?
...I'm sure that offer was indeed generous, L'Arachel, but perhaps you could explain what Rausten is like.
I'm not sure what it takes to "win your favor," L'Arachel. What is the Rausten region like?
...I was planning to visit any suggestions alone, L'Arachel. If you would like to guide me, then elaborate on this "Rausten."
"Rausten"...I've never heard of an Earth region called that. I wasn't planning to bring a tour guide, but perhaps that'd be best.
...I don't understand. Why wouldn't you be able to feel your partner's skin?
Why are you getting all defensive? I really don't know what this "birth control" is.
Proper measures? What exactly are you worried about?
You're certainly not from the Earth I know. It's a wasteland, with the population living in giant gears. No ladybugs, I'm sure.
I've read about ladybugs. Seems like they were common on Earth...but now it's a wasteland.
Taking inspiration from ladybugs...you must be from a different Earth than the one I know, which is nearly devoid of life altogether.
Where I'm from, Earth's moon crashed into it long ago, and there's almost nothing left. Ladybugs included.
Well, at least you're honest. "Bitch" is tame compared to what I expected.
That's it? Forget soldiers...I heard worse on the streets.
...I can't stay mad at you, Marinette. You're a sweet girl for thinking "bitch" is harrowing.
...You're acting all shy about "bitch"? You've got a heart of gold.
Of course women can do what they want with their bodies. That doesn't mean I have to respect them for it.
Of course women can groom as they please. I just find it distasteful.
Pubic hair just strikes me as something a man would have, Marinette. Not for me.
...You said a pharmacist splices eggs for you, Miko? We use...well, geneticists.
It's not all that strange for women to splice eggs and have children, Miko. Well...using a pharmacist for that is strange.
I thought pharmacists handled drugs, Miko. We don't usually task them with splicing our eggs together.
Women on Mejare combine their eggs to have children, Miko, yes. But if you're using pharmacists for that...you must have it mastered.
Give it some thought--Dread controls are intuitive, even for fresh trainees. And being surrounded by women is quite comforting.
Think it over. We may be pirates, but the women support each other--you don't need men to feel fulfilled.
Perhaps you feel attached to men's presence. But a resourceful woman like you would be a valued member of our team.
I was a zero-experience trainee, as well, and I shot up through the ranks. Consider if you really need men's company.
...Wait. I remember reading that Earth used to be divided into smaller nations--is your "Land of Dragons" one of them, Mulan?
I think I understand now. The "Land of Dragons" is just one of Earth's factions, isn't it, Mulan?
Wait...I think I've misunderstood. Mejare is all one society, but Earth is carved up, isn't it, Mulan? Your "Land of Dragons" is just part of it.
...I just remembered something from school. Earth is divided into territories, isn't it, Mulan? One must be your "China."
Much of society is unnatural, Mulan. It's common on Mejare for young women to shave everything...
There's a lot more unnatural things societies do than shave pubic hair, Mulan. Mejarians shave for sleekness.
Why wear clothes when your nude body is natural? I think societies strive to go beyond that, Mulan...and so Mejare shaves.
I can't speak for all of Mejare, Mulan...but its young women prefer the sleek and smooth. I'm sure China does some things that are unnatural.
Do the women of Planet China wear makeup, Mulan? That's an unnatural effort for beauty, as well...not unlike Mejare's shaving.
To answer your question, Mulan, being shaved is actually very smooth...provided you're rigorous about it.
I understand your earlier concerns about stubble, Mulan, but Mejarians are very aggressive about shaving.
About what you said earlier, Mulan...the Mejarian ideal is a smooth, sleek figure. Like with suits, comfort is not the point.

..."Zombie slaves" sounds more like an experiment Earth would carry out on a colony. I suggest you fortify Falana against them.
...I am a pirate, Fidget. The Mejarian Empire does not take my advice on which planets to invade. Earth, however, is a known aggressor.
...If there's any human planet that would invade your homeworld, you're standing on it. Earth shows no mercy even to its colonists.
...So, there's warring factions on your homeworld? Maybe I've underappreciated Mejare's relative peace...
...I wasn't aware of that. My condolences...is Falana in the midst of civil war? At least Mejare's enemies are only abroad...
...I'm sorry to hear that. My homeworld has its social issues, but they haven't sparked complete civil war...
...I didn't realize Falana was under such harsh conflict. A meeting would be especially dangerous, then...and I thought Mejare was fractured.
A--veteran? ...I can't believe you can walk straight.
Then...I imagine there's videos of you taking one in the "backdoor." I'm surprised you're walking upright...
...I'd be more willing to believe you've fit those things up your rear if we'd been sitting this whole time.
...Knowing your career, I suppose there's video proof. And you still...have a full range of motion? You can squat properly?
...It's fine. Women tell me I look older than I am all the time. Usually referring to the look in my eyes...
...Some of our new recruits don't believe my real age, either. They say I stare through them like an old woman...
...I haven't felt like a young girl in some time. You're not the only woman to say that's reflected in my face.
...Rookie pilots tend to say I look old, too. There was a time when I didn't take good care of myself.
The--wrong hole? That sounds like a cruel prank, not a mistake--!
...The "wrong hole?" How can someone even mistake the two? That just sounds cruel...!
A-as in, a man put his tube up your--anus? There's no way that could happen by mistake--he was making you suffer as a joke!
W-what kind of "mistake" is that? A woman would have to be cruel to to do that on purpose--are men really so clumsy?
Jessie, this is embarrassing. You should be looking for a woman your age to settle down with.
...Shouldn't you be approaching women in your age range? It's embarrassing that I have to lecture you like this.
...I was hoping you'd be more mature than a desperate old woman skulking around youth hangouts, Jessie. Leave me alone.
...Is this how I'm going to act if I don't find a woman to marry? Surely there are dating functions for older women.
...No, I'm not. And so far, you've given me no better reason to share than my pilots have.
...Some women wear their hearts on their sleeves. There's value in that...but I try to remain professional.
...That's correct, Jessie. I share what is needed to do my job, and nothing more.
...As I've said, this is a hostile planet. I see no need to share more with you than I do with my crewmates.
...I still don't understand how they could misjudge the two. Are men's rods hard to control, even for them? Apparently they twitch...
Can't men control where their own tubes go? Or do they enter some sort of trance when they're aroused and can't see straight?
...I suppose men, being the industrious types, seek to fill the first hole they come across. Or are they that blinded by lust?
...As if I needed another reason to avoid sex with men. If he can't tell my vagina from my anus, I don't want him near either of them.
..."Preparations." I can only imagine... lubrication? Stretching it? I'm still getting accustomed to penetration where it's intended.
...Having to prepare over time just makes it sound worse. I imagine you...gradually stretch our your rear? A bit of his rod at a time...
...You "prepare" for anal penetration. Well, then...I suppose I've never done those stretches.
"Preparations"... hmph. I value stretches as much as exercise, but I've never considered stretching my butt.
Our fashion choices are our own, Dust. I choose to wear the armor and flightsuit befitting my rank as squadron leader.
Pirates don't care much for uniforms, Dust. As a junior officer, I choose to wear my flightsuit to set an example. Nothing more.
...Perhaps men generally dress the same, Dust, but women prefer unique outfits--even as pirates. I value practicality over looks.
I try not to concern myself with form over function, Dust, so I wear our standard flight uniforms. Jura is the opposite.
...I see. I hope that peace can come to my homeworld soon, as well. Mejare and Tarak have a common enemy now.
Is that so? Entire societies go through some reflection after a war...the men and women of Tarak and Mejare might reconcile soon.
...That's good to hear, Dust. Mejare and Tarak have been at war for a century, but perhaps our conflict with Earth will resolve that...
...I can only hope Mejare's war with Tarak will end soon, and their men and women can try to understand each other again.
...At least this bar is clean and comfortable. I don't care for bright lights...or constant chatter.
I can appreciate this bar, at least. I wasn't expecting a dim alcove for us to play in...
At least this place had the courtesy to seclude us. I couldn't get work done in a crowded casino hall, much less strip naked...
...I have to admit, the space they gave us to play in is perfect. Secluded...dim...quiet.
..."The Inventory." What are they stockpiling here to give a bar that name?
Perhaps Jura and I should raid this place before we leave...calling it "the Inventory" is tempting.
Hmm...I was actually worried they'd make us strip in a large hall with tables everywhere. This is much better...
...What kind of joke is this? Am I the only one not named Alice?
...Three women named Alice? This is some kind of practical joke.
...For convenience's sake, maybe you all ought to call me Alice, too.
...Three women named Alice...and me. I'm not dignifying this.
...How did I end up in a three-way confrontation? ~player~, don't tell me you know these women.
Ten minutes on Earth and I'm in the midst of an impending fistfight. At least they're all in shape.
...Are you sure you want to taunt these women, Juri? It seems they're ready to gang up on you...not that I know why.
Are you three...familiar with each other? If a fight's about to start, I'm leaving.
...Well, I got the one table where violence could break out at any moment. You're all attractive, at least.
How'd I get stuck with classmates on some perverted date? ...One's even a man.
...I fly all the way to Earth, and I end up on a table with three awkward classmates. Including a man.
...Why did you two bring your male classmate along? Why are you even all here together?
...Classmates? With a man among them...this is already a waste.
...Why am I on a table full of schoolchildren? I already babysit my pilots...
...Schoolchildren? You all know each other? Even ~player~? ...This isn't what I expected from a visit to Earth.
What's this all about? What kind of strip bar lets in groups of schoolgirls? This is obscene!
...Why am I with four classmates? Listen...you should stay in school. These sorts of places are for women who've lost their way.
I'm the...only woman?
All men...don't try anything funny.
All men, no women...wouldn't be surprised if Jura was pulling a prank here.
I was really expecting a few women here...
All men...? This is more than I bargained for.
No men playing? I thought Earth was home to plenty of them.
All women...well, it's familiar.
Oh, I see. They must keep these games single-sex.
I really thought I'd see a man here...
A man is playing...this ought to be interesting.
A man...I should be taking notes on this.
A man...this raises the stakes.
Interesting. I only know a few men...keep in mind that I'm armed.
A man? ...At least there's just one of you.
Meia Gisborn. Pleased to meet you.
You're all from Earth, correct? ...I wouldn't expect a welcome for interplanetary travelers here.
Earthlings...you're all looking healthy. Fresh organs, no doubt.
Meia Gisborn, Dread pilot commander of the Nirvana.
Meia Gisborn, home planet Mejare.
Earthlings...the crew will think I'm sororitizing with the enemy.
Meia Gisborn, age twenty.
Meia Gisborn. I come from Mejare, one of this planet's colonies...a strange one, as I understand.
I didn't think things would take this long...
I won't be getting much sleep tonight, with how long this game has been going...
This game has been going long...pirates don't get days off.
I can't believe Jura talked me into this.
Jura's getting next patrol duty for talking me into this.
How did I let Jura convince me to come here?
I've got to pull myself together...
Can't make any more mistakes...
This is good...and I need good.
...Maybe I don't need this...
...I suppose...this planet is trustworthy.
...Perhaps I...should show more trust.
...I can't make a scene of taking this off...
Perhaps I can disarm... I'm no stranger to using my fists anyway.
It's a bit breezy in here...the Nirvana's gym is heated.
I could use more sets of this underwear...I'd have to steal them from a soldier.
I thought we all had to wear the same amount of clothing...a careless mistake.
I hope I'm looking toned. Exercise is something every woman can do to improve her beauty...

state.text: There's no one left for you to hide behind. Now you deal with me.

case.state: And then there were two. Perhaps now I'll finally lose.
Now it's just you and me. I hope you're OK with that.
One-on-one...maybe I'd be excited if you had made me lose at some point.
One-on-one...and considering the challenge you've put up so far, this is probably over with.
You haven't been much challenge so far. Is that trend going to continue?
And then there were two. Let's get this over with.
Just you and me. I'm not going to go easy on you, nor should you want me to.
One-on-one...and since you cost me my eyepiece, I'm not feeling generous.
One-on-one...I want my eyepiece back, so I'll make this quick.
And then there were two. You certainly haven't given me a reason to worry.
And then there were two. You've made me lose twice, so maybe you have a shot.
Just you and me. I'm not going to go easy on you...it would be disrespectful.
One-on-one...perhaps you'll finally manage to make me show some skin.
One-on-one...you're not about to back down from a challenge, right?
And then there were two. I certainly haven't felt the "stripping" part of this game yet.
And then there were two. I'm already down to my underwear, so don't give up.
Just you and me...just the way I like it.
One-on-one...perhaps you'll actually get me naked.
One-on-one...I'm not exactly proud of my breasts, so I don't plan on having to show them.
And then there were two. Can you handle this game one-on-one?
And then there were two. Watch yourself...I still have a line of defense.
Just you and me...you've certainly pushed me beyond my comfort zone.
One-on-one...you've seen my breasts, but I still have secrets to spare.
One-on-one...don't let my nudity distract you.
And then there were two. Feeling capable of finishing me off?
Let's see...normally I take my eyepiece first.
...Well, I am a pilot. I should improve my depth perception.
Damn. I've had a lot more practice putting this costume on...
It seems my elaborate costume has to come apart now. Don't expect me to obsess over hearts anymore.
Hmm...I'd rather keep the quiver for now.
The quiver is the next logical choice...but I'm always most comfortable when I'm armed.
I haven't put much thought into the strip order for this costume. Archery is proving an excellent workout, though.
Teasing is romantic, isn't it? I should remove something else small...
Tch. I can't say I enjoy losing...but this is a day of love, not competition.
Just when I was getting to a good part, too...this is a book on old Earth flying machines, by the way.
I suppose I should ask if anyone here is in need of love, keeping with the theme...
Damn...magic arrows to improve luck might be more useful at this point.
If you were afraid I'd tease you forever, you should know that's not in the spirit of the holiday.
Well, my arrows can't actually inspire love in others...but maybe my breasts can.
Far be it from a Mejarian to complain about nudity, especially on Valentine's Day. And with the way I'm dressed already...
This lingerie pushes my breasts together...I hope that hasn't given you a false impression of their size.
I'm not one to delay the inevitable.
Damn. Well, in the spirit of the holiday, I'll be charitable...and remove everything.
And here I was hoping for a triumphant victory in full costume.
Was there a better move I could have made there? Oh, forget it...today's a day for romance.
...Don't worry about him, Jura. You shouldn't expect Earthlings to be considerate...especially male ones.
You and I both know men are far from subtle, Jura. And he's from Earth on top of that...two flavors of xenophobia.
What did you expect from an inhabitant of a planet that tries to harvest our organs? He's probably been taught to treat colonists as aliens.
Jura, this planet is the enemy. Earthlings have likely been raised to view us as such--it's foolish to expect otherwise.
...I'm well aware that no technological advantage is needed here, Rinkah.
It's true that even ancient-looking women can win here...poker requires no technology.
In combat, I might think little of your ancient technology. In poker...you have a chance.
Fiercely confident in your friends...a good trait in a woman. Our technology is superior, but in poker, that matters little.
...No, I don't. Jura is hoping that I'll meet a woman here...but that'll distract me from work.
...As Jura likes to claim, I'm married to the job. I don't want a girlfriend.
I'm too busy to have a girlfriend. Leading the squadron takes up all my time.
My entire day is full from scheduling and patrols...it's a miracle I'm here tonight. I can't make time for a relationship.
That's correct. Our commander, B.C., named it. Why?
...You seem rather distressed over the name. Take it up with our commander.
That's correct. Are you interested in its specs, or just the name? Our commander came up with it.
Yes...it's a fusion ship from male and female vessels. B.C., our commander, named it...I offered "the Sonnet."
Isn't my normal outfit provocative, Jessie? Even if it doesn't show any skin.
You say that like my normal outfit is a sundress. And Valentine's Day is a celebration of romance--which Mejare values very much.
If anything, there's more to this Cupid costume than I usually have. Mejare sends its romantic regards.
Mejare hasn't cast off everything from Earth culture, Jessie. Though I fail to see how my bodysuit was more conservative than this.
Yes, we're not from Earth. Jura and I were born on Mejare, which is populated exclusively by women.
I wouldn't joke about something that alienates us so much. We're from Mejare, where only women live.
No, we're not trying to fool you. Our home planet is Mejare, the planet of women...and Earth's uterus colony.
We're being serious. Jura and I are crewmates on a Mejarian pirate ship...Mejare is known for being inhabited only by women.
Wha--I'm not here to find a girlfriend, Jura. It doesn't matter if she looks like me...
Don't tell me this was why you dragged me here. You wanted to set me up with the first girl who looks like me?
Jura, I'm not--she's--don't set me up with strangers! Who cares if we look alike?
W-what? Don't--I--what does our resemblance matter? I don't even know this girl!
What? Jura, I want nothing to with this woman! Don't even suggest such a thing!
Oh, don't even start. I know perfectly well what soldiers take pleasure in, and it's not romance.
Don't bother playing matchmaker, Jura. Or at least find a girl who doesn't sicken me.
I--I don't care what she looks like! She's not worth associating with, Jura! I don't buy her flimsy excuses.
We're pilots for the pirate ship Nirvana, from planet Mejare. It was thrown into a wormhole...so right now, it's where we live.
The Nirvana was thrown into a wormhole, so it's only where we're living temporarily. But we're pilots aboard it.
Jura serves under me as a pilot on our ship, the Nirvana. Normally we wouldn't live there...but the ship itself was warped across the galaxy by accident.
Under normal circumstances, our pirate crew lives in the debris surrounding Mejare. But the Nirvana was flung into a wormhole...so we live and pilot there at the moment.
Don't bother. I want nothing to do with women like you...you're probably only interested in one night.
Save your affections for a less principled woman, Sei. You seem the type who can't hold down a relationship.
Flirting with me is a waste of time. I know your types...you see women as pieces of meat.
Don't pretend a liquored-up woman soldier is girlfriend material. You only want to molest me for a night and move on.
Save it. Mejarians value romance...you're looking for a fling.
She might be a bit irritating personally, but Jura does her job. Besides...the Harvest is the sort of thing that brings crewmates together.
...You're right. We used to be a lot more distant before we had to fight the Harvest...before the men came aboard.
I suppose the Harvest made us feel our own mortality, because I recall not being as friendly with you beforehand, Jura...
I certainly would never have came here with Jura a year ago. Fighting the Harvest really changed us...as did the Paksis.
...My attitude should be of no concern to you. Is stoicism rare on your planet?
...I have my disposition, and you have yours. Many human women are quiet.
...I consider restraint to be a very human trait. Perhaps it's more unusual to a Saiyan.
...I prefer to be reserved for work purposes, and my work is always ongoing. It's not rare for humans to be this way.
...I am from planet Mejare, Caulifla. I only work in outer space. Humans pride ourselves on technology like space travel.
You seem surprised to see that humans have developed space travel. We're known for our intelligence, not strength.
Earth has been colonizing other planets for centuries, Caulifla. If you were to dismiss anything about humans, it's not our technology.
The human intelligence to develop things like space travel is the pride of our species. Why are you shocked to see a human spacefarer?
I'm curious just how far these magical songs can go...
And your other songs are just as potent? Changing the weather would be powerful enough as your only skill...
...How can one woman be gifted with reality-bending powers like this? I want to see what your other songs can do...
You're far too casual about your ability to alter the weather. And this was one of your tamer songs?
You're quite confident for a woman both exposed and possessed. Unless this is simply your true form.
So you've suddenly gained confidence in your poker skills, "Veran"? Is this your true form, or the posturing of a possessor?
I see you've unleashed your true card-playing potential, "Veran." That, or Nayru simply let a better player possess her out of shame...
Are you a more skilled possessor, or simply Nayru having dropped your act? If you thought seeing a shadow attack a woman would rattle me...well, apparently it did.
Of course I distrust men. I come from a planet of all women, Revy...men have always been the enemy.
I don't know the insults you're throwing around, but I assume hating men is a faux pas on Earth. On my planet, there are only women.
It was my understanding Earth men and women were fond of each other. My home planet Mejare has only women...so you'll have to excuse my distrust.
...What are you shouting and making threats for? Whatever a dyke is, I don't trust men because I didn't grow up around any. Planet Mejare has none.
...Dyke? I'm not from Earth, Revy--I don't know what you're even insulting. My home planet has no men in the first place.
...As I said, Revy, I grew up on planet Mejare. It's an Earth colony with only women...we have children by splicing eggs.
I essentially said everything already, Revy. Mejare is a colony of Earth's...and you already seem to have insults for women dating.
There isn't much beyond what I told you. Mejare was settled by Earth women...and we form couples there, as you might imagine.
I told you, Revy, Mejare is a planet of all women...an Earth colony. I assume lesbo and dyke are your words for women in a relationship.
Blue hair is fairly common on Mejare, actually...but I didn't know Earth men could have it. And what is this boy like?
Perhaps you could tell me about him, then. Is it just his hair color that's similar, or his demeanor?
That's the word for a child man, right? I wasn't aware Earth men could have blue hair. What's he like?
...Thank you. I have a crewmate with your brown hair who recently had a baby...but maybe you could tell me about this boy.
...I'm part of a pirate band. I lead its Dread pilots.
A thug like you would be the type to presume others' jobs. I'm a pilot...for a pirate crew.
I don't have a day job, Revy...I'm a Dread pilot for a band of pirates.
Perhaps you think Mejare is a paradise, but I pilot for a pirate crew. In fact, I'm doing some scheduling for it now...
...No, I don't. It was my crewmate's hope that I'd run into a woman here that would distract me from work.
...As Jura, my second-in-command, likes to claim, I'm married to the job.
I'm too busy to have a girlfriend. Leading the squadron takes up all my time.
My entire day is full from scheduling and patrols...it's a miracle I'm here tonight. I can't make time for a relationship.
..."Universe"? I'm not familiar with how the Saiyans organize space sectors, but we use "universe" to mean all of it.
...What does the term "universe" mean in Saiyan society? To humans, that encompasses all sectors of space.
..."Sixth" Universe? There's only one universe, Caulifla. Unless Saiyans have different words terminology...
...Just how many "universes" have the Saiyans catalogued? I suspect that might be the way we say "sectors."
...Is that so, Caulifla? Who is this Saiyan woman I resemble?
...I didn't think we'd have any common ground, Caulifla. Who is this woman I remind you of? Another Saiyan?
...I remind you of a woman you know? A Saiyan woman?
...I was beginning to believe that there were no Saiyan women like me. What is your relationship with her?
...Is that so, Caulifla? Who is this Saiyan woman I resemble?
...I didn't think we'd have any common ground, Caulifla. Who is this woman I remind you of? Another Saiyan?
...I remind you of a woman you know? A Saiyan woman?
...I was beginning to believe that there were no Saiyan women like me. What is your relationship with her?
My bodysuit is one piece. I'm wearing armor over it...and it's not coming off first.
...Spacesuit? This suit is for piloting, not navigating the vacuum of space.
..."Spacesuit"? I don't float around in the middle of space with this on. We have much bulkier spacesuits that let us breathe.
I hate to break it to you, Ami, but my suit's not coming off first. Neither is the armor over it.
...Sounds like you're the cocky one.
I'm not afraid to lose. I just don't want to...and I won't.
Just sizing things up...hopefully that was enough.
Having the first attack doesn't mean much unless it's the winning one.
I don't need to wear more than you, nor do I want to.
Wearing excess clothing is only useful here.
I wouldn't even know what to do with all your clothes. You only ever wear that same dress anyway.
Well, I've given it some thought...
I don't want to do this, but it's just a game...
My first choice? Well, to an outsider, it's obvious...
I know what I'm stripping first...unfortunately.
I hope you don't think this magically puts you in a good position.
You're still losing, Jura. What are you so excited about?
So be it. I made a mistake and paid for it.
I'm having more fun already.
You haven't exactly dazzled me so far, Jura.
You don't have much to be proud of at the moment.
Don't start congratulating yourself over one win. You could beat me if you tried.
You're happy that I lost once? You should really hold yourself to a higher standard...here and in your Dread.
I don't baby you when we're piloting. You shouldn't expect it here.
You know how to play cards perfectly well. Don't ask for your opponents to take pity on you.
Would you ask the Harvest to take pity on you? Or even a Mejarian soldier?
As if you aren't perfectly happy to display your body in public.
You understand poker as well as I do. You're just too busy flaunting your body.
Spend more time practicing and less time bragging, and you'd be in my position.
It's called applying yourself, Jura, and you're capable of it.
Better to be disappointed in myself for losing a hand to someone who wasn't even trying.
Don't even talk to me...
Just keep masturbating. I don't want to hear from you.
Give it a rest already. I expected better from you.
Just shut up.
At least you're done masturbating, but your commentary isn't amusing.
I've had it with your little comments. At least pick yourself up off the floor.
I'm not interested in what a loser has to say.
Oh, be quiet. You've disappointed me all night.
Give it a rest. I'm ashamed to call you my second-in-command.
...Excuse me? What do you mean, I'll get lewder? Why are you making predictions?
What? You don't know me--Navi. What kind of presumption is that?
...Is this your hobby, Navi? Making presumptuous statements about women you've just met?
...I realize you're some sort of fairy, Navi, but human women tend not to announce their predictions for each other's behavior.
...You are aware you've lost, right?
Correct me if I'm wrong, Pit, but "the rest" seems to include you.
...I see sexual activity seems to make men forget their own situations.
It's...hm. I'm not sure this has a specific name, actually.
My eyepiece? It's actually...well, no, I can't think of a more specific name for it.
This is my...hm. Now that I think about it, my Fama never gave it any particular name.
...I'd tell you, but I never was sure what to call it. Besides an "eyepiece."
...I'm from planet Mejare, Ryuko, which is populated by women only. You're aggressive for a young girl.
You don't need to shout, Ryuko. I'm from Mejare, the planet of women, and one of Earth's colonies.
You're actually correct, Ryuko. Mejare is my home planet, not Earth...and it's known for only having women.
I actually am from another planet, Ryuko. You're perceptive for such an aggressive girl...I'm from Mejare, the planet of women.
Don't worry about me...I'm over it.
Just a few mistakes...think nothing of it.
I'm not going to blame my failures on sentimentality...
I'm fine. Just playing badly...that's all.
Just drop it, Jura.
Ugh...I'm all shaken. I'm sorry you have to see me like this, Jura.
I don't want to dwell on the issue...
Thought that wouldn't bother me, but I guess it did...
Just focus on your own outfit. There's only so many small things you can strip.
I'd pay attention to my own outfit if I were you. No hope for me...already down to my armor.
Thank you for apologizing, but it doesn't matter anymore...
My memories would remain even without it. I don't want to bring things down anymore...
You're right...I don't get like this. I'm sorry I just did.
It's fine. I'm moving past it now.
I don't want to be a distraction, least of all to you...
You're right...a Leader can't lose herself over something trivial. I'm sorry.
Well, don't draw attention to it.
Nobody else was saying anything about it...just leave it be.
Unless the rest of them are desperate to know, then just let it alone.
Speaking of which, you should worry more about your own situation, Jura.
I'm not wearing much, Jura. You're not as far behind as you think.
I can't get too flustered when my crewmate is next to me wearing five square inches of fabric.
I've come to expect this sort of thing from you, honestly.
...I've been blushing, huh? Guess I'm not as stoic as I'd like...
Your concern for me is sweet, but I'm fine.
...I had a feeling my face was giving me away. Oh, well...
Worrying about me when you're naked is surprisingly selfless, Jura.
I wouldn't expect you to value winning when you've never applied yourself a day in your life.
That doesn't look fun at all...masturbation should be private.
I'd rather have a bed to sit on...if I were to do it at all.
My chief complaint with you is that you don't focus enough on winning.
I'll enjoy my self-respect and be on my way.
...Fine. You've already humiliated yourself, so there's no point in being sour about it any longer.
...OK. But you'd better work harder piloting after this.
I consider this all the leeway I might've given you in flight practice, so you'd better take it seriously.
Alright, alright. You can't fall any further...so it's time I picked up the slack.
My name is Meia, not blue-haired woman. And I already told you I don't know much. It doesn't have a function.
...I have a name, Remilia. If you had listened in the first place, I said I knew little about it. It's just fashion.
My eyepiece is just a decoration, as I stated before. And if you find "blue-haired woman" tiresome, I have a name.
You made it a point to ignore me last time, Remilia. My name is Meia, and that eyepiece was just decorative.
No, it wasn't. Just a memento.
It was a gift. So I wear it to remember.
...No. I'm sorry if you were interested in the technology.
...Sorry to disappoint.
It really isn't. Mejarian soldiers are much better-outfitted.
You wouldn't say that if you saw the Mejarian soldiers we contend with.
It can deflect lasers...if they hit the shoulderpads. You should see Mejarian imperials' equipment...
It looks a lot fancier than it is. Mejare's empire has the latest models...of course, we have the Paksis.
...What is it, Sei?
...Yes, Sei? I'm listening...
...With you in such a sorry state, I feel obligated to listen...
...Yes? Try not to slur it...
You're doing very well, Jura. Just remember who's always won our games.

...I pilot a Dread ship near Mejare. What do pirates look like on Planet Britain?

...After one whole round of reconnaissance, I've concluded you're all very conservatively dressed.
You all wear too much clothing.
So much extraneous clothing...
I had a streak, but you're all still ahead...
I know my suit isn't much clothing, but Earthlings sure dress heavily...perhaps it's because the opposite sex is wandering around.
Nice run to start with, but I have so little on that it doesn't seem to have helped much.
Flustered...and losing.
I'm all shaken up...and to top it off, I'm losing.
Can't believe myself...
I'd say I should've worn more clothing, but...I own almost nothing at all.
Why do you all wear such extraneous clothing?
Unbelievable...
Any extra clothing...should be personally meaningful.
I shouldn't complain after that streak...but I seem to be losing purely on layer count.
Poker is a dangerous game...I'm losing, and fast.
Just sad...
Normally I'm better than this.
Maybe the suit's too tight...and I can't breathe or think straight.
I had a good run, but I'm still losing.
I had a streak, but it hasn't helped much...
Perhaps I'll have another run like that with the pressure on...
When you're an Earth woman with pants and shoes, I guess it's only natural to outlast a Mejarian in a bodysuit.
Clearly you've gotten in my head...
You're in my head. Now you'll reap the benefits.
I'm being too stubborn...
I'm playing so badly...and fittingly, I now have to be humiliated for it.
I needed that streak...
Not the bra...and I was doing so well.
...Not the bra.
Right when I start playing well...it still wasn't enough against these extensive Earth wardrobes.
What a mess I'm being tonight.
This hasn't been my A game...
Even Hibiki would be outplaying me like this.
This is poker play worthy of Hibiki himself.
Normally I do pretty well in poker games. I guess the allure of showing my nude body was too powerful.
I really don't care about being naked...but I was having a good run there.
The bra was a more painful loss anyway.
Even after that run, I'm still losing. But don't think I'm through just yet.
If you think stripping excites me...well, maybe it would if I weren't losing pathetically.
Damn.
Perhaps I should have worn a more elaborate outfit.
And everyone's more dressed, it seems...
Serves me right for playing like a certain shorty...
All my strategy...well, I have no one to blame but myself.
So overdressed...I can only imagine how long Barnette would last.
Seems it's Earth standard to layer much more. Maybe it's cold...or you're all much less sexual.
I see we don't all have to wear the same amount of clothes. Well...I like a challenge.
I really need to focus...
Damn it, I'm better than this...
I should've known losing my eyepiece would fluster me...
What a miserable loss...
Mgh...I shouldn't be losing at all.
If only I had all the elaborate dresses from when I was a girl...and not this revealing bodysuit.
Jura might look like she wears less than I do...but she's got trinkets everywhere.
Gascogne taught me better than this...
Perhaps part of me wants to lose deep down.
I'm feeling fat...
I'm more than capable of clawing my way back.
This is really putting Mejare's scant layering into perspective for me.
I've played shamefully, so it's time for me to be ashamed.
...And no more breast support. I could use some support right now...
I deserve this with how predictable I've been this game.
Still not as bad as getting your district shut down...
Let's get this over with.
Once upon a time, I had as much to wear as you all do...now that suit is one of the few things I own.
I need a few more practice rounds with Gascogne, apparently...her coat would be helpful, too.
I can't afford these mistakes...not here, not ever.
If you told the captain I played this badly...well, she'd tell me I needed to dress heavier.
I'm still in this game, and don't you forget it.
Planet Tarak's last line of defense is a minefield. Mine is training shorts.
Serves me right for underestimating Earthlings. They turned their colonies into unwitting organ farms, after all.
There has to have been a way I could've played this game better...besides wearing more clothing.
...What can I say? Mejarians don't wear much...but I'm not finished yet.
It's a shame Cupids are known for their stoicism. Otherwise this costume would fit you much better, Jura...
Kicking off boots, undoing the garter belt...my suit has shoes built right in.
Perhaps this'll convince you I'm more woman than monster.
Gascogne won't be happy if I misplace any pieces of this...and there's more than I'm used to.
No, I didn't grow out any pubic hair for the occasion, either...it'd be foolish for just one day.
This thing was irritating anyway...it doesn't have any meaning to me like my eyepiece.
This was not a gift from my Oma...so I'll part with it just fine.
Most Cupids I've seen simply have hair covering their eyes...I wasn't growing my bangs out for this.
This thing has made me appreciate having both eyes. Not all pirates are that lucky.
Women always assume my eyepiece is some sort of scanner. Now I'm just hindering my sight.
I've heard a few crewmates fantasize about being carressed by silk gloves...specifically mine, sometimes.
With no bodysuit to get your attention, accessories will have to do...
Feel free to stare at my cleavage if you don't consider my gloves a worthy strip.
I've heard mixed opinions from women on gloves...I wonder if men like the feel of silk on their tubes.
Lastly, the beret...I won't waste any more time teasing after this.
I have to wonder why Gascogne even had a costume like this lying around...maybe she wore it when she was younger.
I could probably stall further with my boots and belt...but the beret should suffice. It is Valentine's Day.
Do men enjoy this sort of decorative dress on women? Practicality is usually my preference.
And with my chest's reveal, I might as well remove the top...and the quiver.
Lace is too delicate for my tastes anyway. Suits keep my breasts supported and stay strong.
This outfit puts a lot of emphasis on my hips...which is to my benefit, I'd say.
Cupids serve the Goddess Eros...I'm not sure what she'd think of me baring my breasts on the job.
It's a shame Cupids are known for their stoicism. Otherwise this costume would fit Jura much better.
Kicking off boots, undoing the garter belt...my suit has shoes built right in.
Perhaps this'll convince you I'm more woman than monster.
Gascogne won't be happy if I misplace any pieces of this...and there's more than I'm used to.
No, I didn't grow out any pubic hair for the occasion, either...it'd be foolish for just one day.
...It sounds as if you take in stride whatever Emi demands of you. I hope you feel satisfied with that.
...Perhaps you should ask Emi to let you make decisions for once. Unless you're truly happy following her around.
...I see. So Emi tends to take the initiative, and you follow. For some girls, that works...if you're happy.
...I suppose that makes Emi the leader, and you the follower. Not every girl can be a leader... but that's your choice.
...It's not heavy at all, actually. What good would armor be if it weighed me down?
Heavy? It's bulky, but all armor is lightweight. I've read that ancient Earth armor was heavy...poor materials, I assume.
Most of my armor is lightweight padding, Penny. It's only so effective for a pilot...hence why I don't make Jura wear it.
Why would armor be heavy? It's just pressurized. Metal armor is the stuff of history books... even this is hardly effective.
Maybe Earth armor is heavy, but Mejarians build for lightness. Or don't bother at all...it's not much help for a pilot.
...Zizou, she dragged me to strip poker game. Jura already doesn't respect me.
That's implying she ever respected me. Remember what kind of game this is.
If Jura had any respect for me, she wouldn't have made me strip naked in public.
She already dragged me here. Jura and respect are like men and women...they don't mix.
...She seems to think we're part of a religious cult on her planet. Be on guard.
...I don't know what a Buddhist is, but acolyte implies religion. She's mistaken...and she might get violent.
Miko seems to think we're rival religious cultists from her world. Knowing politicians, she'll start a fight soon.
Be careful. If she's calling us acolytes, Buddhists must be religious fanatics she seeks to eliminate.
...Is Nirvana a "Buddhist" term? Probably just a holdover...we're not cultists.
...No, it wasn't. If only my eyepiece completed the costume...

Just count yourself lucky that I didn't wear my eyepiece alongside this. But no, it wasn't easy...
It was certainly easier than piloting with one eye...it's a shame my eyepiece's colors clashed with this.
...I'm not the Nirvana's captain.
...Our captain is Magno Vivan. I'm the squadron commander...
...I lead our Dread pilots. That doesn't make me the captain...
Don't make a scene...and I'm not the captain, Daria.
...Haru's not bothering me, Jura. Don't go yelling at women on my behalf...
Leave her alone, Jura. It's not Haru...I'm just making the practical decision.
My eyepiece is the least important here, so I'm starting with it. Don't overthink things...and don't start blaming nearby schoolgirls.
Haru has nothing to do with my decision-making...don't start antagonizing her. Where's a safe place to put this?
..."Get it back"? This bar has no right to my belongings. Jura, can you take care of this?
...I'd rather have Jura hold onto it than surrender it to the bar, as you suggest should happen.
I won't be "getting it back," because no one should take it. Maybe you should hold onto it, Jura...
...Penny, you're far too trusting if you'd give anything to the owners here. Jura, could you hold onto this?
She's just overreacting...it was a gift from my Oma.
Jura's just a bit concerned for me...my Oma gave this to me, and I usually keep it on.
Pay her no mind, Ryuji...my Oma gave this to me, that's all.
This was a gift from my Oma. Jura doesn't see me take it off very much...
I'm not...looking for romance. Especially not from a strange woman on another planet.
An interstellar relationship is even more than I bargain for than usual. Drop it.
Jura...don't play matchmaker with me as your test subject. She's from a different planet regardless.
Unless you plan on recruiting her, Jura, we'll never see her again anyway...not that I want a relationship.
I see absolutely no reason to be friendly with this woman...she's done nothing to alleviate my fears.
The very first thing she did was threaten me. Why should I give her a chance?
Sei clearly enjoys escalating situations. She had her chance to prove me wrong and wasted it.
Maybe I'd be more respectful if she were the bigger woman. Instead, she tried to start a fight...
You're very friendly, Yang. Blondes always seem to be...wouldn't you agree, Jura?
You seem like you'd get along with Jura just fine...both amiable, as blondes always seem to be.
Between you and Jura, I have to wonder if blonde hair has genes for friendliness...
Blonde hair and energy seem to be intertwined. Jura was proof enough...and now Yang supports that.
Yes, we're pirates. We only do it to survive...well, I do. Let Jura speak for herself.
I try not to bring up my piracy unless asked. It's not glamorous...though Jura tries her best to make it so.
Yes, we're pirates...I try not to bring it up. Jura sees it as a point of bragging rights.
I try to keep my piracy private unless asked. You never know what someone's reaction will be...

...Whatever a Buddhist is, the Harvest has already proven to be a fierce enemy.
...Buddhist? We've had our own issues with the Harvest already...and its fleet of evolving machines.

Care to explain what a Buddhist is? Our enemy is the Harvest--Earth's fleet of mechanical drones sent to kill us.
Your occupation is reason enough to stay defensive.
Among crewmates, I might relax...but around a soldier, no chance.
A drunken, belligerent soldier is nearby...I'll let you decide if I relax.

It isn't armor that makes a woman defensive...it's the company she keeps.
...Jura, I'm sorry for ever calling you vulgar. Hearing this woman speak is making me feel dirty.
On and on with your sex-talk...at least Jura has some class about it.
Cameltoe? I need a shower after this game...even Jura's never made me feel that way.
I should've expected a disgusting drunk making passes at me tonight. I never realized how subtle you were, Jura.

..."Bodysuit," Aella. Or flightsuit...Jura loves talking about clothes, so I'll let her explain.
...You mean my flightsuit? They're certainly popular, but... well, Jura is the expert on these matters.
..."Long johns"? Interesting name for a flightsuit...but I'll let Jura discuss fashion. She'd actually wear different outfits if she had any.
We're not a wealthy enough crew to have private bathrooms, so yes, she has.
We have a communal bathroom, Penny. It's not so awkward when everyone is the same sex.
A ship's crew is like family, Penny. We don't get much bathing privacy--even in the gym, I'm down to my underwear.
We all share bathing accommodations, Penny, as well as anatomy. Jura's seen me naked--and worse.
Earth women are more reserved about their bodies, even to each other, right? Men's presence must do that--we share a bathroom and spa.
Jura being here is easier. At least I have some authority over her.
We shower together. Undoing this bra is more awkward than Jura's presence.
If you're going to admire my resolve, I'd prefer it be from putting up with Jura's laziness for several years.
I couldn't care less about Jura's opinion on my breasts. I'd prefer if she had criticisms of my leadership.
Jura, don't even think about...messing around. The squadron needs you and Barnette happy together...
Cheating shouldn't even be crossing your mind, Jura. I know how you flirt...and trouble with Barnette will mean trouble for the fleet.
...She's in her own little world. Listen, Jura, don't you dare endanger your relationship with Barnette...you'll be arguing during dogfights.
Miko...? She's ranting. Jura, fidelity is important...and arguing with Barnette during battles would be dangerous.
Vaginas, yes. I don't know why Earth culture seems to skirt around the issue.

Yes, we've seen each others' vaginas. I don't know why you consider that a watershed moment.

Our commander, B.C., came up with it. I couldn't tell you if she's a Buddhist...I'm not sure what that is.
B.C., our commander, named the ship. B.C. is many things...but what a Buddhist is eludes me.
What exactly is a Buddhist? Our commander, B.C., came up with the name...for the record, I suggested the Sonnet.
Our commander came up with it. I don't know what a Buddhist is, but we all submitted names...Jura said "the Luxury Night."
You're mistaken...whatever Saiyan technology a scouter is, this isn't it...

...This is just a decorative piece...so it can't be a scouter, whatever that is.
Forgive me for not being in a hurry to satisfy you, "Veran."
I always planned to remove this first. The fact it irritates you is an added bonus.
...Is my eyepiece not good enough for a shadowy Oracle woman? I don't value your opinion.
...My apologies, Veran. But you give me little reason to please you.
Women have been having children on Mejare for generations. We have machines for splicing eggs together.
The only thing that stops women from having children together is biology. We fuse eggs to create babies...then carry them as normal.
Two eggs can produce a child just fine when artificially spliced. The process works just fine, and Famas carry the child as normal.
It's simple Mejarian technology--we splice eggs together, and a couple can have children. Stop shouting.
Mejare has a sister colony called Tarak. It was settled by all men...we're at war.
The men are on the nearby planet Tarak. The two have feuded for a long time...usually staging military raids on each other.
Men are the sworn enemies of Mejarians--and they're on neaby planet Tarak. I've killed plenty myself in armed conflict.
If you want to find the men, they're not far from Mejare--planet Tarak is the male colony. We've been at war with them for almost a century.
...Don't patronize me. What is the extent of Saiyan technology to expect so little from humans?

It seems you don't expect much from human creations... which makes me wonder just what Saiyan technology is capable of.
And what have Saiyans built that stands above human technology? You're quick to dismiss us...
...Do you mean that sincerely? If your strength was attained through effort, I want to earn it myself, as well...
Is that an offer? I thought your strength was inherent to your species, but I would gladly train myself the way you do.
Are you really saying a human could wield the power you do, Caulifla? I'd like to believe that...and attain it myself.
...Is the limit of human strength really the same as a Saiyan's? If you really mean that, I want to know how to reach it.
If simple armor would have been enough to stop you, Veran, these shadow powers of yours are less than impressive.
If you were worried about my armor, Veran, a fistfight would probably be enough to subdue you.
You shouldn't be making threats if my armor was a worry for you, Veran.
If my armor is a concern to a shadow woman, Veran, then clearly magic is not as potent as I thought.
You can believe whatever you want to. I'm not wasting my breath justifying myself to you.
If telling yourself a pirate can't take care of herself makes you feel better, Revy...well, I can't stop you.
I have crewmates, Revy...women willing to help each other. There's no reason I can't be groomed.
I never called it a small pirate band. We do our best to help each other achieve some comfort...
I'm sure your personality is much more attractive here on Earth.
...You must be very successful romantically, Revy.
If stoicism drives women away, I imagine you must have your pick of partners, then.
Men and women both must flock to you, then. Hence your experience in vulgar language.
My Dread is advanced...nothing about me needs to be.
No, it's not. Technology is for using, not wearing.
...My armor deflects lasers. That's about the extent of it.
You'd be surprised how simple it is, actually. Basic form-fitting material...for the hungry eyes of passersby.

Naked under a bodysuit? That's just indecent.

...Can the body really be trained to withstand gunfire? Perhaps with the power the Paksis wields...but from our own spirits?
