...You look a little flustered, Mae. Not unlike a rookie pilot, fresh off the streets...staring at my backside.
...If you're as flustered as you look, Mae, then my squats are paying off.
...Do you not see nude women's backsides often, Mae? Pirates don't get much privacy...but you look nervous.
...Mae, you look flushed. If you're not used to women showing skin in your town... well, it's my whole planet's style.
It's only fair that I show you every side of my body...at least you're enjoying the view, Mae.
...You're staring, Mae. Is that because of my butt or my back?
I've done my best to keep my backside toned, since my suit always shows it off...do you agree, Mae? You're staring.
Apparently, many of my pilots have crushes on me because of my backside. I can tell because they stare like Mae is doing.
I agree, considering what fate Earth has in store for us. As for paradise... there are men around.
Paradise? Hardly...we have to deal with men every day now. But we certainly defy fate.
Of course. We wouldn't be pirates if we thought we were slaves to fate. The men keep it from being paradise, though.
I never pictured my paradise with men in it, but defying fate is something I can get behind. Speaking of behind...
I never did care much for fate. As for paradise, we're stuck with the men...to whom I could never display my backside like this.
"Mother"? That must be the Earth term for it...an Oma is an egg donor.
I said Oma. Or is "mother" what you call them on Earth? I thought men were your Omas...
What's a "mother"? I said it was from my Oma...maybe I'm just unfamiliar with Earth terminology.
"Mother"? If Earth has a word for Omas, maybe Mejarian reproductive methods aren't so foreign to you...
I said Oma. It was my understanding that men and women reproduced together on Earth...is that what you meant?
I don't see through it. Speaking of libraries, I have work to do...
I said it doesn't do anything...I'd rather not talk about it. Let me put it somewhere...
...Again, it has no function. With how often I work, maybe I ought to be one of those sages...
...It's fashion. My Oma gave it to me...speaking of sages, I should get more writing done now.
Mejare is a terraformed planet...it's not in our culture to cover ourselves. Why does a "monster" reveal so much?
Mejare is climate-controlled, so bodysuits are the fashion. I suppose monsters have your own reasons for dressing scant...
Mejare prides itself on being the temperate paradise of female beauty...do monsters try to attract each other the same way?
The women of Mejare form couples...so we put our breasts and hips on display in clothing like this. Why would a "monster"?
Big? You're referring to...my breasts? Wearing armor for that purpose would just be sad.
...Is that why you wear your armor? Insecurity over your chest or not, that's just dishonest.
What? I wear that armor to show rank and protect myself, not--to make my breasts look big.
Are you saying that my breasts look big? No one's ever described them that way...and I certainly wouldn't wear armor just to fool people.
Perhaps if I were a more cowardly woman, I'd try to argue that the suit counts as two pieces. But three?
The suit is clearly one layer, Catria. It's my own fault for not dressing for the game properly--I won't be making excuses.
If you'd like to describe to me how a bodysuit counts as two pieces, let alone three, then please enlighten me.
Strong women accept the consequences of their choices, Catria. Cowards try to count one item as three.
What? Oh...your duel. ...Men gain muscle at an impressive rate. If I could trust one not to attack, then I'd let him lift me up...
...I should've known you'd ask something like that. It's not their rods--maybe their muscle growth. I wouldn't mind one lifting me up...gently.
Right...your duel. I do like men's muscles. Not only is it utilitarian, but their strength would help in...breast massages.
...I expected a question about men. I know they can grow muscle very well compared to us...I wish I trusted one enough to let him massage me.
...I knew I'd be answering this...I had so little clothing. Men are bulky compared to women, and I'd like to...explore their muscles.

state.text: For a woman who claims not to "have her shit together," you're very confident you could capture me.
Earth has no reward money for me, I assure you. Mejare certainly does... but let's see you claim it.
It's just like a soldier to hang a threat above her victim's head. For your own sake, stay over there.
And I'd be enjoying the game with both of you gone. I promise you, the reward money isn't worth the lasers.
...Yes, I'd prefer the body questions, too. As you can tell, I'm not terribly shy about it.
I think your viewers would prefer questions about my body, too. As would I--since I'm constantly displaying it.
...I'm more comfortable talking about my figure, too. Surely your audience would prefer a hips-and-breasts discussion.
Body questions would be better, yes. I'd like some feedback on my stomach and waist...or my backside.
...Exotic and erotic. Is it the way I dress, or the allure of a woman unspoiled by men?
Why exactly am I so fascinating? Or...erotic? My skintight suit? My unfamiliarity with men?
Earthlings seem to find something appealing in a woman who's never been with a man...or shows her body off.
...I certainly thought Earthlings would find me exotic, but erotic? Because of my suit, or...because of men?
Busy interviewing someone else, I hope. Hmm...how do men show they're in love with a woman?
Does that mean she'll ignore me now? Well...er...if a man is in love with a woman, how would she know that?
...Well, Sei...men fall in love with women, don't they? Do they express that the same way we do?
I don't know how much experience you have, Sei, but...what are the signs a man is in love?
Sei...well, I have a different sort of question. When a man falls in love with you, how does he act? ...How should I?

case.state: Go missing? Evas are some kind of exploration craft, then?
So she was a space explorer, then...piloting an "Eva." I'm sorry to hear that.
Perhaps if I had a picture of this woman...I can assure you, I'm not the reason she's missing.
Missing...there's few enough of us that I can monitor the status of all my pilots. A shame to hear that...
So she went missing...I'm sorry to hear that. Is there an "Eva" mech I can study somewhere?
Missing...hmm. If Earth has "freaky Eva mechs," it might use them against us...I'd like to see one.
...So you suspect that the Eva vessel she piloted had something to do with her disappearance? They sound fearsome...where are they?
...I see. She went missing. I considered our Vandread technology fearsome, but perhaps these "Evas" are a different beast.

state.text: I barely even know how men's tubes work, and you make these obscene requests...Sei, I can't have a relationship.
Where do you get the nerve to ask me these things? As far as I know, men are still a hostile species...as are soldiers.
Not everyone is an exhibitionist, Streaming-chan. And I worry men might sprout tendrils...that's not an invitation, Sei.
Maybe you like to degrade yourself for viewers, but I do not. ...Sei, there are plenty of women on Mejare I ignore, too.

case.state: ...Shut up. Quiet. ...Sei, don't be stupid. I can't be claustrophobic...that's just weakness.
...Quiet. Quiet! ...I'm not claustrophobic, Sei, I'm...well.
...I said I don't like them. Now shut your mouth! ...Claustrophobic? Don't be ridiculous...
...My Dread is the only tight space I like. Now be quiet! ..."Claustrophobic"? No one's ever called me that...

state.text: ...Streaming-chan? I see...she won't be finding much. It's a long flight to Mejare.
...Hm. How do you propose she actually search for them? Even as faster-than-light, Mejare is months away from here.
Are you even listening to me? ...Apparently not. Well, between the distance and imperial policy, she won't find much.
Hello? ...I see. That'll be a long shopping trip for products that are probably superior on Earth.
...Is nothing sacred to you, Streaming-chan? Are you here to make me appreciate the soldier's company?
...Ghoulish indeed. Did you bring this pathetic friend of yours to make yourself look better, Sei?
...You're disgusting. Sei, you actually call this woman your friend? She certainly makes you look better.
...I'll say this, Sei. Even for a soldier, you have more of a heart than this soulless attention-seeker.

case.state: ...There's no need to waste time and resources to impress ignorant Earth children.
...Just take this as an example of the xenophobia bred into Earth's younger generation. We should focus on their fleets.
...She's not worth the effort, Jura. We should be striking fear into Earth's Harvest fleets, not its schoolchildren.
...Earth children are taught not to value our humanity, Jura. A show of strength won't change that.
...Thank you, Jura. You're a talented pilot, as well...you just need more leadership experience.
...You're a fine pilot, too, Jura. You just need to practice maintaining that skill when you have to lead the team.
...Jura is second-in-command on our team, and a fine pilot in her own right. As well as more adept socially.
...There's no need to praise me so much. You and the other pilots are skilled, as well...I should let you lead the team more.
Sei and I both shaving is coincidence. I can only assume the women of Planet China are covered in hair...including their backsides.
Shaving is the style on Mejare...ask Sei if you want to know about Earth. Planet China must be fully committed to pubic hair...possibly anal hair, as well.
I'm sorry if you were hoping to see blue pubic hair, Mulan, but it exists. Planet China must encourage its woman to grow hair...freely.
Feel free to display the anal hair Planet China values, Mulan. I don't know Sei's situation.
My pubic hair is thick without shaving...and it's indeed blue. Do the women of Planet China not shave...anything?
A man as the level-headed member of a fighting team? That hasn't been my experience...
I assume you're the cooler head in this arrangement, then? The men I fight alongside tend to be excitable.
Then you must be the more steadfast member. Usually that falls to me...with men being reckless.
The men I know are usually the reckless ones...and short, as well. So this is a new arrangement to see...
I'd like to be the arbiter of that, thank you. I'm my own person.
...I'll take your word for it that it is. Sounds like I'd get along with this woman.
I never saw myself as having much in common with others, but apparently there's an Earth woman I'm very similar to.
I feel like I've been captured on Tarak and displayed in a cage...who is this mystery woman?
Mejare has few animals...mostly in zoos. I now realize they didn't want us to see male ones.
Any animals you see on Mejare are most likely in captivity. They don't want males on display...
Far be it from Mejarian imperials to let us see male animals. Most are hoarded in captivity and hidden away...
I saw some animals in zoos as a girl...all female, of course. Show any male ones, and it might've caused suspicion.
Yes, I lead our ship's Dread fighter squadron. That means I can't compromise the team with personal flings.
Every fighter pilot on the Nirvana answers to me, in fact. Flirting with them would only undermine my authority.
...I have more than a few trainees in our pilot squadron. If I tried to date one of them, the others wouldn't take me seriously.
Yes, I do. But one of a leader's responsibilities is setting a rookie straight when she's busy ogling your backside.
Your male teammate wears a skintight suit, as well? Men don't seem like they're shaped properly for that...
I think your complaints may stem from your gender, Ryuji. Women are smooth and shapely for bodysuits...men are angular and jagged.
I would think men aren't built to wear bodysuits properly. Wouldn't your tube bunch up and get in the way?
If Futaba and I enjoy our suits, and you don't, Ryuji...it's likely because men aren't built for them. You're too inflexible.
By my estimates, men like smashing things and wearing baggy pants to hide their tubes from women's fangs.
The men I know like many things, and women aren't one of them. And their clothes tend to be spacious...
Men dress...in baggy clothing, correct? And they like fighting amongst themselves, but not women.
I think I've gathered those details already. All the men I know wear baggy, loose clothing and like avoiding women to scheme amongst themselves.
I'm totally lost in this conversation...but the idea of a teenager spying on a clandestine government organization is pretty amusing.
I'll be honest...if she is, I side with the teenager over the state. Good for you, Futaba.
That's a funny thought. Listen, Futaba, if you need protection from the law, the Nirvana has room for you.
Rebelling against authority? I like you, Futaba. Keep up the good work.
Guess Earthlings have more intellectual ways of rebelling against the state than shooting lasers...
...Well? Mejare is one of Earth's colonies. My ancestors were Earth women...and men, I suppose.
...Mejare and Tarak are both natural wastelands, but Mejare has been terraformed somewhat. Anything else?
...Such as? We're taught from a young age to hate them. They showed me films of men eating our livers.
...Can you be more specific? We reproduce by splicing eggs together, and our sister planet is Tarak--where the men live.
To be honest, one of the reasons I came here was the chance to become more comfortable with men. It seems that won't be happening.
It's certainly more comfortable having no men here, but I was a little curious about their...tubes.
I won't lie...part of me wanted to see a man naked tonight. Their...things just seem so ridiculous...
With no men here, it's easier for me to admit I was curious about seeing one nude...and if I had the nerve to strip near them.
I avoid relationships even with the other women. Being with a man is just... preposterous.
I--don't be ridiculous. I focus on my work, not leering at my crewmates.
You--you're just making fun of me. I'm not interested in any relationships.
Oh, for God's sake...I didn't come here to gossip about men. I don't even approach my female crewmates.

state.text: ...That might be an exaggeration.
...Speaking of crime, cameras in my face remind me of my mugshots.
...I really don't. But it's clear you're not actually interested.
...I don't have time for this interview when there's work to do.
I told you there wasn't much to say. If you want Mejarian technology, ask about my Dread.
I'd much rather discuss my piloting and ship than anything on my person. If your viewers want that, all the better.
I don't need your viewers' approval. Next time, ask about my ship...or my body.
What did you expect? My Dread ship is a much better example of technology.
...So it is a fetish here. To be reduced to a pornography symbol...
I can't believe my upbringing is the stuff of pornography and fetishes on this planet...
This is not what I expected...Earth treating Mejarians like fetish fuel.
I should've figured they'd find me exotic. Men are the same way for me...
...I should've known I'd be interrogated about Mejare.
...Surely women have formed relationships on Earth? There can't be much to teach about Mejare.
Questions for me? ...I didn't think I'd be a Mejarian tour guide, but perhaps I should have.
Questions for me...? Maybe I shouldn't have said anything. Mejare can't be that different.
Go missing? Evas are some kind of exploration craft, then?
So she was a space explorer, then...piloting an "Eva." I'm sorry to hear that.
Perhaps if I had a picture of this woman...I can assure you, I'm not the reason she's missing.
Missing...there's few enough of us that I can monitor the status of all my pilots. A shame to hear that...
Make decent requests, then. I don't even know how their--tubes work.
Being a pirate does not mean I'm without dignity. Don't suggest that again.
That's a ridiculous thing to ask of a stranger. If I were with anyone, it'd be--somewhere private.
If you want to degrade yourself for popularity, be my guest. Don't involve me in it.
Don't ask me to suddenly have sex with a species I've been taught will kill me. I'm still not sure that's false...
...Quiet. You know nothing of being a space pirate.
...Don't talk about that. Ever.
...No, I don't like them. Stop pestering me.
...My ship is the only tight space I like.
I wasn't lying to preserve my modesty. My outfit seems to be scandalous on Earth, anyway.
Surely my style of dress is titillating enough. I wasn't misleading you...
I have a hard time believing you're capable of personal questions. Toys are simply a curiosity where I'm from...
I'm sure you can find better products on this planet. After all, men are right here for them to be modeled after.
Of course it's horrible. Read a book on the subject if you're so inclined.
Perhaps if you had colleagues, Streaming-chan, you wouldn't treat their deaths as entertainment.
Are you expecting me to describe that in detail? You disgust me.
You're pathetic. You'd advertise descriptions of women's deaths for attention?

case.state: It doesn't do anything. It was a gift from my Oma.
It has no function. My Oma gave it to me.
Mejare is a terraformed planet. Its seasons are mild.
...Mejare is climate-controlled for human habitation. Our ship is even more so.
Mejare's climate is made artificially temperate. Snow is a rare occurrence and is often deliberate for Christmas...
Terraforming has made Mejare's seasons mild. And even the gravity on our ship is artificial, let alone its heat.
So it is women's hair. I'll inform Hibiki about that.
Well, Corrin does look rather feminine. But then, there's masculine-looking women I respect.
Well, Corrin does look rather feminine. But I object to the idea that "feminine" means weak.
...My planet of origin, perhaps. But other women from Mejare have told me that, too...
..."Something different." My homeworld would be the biggest culprit...but I've heard that from fellow Mejarians, too.
...I've heard that from women on the streets...my crewmates...and our captain. They all meant different things...
Our quartermaster said something was "different" about me when I joined the crew...I'm still not sure what she meant.
...I am the Dread team leader, not the captain. But it's clear you aren't taking me seriously.
...Is this what Earth children are taught? That there are no extraplanetary civilizations, and to insult the very notion?
...Apparently the very concept of Earth's colonies is considered laughable here. We will repel your forces all the same.
...You think my homeworld a joke. If I valued the opinion of a teenage brat, I would demonstrate my Dread's firepower to you.
I see. And you left that to work with men? Our crew only did so out of necessity...
I command a Dread squadron for a pirate group of all women. Until we were forced to work with men...did that happen to you?
That's not an arrangement I'd leave willingly to work with men...or was it not willing?
...Earth women still prefer to work with each other, then? Unless you were a special case...
What's it pressurized for? Good question...I think Mejarians just like tight clothing.
I can only assume it's pressurized so it feels better when one takes it off, Aella. Tightness is a style...
If something can be tightened, Mejarians will do it. Your armor seems a bit unwieldy.
Why's it pressurized? Even with armor, Mejare seeks form-fitting clothing. It almost becomes a part of me.
Pressure is Mejare's style. It can be uncomfortable, but heavy metal armor doesn't seem much better.
...You're familiar with Mejarian armor?
...What exactly has made you familiar with Mejarian flightsuit armor?
...A man built your ship? It must be bulky...women's designs aim for sleekness.
Contacting a male engineer would create clashing design elements. Tarak's ships have heavy armor and firepower, unlike ours...
A male shipwright? He would probably see elements of both bulky male ships and slender female ones in the Nirvana...
If a man designed your ship, I imagine it's loaded down with heavy artillery. We aren't used to the Nirvana's lack of agility.
Forfeit? What are you talking about?
...Whatever this "forfeit" is, I don't like the sound of it.
I'm limber with the armor on. It'd be useless otherwise. And what's that about a forfeit?
If you think I'll be masturbating tonight, then men are dumber than I thought.
Don't count on it. You don't seem too spectacular at cards for all your talk.
As if I'd lose to a man. Don't count on it.
...We don't target civilians or the police, but yes. Most of our recruitment comes from common citizens. It's flashy...but also dangerous.
...We only commit crimes in the eyes of the military. Targeting civilians would be foolish--we need them to join our ranks.
...I'll let you decide how "awesome" our activity is. We focus on the military because our recruits tend to be disgruntled civilians.
...There's not enough to gain in attacking the police or common citizens, and we'd make too many enemies. The work is...stimulating.
For an even shorter search, I could just ask Barnette for one of hers...
I have a pilot who wears flowers in her hair. I could walk ten feet to her quarters and get a bow.
I would have a very short search for a bow on our ship, where my pilot Barnette has a collection.
I have a crewmate who would probably lend me a bow, Leggy. Not to mention a pistol...
...You started this conversation, and now you don't want to have it.
...Are male parents a touchy issue on Earth? You're the one who brought it up.
...Natsuki, don't ask me questions and then decide to back out.
...The least you could do is not waste my time. I tell my pilots the same thing when they can't spit out a report.
I don't know why you'd think I'd know what a lesbian is.
Women functioning without men must seem extremist to Earthlings. And lesbian, whatever that means.
...I don't know what a lesbian is, but yes, Mejare probably seems extremist towards men.
...What's a lesbian? Mejare's government would certainly call us extremists for being pirates...
Photograph me if you want. Nobody knows who I am.
Take pictures if you want. I doubt they'll reach Mejare.
Are you taking photographs? If this reaches the ship, Jura will never take me seriously again.
I have bad memories of my picture being taken...or good, in a way.
Are you taking photographs? I'd like to see you try to blackmail a pirate.
Take pictures if you want. My Wanted mugshot is outdated anyway.
...You used to. I'll remember your case during my daily squats routine.
The image of your oversized backside is plenty of motivation for more lunges in the future.
I'll keep that in mind when I hit the gym tomorrow, Erufuda.
I'm actually quite proud of the muscle on my butt. And if it means avoiding your pudgy fate, I'll do even more squats.
There's no reason you can't get it back, Erufuda. I consider my butt my best asset, and that's because I worked for it.
...Thank you, Leafy. I do my best to maintain it.
...Thank you, Leafy. A woman can't build up her breasts with exercise like with her butt...so I prefer the latter.
...I've always seen "beautiful" as something inborn, not trained. But...thank you.
...Toning my backside gives me a clear goal for my exercise. Thank you, Leafy.
I'm not armed to the teeth at all, Sei...in fact, I'm more vulnerable than ever, turning my back like this...
"Armed to the teeth?" Here...as a gesture of trust, I'll turn around. That way you can see my backside...
I only came armed with my laser ring, Sei. You're the one who's been boasting about her equipment...so here's mine.
I'm not "armed to the teeth," Sei. I only brought a basic firearm... and whatever my butt has to offer.
...So, men like women with no pubic hair? Or do they love shaving themselves? Or both?
...I'm confused. Do men enjoy shaved women, or do they enjoy shaving their own pubic hair?
...Men have pubic hair, don't they? Are you saying they like shaving that, or that they like shaved women?
If men like shaved women, Mejare would be a paradise...except we'd kill them. Or are you saying men shave themselves?
So, men are fans of sleekness, too, then? Either on themselves...or on the women they chase?
...You mean they like shaved women? Men seem to have hair everywhere else, so I can't see them shaving themselves...
Photograph me if you want. Nobody knows who I am...especially not by my butt.
Take pictures if you want. I doubt they'll reach Mejare...or that anyone will recognize my butt.
Are you taking photographs? If this reaches the ship...well, they know what I look like naked.
I have bad memories of my picture being taken...a photograph of my backside isn't nearly as bad.
Are you taking photographs? I'd like to see you try to blackmail a pirate...and one who's not afraid to show her backside in public.
Take pictures if you want. My Wanted mugshot is usually from the front.
Take pictures if you want, Shego. I'd be impressed if Mejarian imperials could identify me by my rear.
...You seem to equate normal human sexuality with aggressive perversion. Do men just force themselves upon you?
Staring at a woman's nude backside is normal, Zone-tan. Spreading myself open for men and monsters...is less so.
...What does "hornily" mean to you? That it's fair for a man to pounce on me from behind and...insert his tube?
To react "hornily" is to stare at a woman's butt. What you're suggesting is that I bend over and present to any raging tentacle...or tube.
...I'm glad you have a sense of humor, Emi. I could say the same thing about your breasts...
...And so are yours, Emi, from my point of view.
Yours are still growing, Emi. Otherwise, I might make the same comment...
The reverse would be true if you visited Mejare. I knew coming here that my body would be scrutinized, as a foreigner...
Mhmhm...you do have a good attitude about fitness, Emi. Remember my piloting offer.
I was hoping you'd feel the same way, Emi. Squats work wonders...you really would make a good recruit.
Mhmhm...I was just about to make a similar comment about toned backsides. You would fit in well on our team, Emi.
I appreciate how the butt can be improved through training...oh, you agree, Emi? You would be a good influence on some of our trainees...
...Perhaps that's what truly makes me alien, then. What are they?
...What are they? I didn't expect to rattle a man just from that. Perhaps I'm more alien than I thought.
...Maybe I am an alien. Is it really so shocking not to know? Enlighten me, then...
...Normally it takes a gun in his face to shock a man. What are "Pokemon"? Maybe it'll make me more human...
Tch...that's easy to offer when my breasts are exposed. A Mejarian never makes herself vulnerable to a man...
Questions about the male sex? ...I might be in a more quizzical mood if I weren't so vulnerable now...
It's a bit late to make such an offer, N...I'd rather interrogate a man armed. And clothed...
You weren't distracting me...this is the game. But I would've preferred learning about men with my breasts armored...
"Darkness"? A strange name for a woman...is she a comrade of yours? What's her training routine?
...My routine is mild at best, Megumin. Perhaps I could learn some fitness tips from your teammate...how does she train each day?
I don't doubt that this "Darkness" could be stronger than me...I could always train harder. What's her daily regimen?
...You shouldn't praise something as simple as toned abs, Megumin. Have you observed this "Darkness's" training routine?
What makes you say that? We have dedicated suits for spacewalks...the suit is just Mejarian fashion.
I assume you mean my outfit. We wear baggy spacesuits for raids...but this is just fashion.
An astronaut? This is for piloting...the suits we wear for space are much clunkier.
I'm not sure how. Our spacesuits are one-size-fits-all...this bodysuit is just a common Mejarian outfit.
"A bit" of muscle? Clearly I need to do more squats...is that what you're really after?
You're one to talk about muscle, Kazuma. You're scrawny for a man...is this a ploy to watch me exercise?
One would think a man would understand that muscle can be soft or firm. One squat would reveal that--you can fantasize if you want.
...Knowing you, Kazuma, I'm sure you'd like to observe my squat routine as I develop that "bit of muscle."
I...have already met "males." But since they're crewmates, I can't exactly ask to see their anatomy...
...There are a few men on our ship. That's enough for me--but here, I can learn about men's physiology.
For purely scientific purposes, yes. An Earth stripping game lets me observe both men's anatomy and their culture.
I've already met several men--the prisoners on our ship. This game is for observation purposes...since I can't just inspect them.
...Tamaraneans are rather...promiscuous, aren't they? Or is that your breeding practice?
...At the same time? We form couples on Mejare, not...orgies.
...I can't tell if this excitement over men passing you around is an Earth influence, or just Tamaranean culture.
...If I were to ever be with a man, it'd be one man. Do Tamaraneans breed with several at a time?
Maybe that's true, but Earth is not my standard of comparison...
You can always compare yourself to someone worse. But I come from the planet of feminine beauty.
That's small comfort when my homeworld is famous for its beautiful women...
The expectations are different on Mejare for this sort of thing...but thank you.
...It's something you could develop yourself, Starfire. With your height, it'd look even better.
...Thank you, Starfire. You have a fine figure yourself, and toning the butt is fairly easy.
...You have longer legs, Starfire. You could show off a toned backside better than I could with the same squat routine.
...Well, I do enjoy how my backside can actually be improved with exercise. So could yours, to greater effect...
...You'll be happy to know that Mejarians dress light. Me especially so, to aid in combat.
I regard accessories as combat hinderances, so yes, that will be all.
Any extra baubles dangling off my body would only interfere with my work. You won't see any more.
You'll get what you want, then. I dress to fight and to fly, not to impress.
...If you were to wear this armor, you'd have to lead a Dread team. Are you asking for a job?
...I don't mean to offend, Jessie, but you don't seem the type to engage in combat, or lead a Dread squadron. Would you?
This armor is actually a rank signifier as a Dread team leader, so if you'd like to manage a team of young pirates learning to fly, we can find a place for you.
It pressurizes, so I'm sure it could be adjusted properly. More to the point, though--would you be up to leading a team of Dread pilots?

Don't worry, I'm sure everyone wants to see you strip.
I'm not sure if Earth is a strange planet, or if this place just attracts unusual women...
You've got to play better, ~player~...
Don't blame your luck, or you'll never improve.
Well, don't just roll over and die...
All games boil down to skill, even this one.
I'll just treat this like our daily pilot rollcall...
Every round, there's a part of me that has to remember this is strip poker...
We all have to do it, ~player~...
You'll be fine...deep breaths, mind clear.
I train in this outfit...I'm not feeling embarrassed.
Stay calm and focus. The clothes don't matter...the cards do.
You're always your own biggest obstacle...
Earth's Harvest cubes are a little intimidating. But its women don't frighten me.
I'm out of my suit. Now's the time to impress me with your body...
We're all in this together, ~player~...on a cosmic level.
Come on, ~player~. I work my pilots harder than this...
Time to scramble...
When I get serious, you feel it...
Getting me out of my shorts isn't easy...
Don't think the looming threat of nudity is enough to rattle me.
Ah...I've staved off defeat.
This is me playing seriously...
Thought you could brush me aside, did you?
I'm under more stress than this every day...
This is nothing next to managing a fleet of excitable young women.
You know, Jura's not half bad at this...but she never applies herself.
Another woman. That's a lot easier.
Another woman. Not a problem for me.
Let me get something out of losing tonight...
Give me something to see so my mind doesn't drift to my crewmates...
Good thing someone loses every round...
It's like I'm back home, watching women strip...
It's OK, ~player~...don't take losing as hard as I do.
At least the pressure is off me for once...
Losing here isn't so bad, ~player~. I feel better now...
No one likes a whiner, ~player~...
I've lost and masturbated to completion...you have nothing to complain about.
(Ooh, Meia, look how cute she is. You've been staring at ~name~...I noticed.)
(This is strip poker, after all. Women won't mind if you stare...)
(Feel free to ogle the cuties. Our rookies always ogle you, after all.)
~name~...ah.
...Mei, Mei, Mae, and Meia. Never have I felt so unique.
What's the meaning of this? Who organized this table to be as confusingly-named as possible?
...Let me make sure I understand. You're named Mei, as are you, and you. And my name is Meia. Earth was confusing enough already.
Is this the bar's ridiculous idea of a prank? Are there any other "Meis" I should know about?
...Mei, Mei, Mae, and Meia. Never have I felt so unique.
What's the meaning of this? Who organized this table to be as confusingly-named as possible?
...Let me make sure I understand. You're named Mei, as are you, and you. And my name is Meia. Earth was confusing enough already.
Is this the bar's ridiculous idea of a prank? Are there any other "Meis" I should know about?
...Mei, Mei, Mae, and Meia. Never have I felt so unique.
What's the meaning of this? Who organized this table to be as confusingly-named as possible?
...Let me make sure I understand. You're named Mei, as are you, and you. And my name is Meia. Earth was confusing enough already.
Is this the bar's ridiculous idea of a prank? Are there any other "Meis" I should know about?
...Women always say it's not the clothes themselves that determine fashion, but the body within them. I think that applies here.
...Is that you, Misty? Next to the old one...we can certainly see who wears it better.
It really is the beauty of the woman that makes clothes work...I hope I could wear my old outfits better than I used to.
...How bizarre. A woman wearing her girlhood clothes, and the very image of her girlhood...you look better now, Misty.
...You two are classmates? ...Is this some kind of date? Between--male and female?
Classmates? ...Well, Mejarian girls date in school, too...men and women must do it on Earth.
Interesting location for classmates to date each other. That is what you're doing, right? ...Men and women?
A young man and woman, from the same school...not what I'd choose for a date, but then, I wouldn't date a man.
...You two are classmates? Men and women in school together...unthinkable.
Classmates? Futaba certainly seems like the booksmart type...I have a hard time picturing men in school at all.
I can't believe men and women could function in school together...and that they'd play strip poker together afterwards.
You're classmates, and you'd play this together? It'd be awkward enough just attending school with men...
...I'm well aware that no technological advantage is needed here, Rinkah.
It's true that even ancient-looking women can win here...poker requires no technology.
In combat, I might think little of your ancient technology. In poker...you have a chance.
Fiercely confident in your friends...a good trait in a woman. Our technology is superior, but in poker, that matters little.
Oh, perfect...not a few minutes in and these women are already at each other's throats.
Am I intruding on something? Who are you two, and why are you fighting already?
Do you two know each other? Or is it just in Earth women's nature to fight like this?
I'd prefer if we didn't start this friendly card game with a fistfight. I came a long way to Earth just to deal with you two.
What's the meaning of this? Are you two enemies? I didn't sign up for two women going for each others' throats.
If you two have a personal--or professional--squabble, you can take it outside. I didn't come to Earth for this.
These two...I should've known a fight would break out right away. It seems as if they've fought before, though.
...Did I walk into a streetfight in progress? That's not something I want to go back to...actually, you two seem familiar with each other.
...I'd compliment your figures--both of you--but you seem ready to pounce on each other. And may have done so in the past.
...Sayori, are sure you want to hang around this girl? She...seems off.
I'd be wary if this girl is your friend, Sayori. It's my job to spot threats...
If this girl is who you'd call a friend, Sayori...then I'd say you should work on your character judgment. She isn't trustworthy.
I lived on the streets for a time...I know when a woman is manipulating others for her purposes. Monika isn't your friend, Sayori.
...Do you two know each other? You're speaking professionally...and you're both...er, fit.
...What's the meaning of this chatter? Do you know Chun-Li from somewhere, Cammy? ...You're both very muscular, after all.
Did I come down to Earth in the midst of an investigation? Two muscular women who seem to know each other, and talking about crime...
I didn't expect to see...such well-built women here. And the two even seem to have a working relationship...
Hello, Misty. It's nice to see you again... apparently this is an outfit you wore as a girl? I lost all my old dresses and skirts...
If I had to bring something I wore as a girl here, it'd have to be my old school uniform...I suppose you spent your time outdoors?
Hello again, Misty. I see you wore athletic outfits even as a girl--believe it or not, I used to wear sweaters and skirts.
I hope you've been well, Misty. I see you're reconnecting with your youth--my parents certainly didn't dress me in shorts and overalls.
Hello again, Elesa. I trust you're well--that's a nicer look than last time. Slim, efficient, and simple.
Is that really you, Elesa? You change your look as much as the average Mejarian--I prefer this one's simplicity.
...Elesa? I almost didn't recognize you with a different hair color--and outfit. This looks much sleeker and more practical.
Hello, Elesa. I see you've opted for a more practical side of fashion--it's better to move around like this, isn't it?
Hello again, Nami. I'm glad you've adopted that short hairstyle--it's more befitting of a pirate.
Is that you, Nami? You almost look younger since I last saw you...but I approve of your haircut.
Hello, Nami. As you might imagine, I recommend that any fighting woman cuts her hair short...though yours was beautiful either way.
I see you've taken after my haircut since we last met, Nami. It's quite practical--and it even seems to have made you look younger.
Here we go again. I just don't understand.
You can't run away from your problems, Florina...I've tried.
I appreciate women that stand their ground against their fears...
Running away doesn't solve anything...your fears can always run faster.
Oh, for God's sake. I have far more reason to fear men, and I flew all the way here to face them...
Wha--how could anyone be so--are you serious?
What a disgusting woman, offering so bluntly...wait, you're letting her?
Unbelievable that someone could be so lecherous...wait, what? Don't let her touch you!
Wha--Jura, you don't even know this woman! Don't let her near you! Doesn't this place have rules about that?
Earth was devastated many years ago, so it started using its colonies as organ farms. Mejare is the uterus colony...so there's no men.
We've come to know a few men, actually...but Earth's organ-harvesting is why Mejare is nothing but women.
Mejare is just one of Earth's many colonies. It was intentionally settled as women-only for Earth to harvest reproductive organs.
Jura wanted to come here because we don't know much about men. Earth harvests uteri from Mejare, so there's no need for them.
This is how Jura treats everyone. She's quite proud of herself...and to be fair, no disasters have struck because of her.
I'll start reprimanding Jura when she starts getting women killed. For now it's just an annoyance.
I'm the squadron leader, yes, but Jura is second-in-command. Besides, she hasn't gotten anyone killed yet...
Jura's second-in-command. She usually does her job...she just tends to get distracted with this sort of thing during downtime.
...Revy seems the type to act on that, Jura.
...Are you sure you want this woman touching you, Jura? I don't want to have to pry her off you.
I don't think Revy responds well to being teased, Jura. Fair warning.
...This isn't going to end without some physicality.
You take orders from this man, Rinkah? ...I guess this is a clash of cultures. No man is commanding me.
Hmhmhm...I'm sorry. It's just that...I would never take orders from a man.
Corrin's your commanding officer, Rinkah? I've fought beside men, but taking orders...no, thanks.
I knew Earth would bring some culture shock, but watching a woman take orders from a man is...well, laughable to a Mejarian.
So you two are classmates? I'd say you're not wearing the same uniform...but that may just be a cultural clash.
Shouldn't schoolmates be wearing identical uniforms? ...Maybe that's just a Mejarian custom.
I see classmates on Earth don't wear identical uniforms. That must be yet another Mejarian indoctrination practice.
I always had to wear a uniform to school on Mejare. If you two are classmates, I guess that's not a requirement on Earth.
Ah, so you two are comrades? I imagine Corrin is the officer, given her more professional look.
It's always good to see two strong women working together. Corrin's wearing armor, so I imagine she's your commanding officer.
Is Corrin your commander, Rinkah? You're speaking like she is, and she's more dressed for the part.
It's nice to see that, even on Earth, women fight together. And apparently the officers wear armor there, too...
I see you brought a friend along for moral support. Either that, or Lyn dragged you here for some sort of exposure therapy.
So...whose initial idea was it to come here? Either you're trying to be more confident, or Lyn is trying to make you that way.
Shame can be crippling, so I can see why you came here. Unless, of course, Lyn just dragged you herself.
I've never seen such a timid woman...I'd expect living around men to make you tough. Did you bring her here, Lyn, or did she bring you?
You two...are sisters? I...I had no idea Earth families were so sexually outgoing.
I was an only child...but I'm fairly certain Mejarian sisters wouldn't play this game together.
Sisters? ...So this is how Earth handles familial relationships.
I understand you grew up together as sisters, but...do you really want to strip naked in public together? Is this normal on Earth?
...What exactly is your relationship? Something related to magic, or just romance?
I see one of you dragged the other here...probably Zizou dragging Sola. Do you two have...a relationship?
Are you two a couple? You certainly seem like opposites...but many Mejarian couples are like that.
I see Earth women are also capable of forming companionships with each other. Good to see, even if you seem very different.
...Sisters? I knew soldiers lacked all common decency, but to drag your siblings into this...
A military woman...and her younger sister. As if I needed confirmation soldiers were depraved.
Soldier women always seem to show me new lows. Bringing their young sisters to strip poker, for instance.
You two are sisters? What kind of disgusting--well, a military woman fits the bill.
Jura, this woman is clearly unhinged. Don't antagonize her.
Jura, we don't know what this woman is capable of--either magically or mentally. Leave her alone.
Don't tease this woman about her obsessions, Jura. Can't you tell she won't take it as a joke?
...Jura, we don't know the extent of this woman's magic. We do know that she's mentally ill, and not afraid to use it.
...Mei, Mei, and Meia. This has to be some stupid prank on the part of this establishment...
...Are there any other "Meis" I should know about? This has to be some sort of joke.
...So, both of you are named Mei. I'll let you figure that out, and count myself lucky to have an "a" to set myself apart.
Hello to both of you...the two Meis. Playing with one similarly-named woman is confusing enough--I can't imagine how you must feel.
...Mei, Mei, and Meia. This has to be some stupid prank on the part of this establishment...
...Are there any other "Meis" I should know about? This has to be some sort of joke.
...So, both of you are named Mei. I'll let you figure that out, and count myself lucky to have an "a" to set myself apart.
Hello to both of you...the two Meis. Playing with one similarly-named woman is confusing enough--I can't imagine how you must feel.
You're awfully dressed-up for this game. Seems pointless when your clothes will come off anyway.
Is that the kind of outfit that attracts men? You'll have an easy time finding a man, then, Jura.
Makeup...don't see the point. Talk to Jura about it...
All dolled-up...just another form of dishonesty.
That's correct. Our commander, B.C., named it. Why?
...You seem rather distressed over the name. Take it up with our commander.
That's correct. Are you interested in its specs, or just the name? Our commander came up with it.
Yes...it's a fusion ship from male and female vessels. B.C., our commander, named it...I offered "the Sonnet."
Earthlings really are clueless about their own colonies...or perhaps it's because you're a man. We're not aliens.
Is this xenophobia or ignorance, N? Mejare was settled by Earth women. Jura and I are humans.
Ignorance of your own planet's colonies... typical of an Earthling, and a man. We're humans like you.
...Up until recently, we were taught men were aliens. I can only assume Earthlings are taught such about their fellow humans on Mejare.
You work as a model? You and Jura here should talk.
You work as a model? Isn't that you've always wanted, Jura?
Seems Earth women are capable of being vain, too, Jura...and models. Have fun with this girl.
This "academy" of yours sounds like a school...Mejarian schools are just government propaganda.
So, you go to school with men? Must be a pain getting them to sit still during a lecture.
I'm told you're into government. Mejare's is in need of reform, to put it bluntly.
I'm told you're into art. If you want that life-sized portrait, Jura, here's your chance.
This "academy" of yours sounds like a school. I dropped out of school...
I'm told you're into art. I know Duero painted Parfet something once, so maybe you two should talk.
You have a roommate at this school of yours? I'd never be comfortable without my single room.
You work as a model? So does Jura here. Fire away.
You work as a model? This is your chance, Jura. Make connections.
You go to school with men? Sounds distracting.
You're a student...I dropped out of school. Bad times.
I hope this "high school" of yours is a little less indoctrinating than Mejare's.
You're a "witcher"? What do you think, Jura? Was it for owning an anatomy book?
You're a "witcher"? Mejarians who associate with men get called witches...like us.
The word "witch" gets us a little touchy sometimes...I apologize.
The same person, both male and female...that shreds any doubts I had about men and women being the same species.
I wonder what Hibiki would look like as a woman...probably taller, honestly.
Male and female...you two would make perfect test subjects for Tarakkian scientists.
The same person, one born on Mejare and the other on Tarak.
I'll be honest...you both look like women, and I'm not sure which one is prettier.
You look like Paiway's first attempt at makeup.
So much makeup...I don't wear any. Just gets in the way.
See what too much makeup leads to, Jura? You shouldn't concern yourself with it.
...Do I have to be involved in this? I didn't even lose...and I don't want the ship seeing this.
The focus is on Jura. Don't rope me into this...I don't want my pilots seeing me here.
It's Jura's turn. Just take two pictures of her and be done with it...she won't care if the ship sees her here.
Can't you just photograph Jura? This could reach the ship...
We're both fighter pilots on the Nirvana, a fusion ship. I'm commander; Jura is second-in-command.
We're part of the fighter Dread team of the Nirvana, a ship created by the fusion of male and female machinery.
We're pilots for the Nirvana, a ship created in an energy fusion accident. Which reminds me...I have scheduling to do.
I'm the leader of our Dread squadron on the fusion ship Nirvana. Jura is second-in-command...as you can see by her attitude.
Your planet has no men, either? ...Maybe Mejare isn't the only uterus colony Earth has.
You're kidding--Gensokyo has no men? But then--perhaps Earth has more than one colony for uteri.
Gensokyo has only women, as well? Mejare was established for Earth to harvest uteri--that might be its plans for you, too.
I'd watch Earth carefully, Miko. It plans to use Mejare as a uterus harvest planet--if Gensokyo has no men, they might use it, too.
I'd be surprised if Jura parted with her boots too quickly...the only thing she loves more is her dress.
I doubt it. Jura has plenty of small things, Sei...she's just getting started.
I wouldn't bet on that, Sei. You should be able to see all her jewelry left...
Jura loves her own body, Barnette, her dress, and her boots, in that order...so they've probably got a while to go.
Tease me? Yes. But this place provides a particularly good avenue for it.
...Tease me and call me boring? This is more than usual, but yes, she does.
...You'll have to be more specific, Sei. If you mean calling me a sourpuss, yes, and even more so today.
A strip poker game is the perfect opportunity for Jura to call me both perverted and boring, if that's what you mean.
No, she just has absolutely no shame...and a supreme confidence in her body.
It's less that she wants to strip and more that she's convinced she's the most attractive woman in the galaxy.
No, she doesn't normally strip in public...but as you can see, she clearly has zero qualms with people admiring her.

state.text: ...I think she just sees this as an opportunity to get more women to ogle her, Sei.

case.state: Captain? I'm the squadron leader...our captain is an elderly woman named Magno Vivan.
...I'm not the captain, I'm the Dread leader. The Nirvana's captain is older than any of us.
The Nirvana's captain is a wise old woman called Magno Vivan. I'm just the squadron officer.
I'm just the Dread team leader. It'll be a long time before I'm our captain's age...
Cute name similarities aside, Jura, this doesn't seem like the kind of woman who laughs things off.
I think everyone will remember the difference, Jura. Unless you start threatening people.
...Jura, please try to evaluate someone's character before flirting with her.
Height, hair color, and general demeanor should be enough to tell you two apart, Jura.
Don't antagonize her, Jura. I can respect a woman who understands the value of silence.
You could do to learn from me or her when it comes to occasionally being quiet.
You can't learn anything from talking, Jura. Kyoko's being smart, listening in on us...
She does have my temperament. Don't take that as an insult, Kyoko...more women should listen to others.
Fancy dress...your outfit is like Ezra's, and your sword like Jura's here.
You dress like Ezra...you kind of look like her, too. But the sword is distinctly Jura.
You look pretty good with that sword. Jura, learn from this woman and actually use your sword properly.
As long as you've got that sword, could you teach Jura how to use it? That rapier of hers is just for show.
This is a card game. Why'd you come armed with...whatever that thing is?
You look pretty good with that sword. Jura, take instructions from this woman so you can actually put that rapier to use.
Fascinating. That sword looks like it's made from the lasers our rings use.
Assuming that style exists anywhere, it's too conspicuous. This coloration blends into machinery.
She can be as bubbly as she wants. I doubt she has the responsibilities you or I carry.
She looks young, Jura...and in a better position. She can afford to be happy, so let her.
Wherever she comes from, I'm sure that pattern is optimal. She must wear it for a reason.
I don't think people will be confused. This woman seems a lot more well-known on this planet.
One letter can make all the difference...just like one mistake.
If you actually got us confused, I'd have Duero check your eyes before you posed a danger to the team.
I trust my second-in-command to track the subtle differences between Mei and I.
Oh, good, another of me. Now I can take a day off of bossing Jura around.
Two Meias? Look at that, Jura. The worst day of your life.
Playing with more than one of me is sweet. Have you extended the same love to Jura here?
I'm glad you like me enough to play with more than one of me, ~player~. Do you like Jura, too?
Two of me? Give Jura some attention, too, ~player~. She's not a bad person at heart.
Wha--don't bring up Misty. It's not like she'll understand.
You--I--Misty and I are not an item. I just give her advice.
You know perfectly well Misty's into men, Jura...and also that she's too young.
Why do you try to twist my relationship with Misty into love? She just...needs guidance.
You just want attention...
I wanted a challenge, and I get you.
...Insufferable.
For God's sake...
Is it Moon's turn again? Perfect, no reason to care...
Walking Mejarian propaganda, this girl...look what men have done to her.
I know a male doctor who'd like to inspect you for diseases, Moon...and the limits of female physiology.
You wear quite a bit for a girl so eager to strip. At least that gives me work time...
...I'm glad you're here, Misato. You paint a more flattering picture of an Earth woman with experience with men.
You should know that Moon fits the Mejarian stereotype of a woman who sympathizes with men, Misato. You're a much more respectable example.
It's nice to see, in Misato, an Earth woman who's had sex with men and hasn't become a shambling wreck. Moon is the shambling wreck.
This is quite the mixed message about men. You seem well-adjusted, Misato, but Moon might represent the result of prolonged male contact.
...Navi, do you know this woman? You're all excited...does she live on Planet Hyrule, as well?
...Is there something about Nayru we should know, Navi? You're acting as if she has some authority on Planet Hyrule...
Nayru is from Planet Hyrule, too, then? I see women can vary dramatically there...you're quite excited, Navi.
Two women from Planet Hyrule, then? And not very similar...apparently Nayru holds considerable authority over Navi.
You're a goddess? Don't be so vain.
You're a goddess because you live in the sky? There's a lot more to the universe than that.
A "goddess"? I'm sorry if I ever called you vain, Jura. This is a new one.
You have some competition for extravagant dress, Jura. And vanity, apparently.
I feel your pain. I command a short, overconfident man myself.
Well, this is one way to grow closer to your colleagues. I sure wouldn't want any crewmates here.
Surely a goddess wouldn't need a man to help her.
You study human culture? What exactly are you?
You study human culture? I could probably learn from you...
You study human culture? Duero has an anatomy book you might be interested in reading...
"Pearl"? Jura's already a big fan of yours.
And you call me chilly, Jura. At least I show my face.
You look like that outfit has never come off.
You can show your face, Raven...I know being open with people can be hard.
Clearly I need to show less emotion, then.
You're right. I could really improve my stoicism by watching her.
A concession? I thought you were going to tease me all night.
I'm sure she has her reasons. Stoicism is important for a leader...
You're certainly acting more cheerful, Raven. Perhaps I should follow suit...
Something about this game lightened you up in a hurry. That was supposedly why I came here...
Well, Jura, if you had doubts stripping can improve a woman's spirits...if it worked for Raven, there's hope for me.

state.text: Something about stripping has brought out a lighter side of you. Now everyone will expect that of me.

case.state: I'm not sure I'd want to date someone who'd agree to it in a seedy place like this.
Unless she's heading to Mejare soon, I can't see that relationship working out.
You seem far more interested, Jura. She is blonde, after all.
Maybe you could flirt with her and bring her back. Barnette could use some target practice.
Maybe if she agreed to join the crew...but what from I hear, she hunts pirates.
That's quite the outfit. You may have competition, Jura...but then, you like that.
I've heard Earth women dress like you to attract men. Mejarians do it to attract each other...
Well, you're certainly devoted to matching colors. I wear what I have.
A martial artist? You must be proud of your...assets. Both of them.
I can see two reasons why you and Jura are going to get along this evening. And your martial arts skills aren't one of them.
You're a martial artist? Even with...er...you're not off-balance at all?
...Are you really a martial artist? You must have quite the developed musculature...on your back.
You're...a little pale. Are you feeling alright?
So pale...muscular, but...you look sickly.
And you call me pale. This woman's marble-white.
...Is there no sun on your planet? I'm...so sorry.
You're, uh...a little pale. Are you feeling alright? And you're not wearing much...
So pale...muscular, but...you look sickly, despite how little you're wearing. Trouble breathing?
And you call me pale. This woman's marble-white. And she doesn't really have the wardrobe for this game...
...Is there no sun on your planet? You're certainly dressed for it.
That's a vivid hair color...look, Jura, another one.
You're a fiery one...she's how I picture your and Barnette's daughters, Jura.
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...you've certainly got the energy befitting yellow.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...your yellow betrays an intense personality.
You work in a team of women? Well...seems Earth and Mejare aren't that different after all. You've even got the fire of Jura here.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself, apparently...you've certainly got the spirit for it.
That's a vivid hair color...it matches yours, Jura. But I can't say the arm does.
You're energetic...how'd you lose your arm?
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...none of us have mechanical arms.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in outlandish hair colors...maybe we could regrow your arm.
I'd say I'm sorry, but...that mechanical arm looks pretty useful.
It's good to see a woman who can carry herself...and perhaps lift herself, too.
...What do you think, Jura? Should we have our arms replaced with robotics?
I hope you realize the kindness I'm doing you by dressing this way, ~player~. That other Meia is wearing my favorite bodysuit.
I decorated myself like this for you, ~player~...just so you know. That bodysuit is much more comfortable--and sleek.
Did you have to invite a normally-dressed clone of me, ~player~? It's just making me miss my bodysuit even more.
...~player~, do you have something to tell me, picking both of my costumes? For the record, I prefer suits.
Wouldn't you agree a bodysuit is a better look for me, ~player~? It's practical--and it reveals my figure with no skin.
That Cupid costume is ridiculous enough in front of a mirror. ~player~, you're embarrassing me.
...Well, ~player~? Do you prefer me in a bodysuit or a ridiculous Cupid outfit?
Cupid Meia? ...~player~, are you trying to engineer some sort of clone-threesome with me?
Mirrors didn't do this justice. Seeing me in that Cupid outfit from every angle...how do you like me better, ~player~?
That Monster Girl outfit is certainly revealing. You should know, ~player~...I'd prefer a partner who likes my suit.
...Are you trying to decide which outfit you like better, ~player~? I am not dressing up like that all the time.
...Two of me, and we're both in Cupid outfits? I can only help you so much in finding love, ~player~.
Normally I'd like you liked me by choosing a clone, ~player~...but I think you just want a Cupid's help.
You do realize this is just a Valentine's costume, ~player~? Picking more Cupids won't magically bestow you with love.
I hope you're not expecting us Cupids to find love for you, ~player~. Unless...you're saying you want me around.
...Are you done insulting us? You weren't even brave enough to fight when you were armed--and stay away from Jura.
I'm sick of you running your mouth. Insult me if you want, but don't you dare involve my second-in-command.
Leave Jura out of this, Revy. Your quarrel is with me--but, of course, you're a coward who picks on those weaker than her.
Don't you dare lay a hand on my pilots, Revy. I suppose you're too cowardly to fight me.
That's an elaborate outfit... what's Earth's view of Easter? On Mejare, it represents our founders' divine voyage.
I'm curious just what Easter means on Earth. On Mejare, it's the day an angel led us off Earth to escape men.
Easter on Mejare is the day the angel Gynos led us to our new homeworld. What does it mean to Earthlings?
I didn't know Earthlings celebrated Easter. Mejare's Easter is the day we left to found the colony--led by an angel.
That's an unorthodox look for Valentine's...perhaps you feel more comfortable encouraging others' love than finding yours.
That's an interesting choice of outfit, Ochako. I suppose a hero would rather cheer others' love than risk her own heart.
Dressing as someone who encourages others to find love...we're of the same mind, Ochako. Both reluctant.
A Cupid makes others fall in love--just like a Valentine's cheerleader. I struggle with my own feelings, too, Ochako.
I understand black cats are a symbol of misfortune here. Mejare's equivalent is men.
A black cat. Mejare usually uses a man's silhouette to show bad luck--to the surprise of no one here, I'm sure.
I didn't know Earth had such a hatred of black cats. Mejare would have you believe our misfortune comes from men.
Black cats for Halloween, rabbits for Easter...Mejare barely has any animals. We blame bad luck on men.
It's good to see someone who shares my fashion sense...on most days.
Bodysuits can get uncomfortable, wouldn't you agree? I hear you normally wear one.
You pilot a mech? So does Hibiki...and he's learning. But he always dresses the same, unlike you.
So, what's planet Korea like? Never heard of it...is this how people dress there?
You're a pilot, too? Mechs, Dreads, they're all fascinating...even though you're not dressed for the part today.
Easter has nothing to do with rabbits on Mejare. What's so signficant about them on this planet that you'd dress as one?
On Mejare, Easter is the day our founders' divine journey from Earth began. Here, you...celebrate rabbits?
...I take it the rabbit is some sacred animal to Earthlings? Why would you dress as one on Easter?
Why are you dressed as a rabbit for Easter? Mejarian Easter is very much about Mejare--so I'm not sure what Earth honors.
I've heard passersby call you "Dahlia." Is this more deception on your part, Ini?
I'd compliment you on the dress, but I'm curious why some workers here think your name is "Dahlia"...Ini.
That's a nice dress for a woman who deals in deception. Is this "Dahlia" I keep hearing about your alter ego?
I happen to like sundresses and parasols...it's a shame I share a fashion sense with you. Is "Ini" your real name, or "Dahlia"?
...Is that you, Moon? So skin-bleaching procedures exist on Earth...not that it's helped your personality.
Bleached skin...are pale women seen as more promiscuous on Earth? That's how you want us to treat you, after all...
Ugh...not you again. You can bleach your skin and dye your hair, but your lack of self-respect is still sickening.
...Moon? What unnatural procedure did you submit yourself to to bleach your skin? You're not even acting different...
I see you've...died since we last met, Weiss. My apologies...what happened at your wedding?
...Weiss, have you--died? That's a grim reminder of fate--were you marrying a man? Did he kill you?
...Well, now. It's good to know women can keep their forms after death...I assume you died at your wedding?
...Weiss? You--you died at your wedding? I knew trusting men to that extreme was dangerous--!
...Hello, Juri. I'm surprised a vagrant thug bothered to dress for summer as she searched for victims.
Juri...I don't suppose you've mellowed out since we last met. Even if you've dressed for the season.
You again...your original outfit would probably have kept you cool in summer. Do you have your original attitude?
Of all the women I had to meet again... seasonal dress never struck me as one of your priorities. Not over starting fights.
I see wedding dresses aren't much different on Earth. But... you usually marry men, correct?
If you ask me, Earth women should take Mejare's lead and marry each other. Men are superfluous with today's technology.
Sometimes I've wondered about getting married... but no woman would marry a pirate. I suppose your fianc is a man?
A gown...Mejare's wedding dresses are a bit sleeker, but the real difference is the other woman on the altar.
You again...the horrible aura you give off is even stronger now. You feel connected to this place somehow...
Monika? Dressed up for Valentine's Day, and giving off even worse vibes than usual. Like we're all pawns to you...
Even dressed up for Valentine's, you make a pit in my stomach. How can a schoolgirl give off such murderous energy?
You again? Today? The look in your eyes is even worse than before--why do I get the feeling it's tied to this place?
Not again...somehow, your aura is even worse today. Overt murderousness rather than passive.
Not you again. Our last game made me feel nauseous...perhaps the summer breeze will help.
You? I was hoping for a relaxing summer's day, and I find the girl whose very presence unnerves me...
...Not the ominous schoolgirl again. She never hurt anyone, and yet just being near her claws at my stomach.
...You can dress in casual summer wear all you want, Monika. I know you're still up to something...our last game made me nauseous.
You look cute in that outfit, Nagisa. Mejare has maid cafs like that, too.
It's been a while since I saw a girl dressed in a maid caf outfit. They exist on Mejare, too...in scattered locations.
...I can't stay stoic when a sweet girl like you dresses up. I visited a few maid cafs on my homeworld...
As if we didn't know it was Valentine's Day, Nagisa comes dressed like that...Mejare's maid cafs were packed around this time, too.
Nugi-chan? You must work for this bar year-round...do you serve ice water?
Hello again, Nugi-chan. I see you work summers here, as well--I'll take some ice water next hand.
...If you wouldn't mind continuing to serve drinks, I'd like a glass of water. Does the Inventory make for stable employment?
Is that you, Nugi-chan? You really do work for this establishment...ice water, please.
Rinkah, you look... ghastly. This is how a Mejarian might dress up to show girls what men look like.
What's the meaning of this horrifying fire spirit makeup? Like men in my planet's propaganda...!
...How long did it take you to create this costume? You're a walking fireball--not unlike Mejare's pictures of men.
...Rinkah? My God, you look horrific. I didn't know the "Flame Tribe" matched Mejare's depictions of men...!
...That's about how Mejare would have you picture men. Hellish, fiery ghouls. Is Halloween that important here?
...Is that you, Rinkah? Flame Tribe, indeed...eat women's livers, and you'll match how Mejare depicts men.
I see you've taken the Mejarian approach to armor this Halloween: cover the shoulders, and leave your body exposed.
I'd claim that armoring only your shoulders is ineffective, but Mejare is guilty of that, too. Is it purely for Halloween?
I doubt pure shoulder armor will protect you from the horrors of Halloween. And you're a ground warrior, not a pilot.
Metal shoulder armor seems like little more than excess weight. But then, this is just a Halloween costume, correct?
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors...our outfits tend to vary, too.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...you've got some strange outfits yourselves.
You work in a team of women? Well...seems Earth and Mejare aren't that different after all. Besides those bizarre outfits.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself, apparently. And dress herself in different ways.
Did you get dressed up for this? I know a few Mejarians that are obsessed with fashion...
Oh, it's you, L'Arachel. I see not even a holy woman is above spending a day at the beach...while still armed.
Hello, L'Arachel. Even in casual swimwear, you bring a weapon along...not unlike me when we encountered an island planet.
Perhaps we're more alike than I thought, L'Arachel. I've kept my weapon on me even as we've gone for swims, too.
It's nice to see you again, L'Arachel. You must not be fully committed to beach leisure if you've brought your staff.
Shouldn't a "magical girl" fighter know how to swim? Unless that inner tube is just for relaxation.
Are you proclaiming your love of cheeseburgers, or can you not swim? I'd expect that from a "magical girl."
Hello, Sayaka. I'm surprised to see you with an inner tube--I can teach you to swim if you would like.
...Do you not know how to swim, Sayaka? It's a great full-body exercise--a fighter like you could benefit from it.
Hello again, Sheena. I have a blue swimsuit that's just like that one...though I don't fill it quite as well.
That one-piece swimsuit looks just like the one I have for Mejare's summers. We've encountered a few planets with beaches...
You look very nice in that swimsuit, Sheena. I dress for summer in a one-piece of my own, but you wear it better.
I have one swimsuit to my name, and it's a blue one-piece...it looks like yours. Of course, I don't have to stuff my breasts into it like that.
So, you're wealthy enough to vary your attire? I grew up wealthy...didn't last.
My crewmates and I all have different hair colors, too...none of us have white, but maybe money does that to you. As well as letting you change outfits.
Genetic engineering on Mejare has resulted in some pretty outlandish hair colors...seems you could afford a wardrobe change, too.
I should have expected a wealthy woman to change her wardrobe...I would, too, if I owned anything.
You work in a team of women? And your outfit is different...we don't really have uniforms, either.
Good to see a woman who can carry herself. And has the finances to vary her outfit.
Hello again, Raven. I agree with the new outfit color, but a fighting woman shouldn't let her hair grow.
Is that you, Raven? It's good to meet you again...but I see you're getting sloppy. You ought to keep your hair short like me.
White is a good color, Raven...but why haven't you cut your hair? A warrior can't have it getting in her eyes.
You keep brushing your hair out of your eyes, Raven. I understand wanting to look beautiful, but it can't limit your ability to fight.
Hello, Zizou. I hope your business of being a goddess is going well...you seem to have the free time for a day at the beach.
I wasn't expecting to see a magical goddess at the beach. I trust you've been hard at work.
Oh, it's you, Zizou. That's quite the casual outfit for a goddess, even at the beach. Have you developed any new magic?
Shouldn't a goddess of magic be too busy for a day at the beach? You look like you're enjoying yourself.
You're awfully dressed-up for this game. Seems pointless when your clothes will come off anyway.
Is that the kind of outift that attracts men? If so, Jura will have an easy time finding one.
Makeup...don't see the point. Jura certainly does, but I've never seen eye-to-eye with her.
All dolled-up...just another form of dishonesty.
...I thought Marinette was Ladybug.
...So what you're saying is, Marinette made her public debut before Samus?
...What's "1981"? Sounds old...Marinette doesn't look old, especially not older than Samus.
Should you be talking about Samus and Marinette like this? I'm totally lost...
What...does that have to with anything?
...I don't even know what Street Fighter 1 is.
There's an industry for these...things?
I don't know what it was before, so I don't think revolutionizing it would mean much to me...
...Protagonist? You're talking like she's fictional.
What are you going on about? Gaming? Protagonists?
...What's "1981"? A year? By what measure? What are you talking about?
Should you be talking about Samus like this? She's standing right here.
I see you've got a good sense of style, Haru. I once owned a dress just like that--and a hat, too.
You called this the "Dapper Date"? It's not unlike how a woman might dress up on Mejare...I owned something like it.
A hat and dress...I liked to keep things simple and cute, too. Back when I could afford an outfit like that.
I assume this "Dapper Date" of yours is with a man. I can't understand that...but we do share a taste in dresses.
So, you're wearing Earth festival dress for Valentine's Day? That's valuable cultural information... do men like the pattern?
I see there's a traditional dress Earth women wear for Valentine's Day--and it comes in all sizes. Men like it, then?
I see..."Earth women don a traditional red dress for Valentine's Day festivities. Unknown if red attracts men."
Red is a passionate color--just what I'd expect from a dress Earth women wear on Valentine's Day. It must get men's attention.
What exactly is your fascination with ~player~? Do you know her from somewhere?
Is there a reason you're fixated on ~player~? What's the meaning of this constant attention?
Whatever your ulterior motives are, you're making it awfully clear you only care about ~player~.
I don't know why this girl is fixated on you, ~player~, but I would be wary of her.
Why are you always addressing ~player~? Do you know her from somewhere?
I was under the impression we were all strangers...but you seem very fixated on ~player~.
~player~, do you know Natsuki? She's always addressing you like you're close.
On and on about ~player~. If you two have personal issues to resolve, Natsuki, this isn't the setting for it.
...~player~, what is your relationship with this woman? I suggest you make yourself clear so she leaves us alone.
I don't appreciate this unhinged woman threatening me, ~player~. Perhaps you should address her infatuation elsewhere.
Why is this woman obsessed with you, ~player~? I could tolerate that...if she weren't threatening the rest of us.
...I'm glad to see woman-woman romance is alive and well on Earth, but not when it escalates to threatening strangers in fits of jealousy.
...~player~, please inform Tharja that I am not looking for romance with any woman here...and that her threats are getting tiresome.
What exactly is your fascination with ~player~? Do you know him from somewhere?
Is there a reason you're fixated on ~player~? What's the meaning of this constant attention?
Whatever your ulterior motives are, you're making it awfully clear you only care about ~player~.
I don't know why this girl is fixated on you, ~player~, but I would be wary of her.
Why are you always addressing ~player~? Do you know him from somewhere?
I was under the impression we were all strangers...but you seem very fixated on ~player~.
~player~, do you know Natsuki? She's always addressing you like you're close.
On and on about ~player~. If you two have personal issues to resolve, Natsuki, this isn't the setting for it.
...~player~, what is your relationship with this woman? I suggest you make yourself clear so she leaves us alone.
I don't appreciate this unhinged woman threatening me, ~player~. Perhaps you should address her infatuation elsewhere.
Why is this woman obsessed with you, ~player~? I could tolerate that...if she weren't threatening the rest of us.
...~player~, please inform Tharja that I have no interest in men beyond the scientific...and that her threats are getting tiresome.
...Is this what falling in love with men does to women? It's unhealthy...and irresponsible on your part, ~player~.
Two Juras? Well, you've certainly dolled yourself up to earn this.
I guess all that teasing really did the trick, Jura. ~player~ loves you enough to put another one.
Good. Twice the vanity, half the responsibility.
I don't make any effort to look beautiful, so I see why ~player~ would want two of you instead...
Rabbits seem to have quite the hold on Earth's version of Easter...you remind me of our young nurse, with her frog puppet.
You're not going to count a stuffed rabbit as clothing, are you? I'm surprised they're such a symbol of Easter here...
Our nurse Paiway carries around a little frog doll herself, but it doesn't represent any holidays. What's the rabbit's significance?
I understand rabbits breed rapidly. Is Earth's Easter a fertility ceremony? Is that why they're important?
How could an Earth woman be so shy around men?
Didn't you grow up around men? What's the issue?
If you want to learn about men, talk to Dita. She's obsessed.
For an Earth woman, you seem uncomfortable around men. Are there still tensions between the sexes here?
I understand you're young, but are you really so...inexperienced with men? Didn't you grow up around them?
I was raised entirely without men, and yet there's Earth girls who seem just as clueless. I don't know how to take that...
Not to be rude, but it seems you're living proof that, even on Earth, the sexes can be clueless about each other.
...A satellite is a scanning instrument placed into orbit. They're trivial next to space travel--they don't even self-propel like a Dread.
...Just as this moon orbits Earth, a satellite is any scanning instrument placed into orbit. They just use gravity to move--simple next to a Dread fighter.
Satellites are just orbital scanners for planets. They're the first space technology ever designed--you should see my Dread.
...Satellites are among the most primitive space technology, Nami. They're orbital scanning instruments--my Dread is far more advanced.
This girl is from Poke...whatever? So...these games star real people?
...What makes you think I know what "Star Wars" is, either?
...Money? These games make money? All the money on Mejare goes to the state...
Should you be talking about ~name~ like this? If she wants to bring up...whatever-mon, let her do it.
...The what series?
...I don't even know what a princess is.
Super Ma--what? What's a "princess"?
...Do you two know each other, Chiaki? Is this woman famous?
Are you and ~player~ colluding over something, Kyu? Or are you...hm. A woman and a fairy...interesting relationship.
Always whispering to ~player~...fairy or not, I suppose you're both women. Strange romances on Earth...
I suppose your connection with ~player~ is romantic? Better a woman with a fairy than with a man.
I can only assume you and ~player~ have a very Mejarian relationship, Kyu. ...If fairies count as women.
You're constantly whispering to ~player~. Are you two...in one of the man-woman relationships I've heard about on Earth?
A man and a woman, constantly huddling up and colluding. I can only assume you're in a relationship...unthinkable.
Always talking to ~player~...you and he must be seeing each other. I guess public strip poker is a man-woman idea of romance.
