A good challenge is all I ever wanted from you, so I'm happy.
If you're really this good at cards, we should play all the time...
And you're just toying with me, stripping your rapier...this is great.
I'm really, honestly surprised, Jura. I've always wanted to have a rival for this sort of thing.
Anything's possible...especially if your opponent is convinced you can't win.
Don't get complacent, Jura. One inch is all an enemy needs.
Haven't I always told you to stay vigilant? Now's the time.
You'd be surprised how quickly a lead can vanish...especially when you think it can't.
I'm perfectly fine with being nude. I keep losing, so it's all I deserve.
I certainly don't relish it like you do, but I can live with it.
I'm not a lecherous exhibitionist like you. I'm merely tolerating my nudity.
Yes, Jura, I love being naked in public. I'm bursting at the seams with lust. Absolutely.
I'm sure your body will be much more thrilling than mine.
I work hard in the gym to make my body presentable. Yours is all genetics...and probably still better.
You're really excited about this dress drop of yours, aren't you? I suppose you have plenty to be proud of.
At least you've found something you're truly passionate about--flaunting your own indecency. But I suppose your body justifies that a little.
Figures you'd start with that. I've got no right to complain...I would've lost had you walked in here naked.
It's not much, but strip whatever you want, Jura. I would've lost all the same.
I should have known you'd strip things like that. We're going to be here all night.
Of course you'd start with that. I'd be concerned for your health if you didn't.
If you're trying to get my attention, feet don't interest me.
You'd best hope Earth people appreciate feet, because I don't.
Now I'm curious if Earthlings like women's feet. I'm indifferent...even like this.
Feet take a lot of abuse...even yours. So I wouldn't call this titillating.
You really need to learn how to mind your own business.
You don't have the right to know everything about me, Jura.
I have you on a need-to-know basis. We're still just colleagues, after all.
I'll never understand why you insist on flooding your work environment with sex and gossip.
It would seem that's the last of your trinkets. Better start playing seriously, Jura.
If you weren't taking this seriously before, now's the time. Don't give up!
No more accessories, it seems...but that's better. Now I want to see what your skill can manage.
Only that dress can save you now...that, and your own wits. I have my doubts about your underwear situation.
So this was your stripping plan. I guess I expected something like it...
Shame I couldn't hang around to analyze your stripping choices when they mattered to me.
If that's what you consider clothing, you've got this game locked down for sure.
Just your rapier...I should have expected this sort of teasing from you, but it wouldn't have mattered if I did.
Valore? W--where'd you get that idea?
Valore? That's your hypothesis? ...I'm afraid not.
...Valore's even more of a professional colleague than you are. I could never...
Valore? I...I couldn't look at her that way. We're in too similar of positions...
You know, I'm actually in a good mood. Try not to ruin it.
If you're wondering why I'm always serious, it's because you constantly do this to me.
If you haven't noticed, Jura, you're the one making me miserable half the time.
How sportsmanlike of you. I'll remember this.
You have no idea how glad I am to see all those ridiculous accessories go. But then, I also want you to win...
No, thanks. Jewelry isn't for me...especially your kind.
Jewelry has no place in my life...unless my eyepiece counts as jewelry.
I can't stay mad at you when you've got every right to make fun of me. I should have beaten you, or at least kept even...
...I don't appreciate your aggression, Caulifla. Or is that a Saiyan trait, as well?
...I don't mean any harm in my curiosity. I would hope you're a peaceful race, as well.
...Mejare has made enemies of its sister planet Tarak, as well as Earth. It was not my intention to add Saiyans to that list...unless we're given a reason.
...If you're a visitor to this planet, too, then you would do well to be more polite. I meant no hostility.
...It's true that adulthood is an attitude rather than an age. But you could still mature in that respect.
...Perhaps women would treat you like an adult if you responded in a more adult manner.
Eighteen? Earth's food supply must be scarce...still, you could stand to be more mature about the confusion.
...If you want to be treated like an adult, then don't throw a childish fit.
What's that thing? Oh, right, a bee.
Mejare does have bees...women need to maintain their flower gardens, after all.
How'd a bee get in here? ...How'd I get in here?
We're all just beating around the bush with these sorts of accessories...
The tension is palpable.
Seems cards aren't your speed. Take her outside for a fashion discussion instead, Jura.
You should have brought your laser ring, Jura...
Give me a break...
I brought my laser ring...don't make me use it.
...Wearing small things...that's the most strategy this offers.
...Maybe I should have brought something like that.
I hardly recognize some of these accessories...it must be Earth fashion.
...There's no sense in going bigger...
...I don't have much to lose in the first place.
...Good move.
...I'm glad I brought this.
Your "~clothing~"...interesting accessories Earth women wear.
As a pirate, one tends to forgo what accessories she can...
Only your ~clothing~? Get into the spirit of things.
What is the purpose of all these accessories?
All those accessories...our crew can be touchy about vanity at times.
I won't be counting my laser ring...I'd rather keep it on, honestly.
We're all just beating around the bush with these sorts of accessories...
I wonder what other small items you have...a pilot's eye should be able to spot them.
Perhaps discussing fashion with Jura is more your speed than poker is.
I brought my laser ring...don't make me use it.
Give me a break...
...I understand that my suit is rather revealing by Earth women's standards.
Just an accessory, as I stand here in my underwear. I suppose I deserve it.
...I think I'm seeing how to win this game, and it isn't a poker face.
That doesn't look important, so forgive me for being less than impressed.
Just your ~clothing~...only myself to blame.
Mejarian soldiers don't actually wear much more than I do...
...Where'd I put my stylus?
You're too vain. You don't need all that.
Hurry up...I'm goofing off by being here.
You still have something like that to lose?
Is that in vogue on Earth?
You're being very frustrating.
Pitiless to the end, it seems...
Sticking to the strategy, I see.
I've barely noticed you all game...good job.
Hmm...well, it makes sense.
Games shouldn't reward vanity...
This really is going to take me a while...
I hate vanity...and now I'm hating you.
This is what I get for playing badly...
Mocking your enemy after they've lost is poor form.
This game was supposed to loosen me up. You could use some of that...
To be so far ahead of me...have you considered a piloting career?
After all that time I took to finish, you're still so clothed...
Your play has been excellent...it's giving me goosebumps.
I really thought tonight would be an easy win...I sold Earth women short.
This place attracts the best women around, it seems.
(She's just jealous of Mejarian beauty. Yes, that includes you...silly.)
(Have I ever told you how beautiful you are, Meia? ...I mean, Barnette's still a little cuter.)
(Since ~name~'s being no help, how about you focus on our cutest crewmates?)
~name~--y-you...I...Jura...
Perfect. There's two drunks running around.
Well, now it's a race to see who blacks out first.
Jura can drink for a while. I suppose we'll see if Earth booze is powerful enough to topple you two.
Soldiers really are irresponsible. What are the odds they're both drunks?
Unbelievable. Two soldiers, both irresponsible alcoholics.
Soldiers, exotic hair, alcoholics. It's like watching a stranger look in a mirror.
At least Misato's got the height to down those drinks. Don't ask me how Sei's doing it.
At least Misato's just drinking beer. Sei's hard liquor is something else entirely.
Are you drinking? ...I didn't even know this place served alcohol.
Are you drinking? ...Don't even think about joining her, Jura. I'm not carrying you out of here.
Drinking...just like a soldier.
Are you drinking? The state-approved Mejarian libations are all full of hormones...
Half-naked and liquored-up seems like a bad combination...
Are you drinking? ...Well, keep it to yourself.
Tch...be glad there's no men here to take advantage of you two.
What a young girl needs is responsibility. You should leave this place before a man shows up...
Thank God this game is all women...please don't listen to her, Rin.
...Rin, I'd hate to see a girl like you taken advantage of. We're lucky there's no men here...drinking would make you vulnerable.
I'm--just as confused. The "best part" is something called..."birth control"?
...Nothing about the term "birth control" sounds like the best part of sex. What is it?
I--you're confused, too, Rin? So this isn't just an Earth term--what's "birth control"?
...Birth...control? Do Earth women make birth some kind of erotic experience? ...Rin, what is she talking about?
I--tch. What an obnoxious woman.
I'm not--tch. Fine.
If only you could ignore me more often...
Ignore--never mind. You're baiting me...
Tight clothing is common on our planet, but revealing clothing is moreso. Technically, this is a flightsuit.
This is a flightsuit, Jessie. We're from another planet, not "space." Mejarians wear many things.
Is that your perception of women from other planets? We all wear "spacesuits"? This is for piloting my Dread.
Don't women wear many different outfits on Earth, Jessie? Mejarians are the same. This is a piloting suit, not a spacesuit.
Tight clothing is common on our planet, but revealing clothing is moreso. Technically, I was wearing a flightsuit.
My suit is for flying, Jessie, and we're from another planet, not "space." Mejarians wear many things.
Is that your perception of women from other planets? We all wear "spacesuits"? I wear that suit to pilot my Dread.
Don't women wear many different outfits on Earth, Jessie? Mejarians are the same. I was wearing a piloting suit, not a spacesuit.
Done what? Should I not have said that? I don't--oh.
What do you mean, Mahiru? Is she--o-oh no, you don't have to. It's fine.
...Does Chiaki really like video games that much? Does--oh. Oh dear.
Now I've done it? What do you me--oh. Oh. Uh...please don't.
Jura just carries that for fashion's sake. Not that it's particularly useful next to a laser ring, anyway...
We use violence when necessary. Mejare's government are the real aggressors...
Mejare's military is full of the violent types you're looking for. We fight to survive.
Swords are too heavy. They'd just weigh me down in combat...like I keep telling Jura to remember.
A pilot has little use for a sword. Even our ground raids usually end far too quickly to get in close.
...You're certainly trusting. I suppose you can tell how Jura's not actually very skilled with that thing.
No. A pilot should focus on just that, not playing with knives.
My job is to pilot a Dread. Any time I could spend with a sword would be better used for that.
No. I don't share her fascination with swords--a pilot's job is to destroy targets quickly and from a distance.
No. A sword is a limited ground weapon, and we try to avoid ground engagements in the first place. We're pilots.
...Jura is always trying to set me up with women. She doesn't understand I lack the time for that.
I don't have the desire nor the time for a relationship. You can save the niceties.
Maybe if you did any work, you'd understand why I don't have the schedule for a relationship...
...She thinks because she has time for a girlfriend, we all do. I'm not interested.
...If a few conversations in the communal spa makes us friends, then sure. We're friends.
Is that all it takes for a woman to be your friend? Some time in the spa together? ...Fine, then. Friends.
Jura's definition of friend is certainly looser than mine if a spa visit is all it takes. But...I can live with that.
We've been through a lot more together than a few spa trips. But if that satisfies you...then we're friends.
Laid? What kind of...is this the vulgar language Earth women use?
I'd be a lot less sour if you stopped pestering me...and cleaned up your vulgar slang.
It's a leader's job to be sour. Subordinates and soldiers seem content with...sex-talk.
Wha--what are you talking about? I would never be with a woman who--who phrases romance as getting laid.
...Of course I haven't. Don't you know where we're from? Jura's been making it abundantly clear.
I'd be far more ashamed if I had been with a man. Pirates or not, we're still Mejarians.
As if I would even want to be. Mejare is the planet of women...and we still adhere to that.

state.text: It seems you've spent more time honing your gauntlets than your listening skills. No Mejarian has been with a man.

case.state: ...The last thing I need is a drink.
...I do not drink. You understand that?
...Keep offering drinks, and you'll really see me mad.
...I can't drink...I have responsibilities. Unlike you.
Don't worry--I've learned not to be too trusting. Actions are more important than whatever she says.
Misato isn't the first military woman who's tried to make herself sympathethic. We'll see what story her actions tell.
How gullible do you take me for? We'll see how Misato conducts herself and decide from there.
I always start from place of distrust for soldiers. If Misato's corrupt, she'll make it obvious soon enough.
Don't even think about sharing drinks with her, Jura. You do enough of that back on the ship.
Don't you dare touch her beer, Jura. I know how you get...and Barnette's not around.
You can strip all you want, Jura, but you're staying sober tonight, you hear me? Don't join in with this woman.
We've got a long flight home, Jura...so don't touch Misato's beer. You don't handle it as well as you think.
...Some sort of former celebrity, then? Don't feel bad, Nayru...so am I.
...You don't need to deny your past, Nayru. If you're avoiding some former fame...I am, too.
...Does Navi know you from media appearances? If there's a past you're running from...I used to be the poster girl for my Oma's company.
...Seems there's some confusion for all of us. If you're some kind of celebrity in hiding, Nayru...you're not alone.
I don't think she was teasing at all. A soldier's first instinct is to crush any dissent.
That didn't sound like a tease, Misato. This medic business is just her attempt to seem polite.
If Sei really were just a teasing medic, I would hope it'd take more than one insult to set her off.
Misato might buy your saving throw to make that look like a joke, but I don't. You didn't do anything because we're in public.
I don't trust you either, Misato. Especially with how quickly you side with your fellow military personnel.
It figures the other soldier would immediately side with her. You're both despicable.
I don't know what I expected, running my mouth. Even the unarmored soldier is quick to circle the wagons.
Don't offer her alcohol! She's still a child!
I--you couldn't be a worse influence if you tried. Never drink alcohol, Rin.
Don't take it, Rin. Drinking is a disgusting habit.
...Rin, stay in school and don't accept drinks from strange women.
For your own sake, stay in your corner. And you should be ashamed of yourself for giving drinks to schoolgirls.
Are you sure you can handle all those drinks?
I don't know where you're putting all that alcohol. You're tiny.
Sei reminds me of when you got Dita drunk, Jura. Of course, I'd rather forget that evening.
I can't believe you have room for all that alcohol...I'd rather finish them if it meant Rin didn't have to.
Can you really drink all that? ...If it's between Rin and me to finish those drinks for you, give them to me. She doesn't need that in her life.
Where is all that alcohol being stored? ...Give them to me if anyone. Not Rin...
...You're so short, but you can drink more than I ever could...if you need help, let me do it, not Rin.
Are you drinking? ...I didn't even know this place served alcohol.
Are you drinking? Jura drinks too much. Sometimes she's hungover at the next morning's meeting.
Are you drinking? ...Well, keep it to yourself.
I don't drink, Sei...not anymore.
Are you drinking? The state-approved Mejarian libations are all full of hormones...
Half-naked and liquored-up seems like a bad combination...
Drinking...just like a soldier.
Birth...control? What's that?
...What did you just say? "Birth control"? What does that mean?
Birth control? You control birth on Earth? That sounds--barbaric.
...What's "birth control"?
...This is the last time I try to make small talk about an Earth woman's interests.
And Jura wonders why I don't bother talking to people...
...At least you're passionate about it.
What's "1983"? I have no context for Earth years, Chiaki.
...Would you like it if I started rattling off my Dread's specifications?
Ah, yes. The enn-ee-ess. That explains everything. Thanks, Chiaki.
Men are nothing to be afraid of, Florina. Most are simpletons, anyway.
Listen. I've helped stage raids on Tarak's military. Men are easily dealt with.
You don't have to be afraid of men, Florina. They probably relish that.
You've got to assert yourself around men. They'll try to lord themselves over you otherwise.
Jura...? She's the closest thing to a friend I have, yes. But we're colleagues. What's this about?
...Why is an image of Jura worrying you, Nayru? ...Not that she's my friend, necessarily.
...Jura is my colleague, but it depends how you define friend. More importantly, what are you so agitated about?
...What did Jura scheme this time that's got you so worried? She's more teammate than friend, but...
Friend? ...You mean Jura? What did she hide from me this time?
Friend? ...You must mean Jura, though that's stretching the definition. None of her schemes are ever good for me.
...I assume you mean Jura. It was bad enough dragging me here, and now she's planning something else?
...Jura, you mean? I guess I spend the most time with her...but she's always scheming something.
...Why are you being evasive? I pirate for a living--of course there's going to be conflict. It's why I asked.
Are you surprised to be seeing fighting? That's what I do...it's why I wanted to know my future.
My future is always uncertain, Nayru...that's the nature of being a fighter pilot. And the reason I even asked.
Why do you think I asked about my future? I could die any given day...that's the risk of being a fighter pilot, and a pirate especially.
...I understand you may not like fighting, Nayru, but that's what a pirate does. It's why I wish to know the future at all...
...You said this was "Din's Power"? It's certainly intense...it sounds like a ritual.
Nothing more appropriate, huh...it sounds like something we should chant to.
Hmm...it sounds like a song some primitive tribe would dance to. Fiery.
So, "Din's Power"...energetic, like a bubbling pot. But why is it so appropriate?
...This is somber. And it just came to you? It's like death...
...The "Elegy of Emptiness," you said? It sounds as if it's trying to live up to the name.
Hmm...like a funeral dirge. Or perhaps the war bells that preceded it.
Harsh notes...but with little tying them together. It feels like it's dying.
..."Farore's Courage," this was called? It reminds me of piloting...
...Oh, this is nice. It's freeing...like the first time I piloted.
...You seem uncertain about this. But the tune is nice and bubbly...like flying.
So, you know the woman who wrote this? You called it Farore's Courage...it sounds like flying feels.
I'd be hard-pressed to find music that didn't make me feel a certain way...I see why it's named after sailing.
Are you sure? Hmm...it sways like a boat on the ocean. Fitting for the "Song of Storms."
Swaying back and forth...like a stormy sea. I'm sure if you give it time, a feeling will emerge for you, too.
...I didn't think you'd be so quick to dismiss it. To me, it's as its name implies--a gentle storm.
...Four people? And three of them men? I couldn't imagine...the three men with us are surrounded by a hundred women.
...You're the only woman? Small as it is, I couldn't work like that...
Working with three men on a ship full of women is awkward enough for me. I can't imagine being alone with just men...
...And you're OK without women around? Even with all the women around them, the three men we have aboard...are quite the presence.
Who is this Rock you keep mentioning? It sounds as if he irritates you...as men tend to do, in my experience.
...This "Rock"... If you've had to deal with a frustrating foil of a man, then you have my sympathy.
...It sounds as if you could start by defusing your relationship with "Rock," whoever that is.
...If this Rock is a man you find yourself having to work with, despite your differences...well, I have a crewmate like that, too.
...I don't want to fight you, Revy. I don't know why you want to fight me. You could probably make a nice guide to Earth culture.
I'm sorry for not backing down when you bark at me. You sound like you're opinionated...which would help me learn about this planet.
I wasn't interested in fighting the first Earth woman I met, Revy. I think you could teach me a lot about this place.
Maybe Earth women cower when you shout at them, but I've been shouted at for a long time. Perhaps we could get along, and you could teach me about Earth.
And invite a sucker punch? No, thank you. We deal with enough Earth robots as it is.
My squadron already has its hands full with killer Earth machines. Just stay where you are.
My squadron's mission for months now has been to identify hostile Earth machines. I don't need to feel your arm.
I'd rather not put myself in such a vulnerable position against yet another hostile Earth mech. Why not throw a piece of yourself here?
Actually, the way she breaks in rookies is by playing poker with them. Not strip poker, mind you, but the social effect is the same.
Gascogne's usual way to dress down a new recruit is to play poker with them... normal poker. So you remind me of her in many ways.
Speaking of Gascogne, she's an avid poker player, especially with the new crew members. Of course, she doesn't strip them.
She plays poker all the time, too...normal poker, with new pilots. But I suppose part of me wouldn't mind strip poker with her...
Uh--! And you're--removing a ribbon? You've revealed enough about your body this round already...
..."Monster Lord," without a doubt. We've never encountered alien life, and yet here it is on Earth...
My God! The living, breathing caricature of beastly women that Tarak paints...!
Ugh! I should've known to take such an outlandish title more seriously...!
You look a little incensed. Surely you understood this was part of the game.
No need to get all angry. You have plenty of clothes to lose still.
You're turning all red. You'll never win this if you lose your composure so early.
You have...cat ears? Earth is a strange planet...
What's wrong with having cat ears? It makes you unique.
I was wondering why you waited so long to take that off. I don't see what the issue is, but...sorry.
...If it makes you feel better, Blake, you still look nice. I'm sorry about your ears...whatever the reason is that you hid them.
Who was that woman, Cammy? You'd draw your enemies here and endanger us all?
Cammy! Don't you dare shrug that off! I demand to know who that was and why you drew her near us!
You've made some enemies, and you'd put us at risk by coming here? That wasn't some random thug!
That woman deliberately targeted you! What kind of mission is this that you'd draw them near civilians?
Your hand-to-hand skill really is excellent...what's your training routine like?
That said, to see you handling them like that...you're in fantastic shape. How do you train?
...If only I were as muscular...and as skilled. How'd you train that you can fend them off so easily?
Still...you fight incredibly, and your body is well-toned. Do you have any exercise advice?
I--I really didn't...
...You don't have to do that.
...I really wasn't that curious. Please don't start...
...Oh, dear. I just lit a fire, didn't I?
...I've done my best. How do you get your thighs that muscular?
...I exercise, but clearly not like you do. How did you get your thighs so...thick?
Diet and exercise are about all I've been doing. Your legs look like they could shred your pantyhose...how can I reach that level?
I've...tried to stay toned, but the rippling muscles on your legs...I have no clue how to achieve that.
...It's better in general if I don't get close, Jenetta.
...No, it's better if we stay at arm's length. Just strangers...
...I appreciate the openness, Jenetta, but I'm not...the same way.
...It's fine. Let's get to know each other before we start...touching.
...You lost me at dog. As in, those snouted things in zoos?
...Hilarious.
...I just now remember what a dog is, so you should've picked something else.
...What's a dog? Wait, those fanged things...Mejare has very few animals running around.
...I didn't understand any part of that.
...Maybe you should try another one.
...You need to take some responsibility for your own protection.
...We both know what Earthlings are capable of, and still you take the risk.
...I don't plan on having to use force, but you shouldn't underestimate these people.
...I might understand some bravado in your Dread, but we're vulnerable down here.
Somehow I doubt that's the end of your teasing.
Looking at your outfit...this is far from over.
At least you're enjoying yourself. I think I'm starting to see what you're going for, stripping-wise.
I'm starting to spot some more likely stripping candidates...this'll be a while.
Yes, she really is my second-in-command. I swear I've gotten her to focus on piloting occasionally.
I know Jura doesn't seem like much of a pilot at the moment, but you have to understand how much she loves her body...
Try not to let this teasing get to you. Jura's very proud of her body...she wants to make you beg for it.
Yes, Jura's really my second-in-command...because piloting is second among her priorities.
Why do you wear all that, anyway? It just looks cumbersome...I'd lose track of it.
I'd be tripping over that dress if I wore it...and I'd get those accessories caught on things.
You look perfectly fine without all those accessories on. Why not just go around like that?
You've no need for anything beyond what you're wearing now. Might even be worth cutting the dress closer, just for ease of movement.
...You seem to be referencing things, but I have no idea what they are.
I'll be honest. Half the time I have no clue what you're referring to when you speak.
I'm really out of my element here. I suppose an Earth woman would better understand what you're always referencing.
...What are you always talking about? You seem to be speaking around us more than to us.
Who--you--I--you don't even seem all that concerned. What's going on with you?
...Is this another strange Earth experiment? Launch! Explain yourself!
Am I just supposed to accept that this happens to Earth women? What's going on, Launch?
...You seem like this has happened before. That's good--now explain it to me.
That gun is pretty interesting...shaped like a man's kinetic one, but fires energy like a woman's.
Barnette would have liked to take a look at that gun...
I have my own experience combining men and women's weapons together...not with guns, though.
...I see. I'll keep that divinity in mind.
I really wasn't interested in it, but alright, then.
Divine or not, it's a bit of a cheat.
How does one bond with a sword, exactly? ...Stupid question, considering what the Paksis has done to our Dreads...
...I'm willing to believe it. But actions speak louder than words...especially for an Earthling.
...I'll just be quiet and let your behavior speak for itself, Misato. But Earthlings put me on edge already.
...I'll keep that in mind, Misato. I'm already wary of Earthlings in general.
I haven't had positive experiences with Earthlings, either...so a soldier just alerts me even further.
Drinking is disgusting...I would know.
You have a nice figure, Misato. Don't ruin it with booze.
Despite the alcohol, I guess you still have the professionalism to work for this "NERV," whatever it is.
Drinking...it's the sort of thing I'd expect from a military woman.
...I'm just going to ignore you from now on.
That's it. I'm ignoring you.
...You're not worth my attention.
...I'm done with you.
...I can see where this is going. I have nothing to learn about Earth from you.
Unbelievable that Earth would hide knowledge of its colonies from the general populace. Mine is Mejare, settled only by women.
Earth's leaders may not have told you this, but it has colonies throughout the galaxy. Mejare, the planet of women, is my homeworld.
Anpathos, Melanus, Tarak--settlers have been spreading out across the galaxy for generations. I come from Mejare, the planet of women.
Even among Earth's colonies, my homeworld is unusual for only having women on it. The male planet is close by...
A leader should know not to let words bother them. I would think a goddess would understand that.
Hm. Despite your title, it seems I could teach you about leadership. Don't break stoicism over a taunt.
If you were the leader you claim to be, Palutena, you wouldn't let words affect you in the first place.
Perhaps you're not prepared for the power you wield if a subordinate's questioning rattles you.
...Never mind. I think loud, obnoxious firearms suit you perfectly.
...You don't sound like you're going to change your mind. Loud guns for a loud woman.
...Never mind. It's not worth my time...your guns match your own volume.
...You seem happy with them. They make a racket, as do you.
Sorry if this is forward, but...you're very fit. It's impressive.
Can't believe you came to this game already showing off your muscles. They're something else, too...
What kind of exercise do you do? Your abs are toned...I'd like to get that fit.
Certainly doesn't look like you wear much. Your abs are showing...and they're hard to ignore.
...Senketsu? Your clothes are--is he that eye on your shirt? ...Well, our ship's energy core is alive.
"Senketsu"? Wait, that eye on your uniform--! Fascinating...does that afford you some kind of benefit?
What's Senketsu? Oh, I see--that moving eye on your shirt. We've had inanimate objects come alive...like our ship's energy core.
Senketsu? Wait a minute, that eye on your uniform is moving--! Earth continues to impress with its technology...
You seem like the type that people would take advantage of...until you have nowhere to go but places like this.
...I spent my teenage years in bars and alleyways, too. I don't want anyone else going through that.
You just don't look like you want to be here. I hate to see a woman alone in a seedy place...
It's my job to worry about women...especially ones who look like they don't belong. Don't you have a home?
I suppose medics are a little less reprehensible. Maybe you could help train Paiway.
How thoughtful of you. You don't happen to provide training to nurses, do you?
Actually, if you're a medic, the Nirvana could use you. Our only doctor is a man.
...A medic. That's not as bad...our ship's infirmary is understaffed at the moment.
Are you sure you can handle all those drinks?
I don't know where you're putting all that alcohol. You're tiny.
You remind me of when Jura got Dita, one of our trainees, drunk. She was as happy as ever...just slower.
Wha--and now you're fine? What's the meaning of this? Who are you?
I--how's it out already? Did you control that? Explain yourself!
How can you--treat a fire so casually? Shimakaze!
I--you--what's going on? That fire was unnatural--and so are you!
It must be, for you to bring it here. How many do you own?
I'm glad dying hasn't ruined your appreciation for knives. And I'm curious how many you have.
If that's your favorite, how many do you have? ...And for what purpose?
...How many knives do you have, exactly? Were you a chef before you died, or just a murderer?
Just from looking at you, you don't have a body to be ashamed of. It's no issue...
What's wrong? Your figure is fine. I assume being a "hero" keeps you in shape...
Why would you be ashamed of your body? Maybe Earth women are more modest...
But then...oh, right. You were tricked into coming here, yes? I was dragged...
You look fine, Ochako. Don't let others put you down about a figure you've worked for.
And you seemed so unassuming...just an embarrassed girl.
Seems that outfit should have tipped me off about you...but it's rather normal on Mejare.
How could such a flustered girl be hiding away incredible powers like that?
To levitate under your own power...I need a ship to do it. And you seemed so innocent...
...I really wasn't interested.
I know what panties look like. Put your skirt down.
I think you're the only one demanding your panties be shown.
...Good to know you're not as modest as you look.
...Er...alright then.
...Whatever you just did, can't you actually strip?
I wouldn't call that stripping...or part of the physical realm, for that matter.
...I can't believe what I'm looking at.
Can't you just take off your damn clothes? Honestly.
Why even play if you're not going to follow the rules?
For God's sake...this is preposterous.
I got dragged here. You don't see me making a fuss about stripping.
Just...why? Are you afraid to show off your body? It can't be that bad.
Doesn't that take more effort than just removing your clothes? Are you hiding something about your body?
Are you that afraid to be naked? Is there something about your body you're trying to hide?
For all your bluster and lightshows, you actually do seem fairly skilled at cards.
You're pretty good at this game. Why do you insist on acting so strangely?
Underneath all your costume-switching, you actually seem to know what you're doing.
...That does look useful. I wonder what you'd think of the Paksis.
...Oh my God. I wonder how your power compares to that of the Paksis...our energy core.

...Catchy. I don't suppose you know this song, Rin? Given you're from Earth.
...Is this a soldiers' song, or one every Earth girl learns growing up? ...Rin?
Be my guest. It would certainly serve you better in combat, if you can stomach not being able to tease your figure.
I fully encourage the switch. You'll be surprised how comfortable it is...and it won't get caught on anything during raids.
I'd appreciate it if you started dressing for practicality, even if it's a byproduct of wanting to show off your body even more.
By all means, Jura. I think you'll find how versatile bodysuits can be...and women will still ogle you, yes.
...What's a combo? ...What's a bug?
...And this revolutionized things, somehow?
These things run on computers, right? If there was a bug, why didn't they fix it?
Can't it? You seem to be doing a good job.
I'm telling you, I don't know what "Super Mario" is. Slow down.
I've made it twenty years without knowing about it, so I think it's not all that important.
...Why are you doing this to me? I was just being polite...
I can assure you space technology exists here--my ancestors were from Earth, and Earthlings have been sending attack fleets after us.
...I could prove space technology exists, but I see no reason to share it with an Earthling. You've already sent entire fleets to kill us.
...Perhaps a pirate is blameless here, but Earth has been dispatching Harvest units to destroy us. Space technology is all too real.
...After being told I'm descended from spacefaring Earthlings and facing its attack forces, I find it hard to accept that satellites don't exist here.
Damn it! I knew this place wasn't safe! I'm leaving--!
This place felt off from the start--is this the Harvest? Damn it all--!
Nayru! Damn it! Where's--are there any more? This place...
Argh--Nayru! I should never have come here--where's the exit?
Some Harvest trap? Agh--I should've known! I've got to get out of here before more show up--!
..."Zone-sama"? I see...so you're a scout for your employer. She must seek women who are willing to strip for a crowd--is there more to it?
Hmm...so you're a scout rather than the owner. And what does "Zone-sama" seek in porn models? Large breasts?
...So you're making note of potential models for your employer. I'm curious what an Earth porn producer wants in her women.
...If pornography is the darkest reflection of our sexuality, then I wonder what this "Zone-sama" has you seek in women. A love of men's tubes?
...Aren't you familiar with space travel? Pluto had a colonist civilization, just as my home Mejare does.
...You're speaking as if Earth isn't capable of space travel. This is where her ancestors came from--and mine.
...I never thought an Earth woman would be so confused by the notion of space travel. Misty and I are descended from spacefaring Earthlings.
...What exactly are you confused about? Earthlings have been colonizing planets beyond the solar system for centuries.
...But surely an Earth woman would be familiar with men. Don't you live with them?
...Perhaps not formally taught, but don't you live with men on this world? Or are the sexes segregated?
...I was hoping for information on them. Woman cohabitate with men on Earth, correct? My homeworld has none.
Oh...was I mistaken in thinking men and women lived together on this planet? Perhaps you don't meet any until you marry...
...Again, this is purely for research. Some clips of men's rods at work would be all I'd need...stiffening, being inserted.
...Don't misinterpret me. Could you edit them down to show the progression of men's tubes, from flaccid to erect to ejaculating?
I'm sure you're proud of your performances, but I'm only interested in seeing how men physically engage in sex...and shoot their seed.
If you could splice key sequences from your films, that'd be best. Just the act of men's rods enlarging... penetrating... ejaculating.
...What are you saying? How can you become pregnant by accident? An Oma and Fama have to agree to that...!
...It wasn't your intention? O-of course--there's no distinction between sex with a man and trying for pregnancy! Unthinkable...
...You can't be serious. Even casual sex with a man runs the risk of pregnancy? A child with unwilling parents...that's terrible!
...Oh, God. If it doesn't take machinery to get pregnant by a man, then...it can be accidental? The poor child...!
That's dangerous!
I would never tolerate this kind of negligence!
Are you trying to get us killed?
What's wrong with you?
Firearms aren't toys!
...Secret? What secret?
If your "secret" is breasts, I should remind you all women have them. Even some men do.
Breasts are no secret. Well, maybe on Tarak.
What do you mean that counts as two? I wear a bodysuit, and it's clearly one piece.
Counting it twice...what a cowardly move. You won't see me doing that with my suit.
You're counting the suit twice? ...Rest assured, I'll count mine as one. Nothing else would feel right to me.
Taking just the top of the suit off is cowardly. I won't be doing the same, even if it's allowed.
...I see you have a charming personality to match your skin tone. It's true we've never met alien life...but Earth has a history of twisted experiments.
...An alien...I have my doubts. Earth has never discovered alien life in its centuries of colonization...
..."Alien"? No human has encountered alien life, despite all our space exploration...you look like a modified woman.
...I'll be sure not to show concern for you in the future. Are you really a form of alien life?
...What did you call yourself? Mejare sees men as aliens, but honest alien life...right here? I assumed you were an Earth cyborg...
Underneath...your shirt? But why?
If I could undo my bra underneath my flightsuit, I wouldn't have to pirate for a living.
I consider strategy my strong suit...but I can't fathom what your endgame is here.
You can't be serious. How cowardly can you get?
Take your losses with dignity. Nothing's more embarrassing than a woman who can't own up to her failures.
Wearing makeup at all is already beyond me. To try to count it as an item is outright embarrassing...
Jura wears a lot of makeup, too...I hope she wouldn't try to count it as clothing.
Are you really that ashamed of your body? Or just of losing?
Don't waste everyone's time...have some respect for yourself.
You're a..."princess"? ...And for some reason this required disguising.
Is a "princess" some kind of leadership position? Is that why you wore an unconvincing disguise?
If you're a "princess" so desperate to remain disguised, then why did you show your face and play strip poker?
That was a disguise? I'm not interested in your politics.
Do you really need a trick to take off your clothes?
...I really wish you didn't treat this game as a magic showcase.
I'd appreciate it if you didn't waste time with parlor tricks.
I'm here for a brief game of wits, not magic tricks and lengthy showmanship.
If you think you're scaring me, I have to pilot against Earth's organ harvest fleet again tomorrow.
I'm sure you're very intimidating, Juri, but I deal with fleets of organ-harvesting robots for a living.
Street thugs don't impress me. I used to be one...and Earth's fleet of organ harvesters is a lot scarier.
During my days on the streets, I might've found you intimidating. Today I fear the organ harvesters Earth sends our way.
...What? You're saying complete nonsense. And are you really taking your shirt off already?
...Excuse me, Kizuna, I'm speaking to you. What's this gibberish about writing--and why are you starting with your shirt?
...Your choice of first strip is as nonsensical as whatever you're saying.
...Well, you certainly can start with your shirt. But what are you talking about, with "lines" and "writing"?
Isn't there any way to keep the blue one around? She at least has social skills.
At least you aren't waving a gun around this time...but your mouth is still just as filthy.
Fortunately, your split personality seems to keep you in check better than most maniacs.
Hello, Launch. For the third time now.
Wha--what's happening to you?
...Ladybug?
Ladybug, you're...glowing.
Wha--Ladybug? Are you alright?
What's wrong? Is there something you're hiding?
...You seem a little uncomfortable to be taking that off. Besides the obvious reasons why.
...Misato? Are you alright? You're looking all flushed.
Already? If you're trying to throw us off, a bodysuit would've done that without a strange strip order.
...I suppose no rule mandates a stripping order. I hope my suit isn't making you jealous with how it shows my figure.
...Well, you're backing up your attitude. Is Mejarian fashion making you feel threatened?
...I hope my slight layering isn't making you feel threatened. There's no need to throw all your clothes off.
...So much for that comparison. Now you're taking the light away?
...Just when I compare her to the Paksis, she dispels it.
...Well, perhaps we'll see what you look like now. I can't say I found the Paksis attractive.
...Hm. You looking like the Paksis reminded me of home...but I suppose this is more erotic.
I'm on a strange planet, and you want me to accept food? I'm not coming back to the ship with pink skin.
Judging by your skin color, you're eating far too many cupcakes. I'll pass...
Whatever's in your cupcakes, I don't want any. Bright pink skin can't be healthy, even if sugar were.
A cupcake? Fattening...from a foreign woman...might turn my skin pink. That's a lot of reasons to decline.
...Am I supposed to know this song?
Nothing about being a pirate is free, I promise you.
...Catchy.
All these shots and damage reports...it's like I never left the ship.
I certainly didn't picture a living ship taking damage today...it's as if I'm right back to work.
I can practically hear Belvedere's voice in my head, reporting this sort of damage to the Nirvana...
Every time you call out structural damage, instinct makes me want to rush to our hangar.
...Of course, being able to float would make it a lot easier for me to get out of mine.
I hope you realize how lucky you are to be blessed with these powers. I can't slip out of my suit so easily.

state.text: On the plus side, my suit zips in the front...but I think your levitation powers make it easier for you overall.
I suppose floating makes removing your suit much easier than it is for me. Still, it can't be fun wrestling with a zipper in the back.

case.state: Already? Well...I suppose all clothes are equal here.
For such a conservatively dressed woman, you're having a lot of fun with this.
Well, that didn't take long. I should have expected someone would strip like this.
That was fast. Is that modest look just a front?
Can't say I'm surprised. How many costumes can that thing give you?
How many costumes are available to you with that thing, anyway?
So if I rolled that die, would my outfit change? How many do you have?
Sad how this doesn't even perturb me anymore.
Can't believe I've gotten used to this in the short time I've known you.
This really is spectacular. But couldn't you put it to better use than changing your clothes?
Since when does a bodysuit count as two pieces? Must be a media woman's need to keep the audience around.
Just keeping your viewers occupied? Because I clearly set a precedent for taking bodysuits off in one go.
Why are you counting your suit twice when I didn't? ...Trying to keep viewer interest, probably.
I suppose a reporter has to make viewers wait as long as possible. I didn't count the suit twice, after all...
Sorry to see you down to your ~clothing~ already. It is a style on Mejare, though.
See how calm she is, Jura? You need to learn how to stay composed under pressure.
If you want advice on how to take care of all that skin, head to Melanus...or ask Barnette.
Come on, ~name~, put some effort into this.
I reveal so much already...and yet so little, as well.
I hate to see a woman pushed to the brink...
Nearly out already? Women need to be strong.
Where's your focus? Gascogne would put you through the ringer.
You've been disappointing...
Don't you have any fight left in you?
Sorry to see you down to your ~clothing~ already. It is a style on Mejare, though.
See, Jura would be choking at this point. I can never get her to stay calm.
If you want advice on how to take care of all that skin, head to Melanus...or ask Barnette.
Come on, ~name~, put some effort into this.
I reveal so much already...and yet so little, as well.
You wouldn't last five minutes against Gascogne.
Your ~clothing~? Thought you might have had something else...
Come now. I'm practically naked already.
I wonder if you'd make a good pilot, provided I whipped you into shape.
A woman should take care of herself...let's see if you do.
Join me in my underwear. Maybe then you'll appreciate female camaraderie.
Come on, ~name~. Women have to stick together in this big universe of ours.
It's possible to stay calm dressed like this. Just watch me.
That's the way. Things are heating up.
Earth women's outfits are very individual...on Mejare it's state-approved fashion.
If I can handle it, you can.
Perhaps my shorts are starting to look appealing. They're certainly more comforting than some silly thong.
There's nothing wrong with showing skin. Ask Barnette.
I wonder if your ~clothing~ would look good on me...
I really don't have much besides my flightsuit...and that smock I sleep in.
That's more like it. Now you're dressing like a Mejarian.
Oh, suck it up. Someone's dying right now.
You should meet the captain. She's never cracked under pressure...
Scary how quickly defenses can melt away...
Oh? This changes things.
Take my mind off of piloting...
Maybe I did need to cut loose.
This is so exciting...I see the same women every day.
You have a great body. Mejarians are always comparing.
I'm starting to feel a little glad you made me masturbate...
An excellent choice...for an excellent opponent.
What else are you hiding? If only I could force you to show it myself...
Why didn't we all start with the same amount of clothes?
You're full of surprises, ~name~. It's a good trait in a woman.
I don't mind a little skin. Not at this point, anyway...nothing to lose.
(Go ahead...imagine your life together with this girl. That's what fantasies are for...)
(Don't be ashamed of the feelings you have for her...you deserve love.)
(I just think you should get a girlfriend...there's plenty of willing girls on our crew, you know.)
~name~...I-I hope this isn't strange to you...woman embracing like this.
(Ooh, she really is cute! Go ask her out, Meia...she's seen your most private side already, anyway.)
..."Hate-fuck." Don't be ridiculous...blue hair is not enough to woo me.
Be quiet. No amount of sideline jeering is going to make a drunken soldier appealing to me.
...If you're trying to pair me with Sei because I have blue hair, Futaba, you two share a height.
...Yes, a "hate-fuck" would be the only way I'd ever find myself in bed with Sei. But don't count on it.
You...seem a little hostile towards men. You didn't grow up on Mejare, did you?
Seems Mejarian relationships have a home on Earth, too...because you certainly aren't fond of men.
Take it easy, would you? Men aren't total monsters.
Your hatred of men puts Mejarians to shame. What did one do to you early in life?
So...you two are an item, I assume? And that's why you're defensive around men?
You...seem a little hostile towards men. Mejarian soldiers would certainly like robotic arms.
Seems Mejarian relationships have a home on Earth, too...because you certainly aren't fond of men. Is that how you lost your arm?
Take it easy, would you? Men aren't total monsters. I think they'd be afraid of your arm.
Your hatred of men puts Mejarians to shame. Did a man cut off your arm?
So...you two are an item, I assume? And that's why you're defensive around men...aside from losing your arm?
...Should we just leave you two alone? You seem to forming a romance as we speak.
...I didn't expect to see womanly love blooming here, but maybe I should have...what with the stripping.
You two...seem to be getting along. Good to see a familiar Mejarian relationship on this strange planet.
And I thought Earth women exclusively liked men. You two are quickly becoming more than friends.
And the rambling drunkard claims I'm the agitator.
...You want to handle this girl, Jura? I think you two would get along better.
Can you take over this conversation, Jura? I'm sure you and Sei can find new ways to make fun of me.
I'd be happy to leave you alone. If only you'd do the same.
There's nothing to worry about, Marinette. I won't start a fight... and Sei is too inebriated to win one.
We don't need to be separated. Sei isn't much of a threat anymore--and I don't plan on provoking her.
Don't worry, Marinette. Even if Sei thinks about arresting me, she'll just trip over herself and fall asleep.
Earlier I might have been concerned about Sei's equipment, but now she can barely see straight. A fight won't take long, Marinette.
...I'm sorry you had to be subjected to this, Rin. But every girl who's cast aside eventually learns the truth about authority.
...Take this night as a warning, Rin--the state does not have your interests in mind.
Rin. The next time your planet's military claims to protect you, remember this image of a drunken imp.
...Always have respect for yourself, Rin, no matter what happens. Sei has all of her limbs, and she just abuses her authority.
You're drinking so much...don't you have to work tomorrow?
I can't be drinking like you...I don't get days off.
You don't have the height to be knocking all those drinks back.
Alcohol...empty calories.
Compared to this girl, Jura, you're downright temperate. Sorry I said anything.
Well, Jura, she's certainly giving you a comprehensive look into alien women's fashion.
Well, you're certainly keeping us on our toes.
Hm? Actual progress? Maybe I misjudged you...what do you think, Jura?
...This is the last time I try to make small talk about an Earth woman's interests.
And Jura wonders why I don't bother talking to people...
...At least you're passionate about it.
What's "1983"? I have no context for Earth years, Chiaki.
...Would you like it if I started rattling off my Dread's specifications?
Ah, yes. The enn-ee-ess. That explains everything. Thanks, Chiaki.
...Nayru? Are you alright? Blink if you can understand me.
...It stopped. Nayru, can you hear me? Say something.
...Nayru? Hello? You might just be feeling shock--try to relax.
...Are you alright, Nayru? It might've just torn your dress...try to speak, if it doesn't hurt.
...You must enjoy your work. I can't imagine taking sexuality so lightly....
...This is hardly my idea of fun. To watch women strip nude every day so... casually...
...I would need an ulterior motive to be here...like studying Earth culture. Conflating sex and fun seems unwise...
Mixing fun and work seems ill-advised...but perhaps that's the perspective of a fighter pilot. Sex seems so casual to you...
Tell me something I don't know. So they're just as mystifying to women who live around them every day...
...You've lived around men your entire life, and you don't understand how they think, either? Unbelievable...
...Mejare would have you believe men don't feel anything at all. It's not encouraging to hear that Earth women struggle with them, too.
I don't have time to observe men all day and figure them out. I was hoping Earth women understood them better...
"Exciting"? Well...our prisoners certainly brought some intrigue of their own on board. And some--intimate cockpit seating.
"Exciting"...to a certain kind of woman, maybe. They have helped us unlock new power--provided I sit up against one of them.
I suppose there's a certain "excitement" when joining my ship with a man's...for the power gained, not our--seating arrangement.
I have crewmates who find men's presence on our ship far more exciting than I do. Even when I co-pilot with one, it's...strange.
Their bodies? Well...some are certainly taller than others. But they're nothing like women...
Women's bodies are "nice." Men's are much broader, harsher...utilitarian. No matter the size...
...Well, men's bodies certainly aren't graceful like women's. They're built to destroy, or do heavy lifting.
I...suppose so. But next to women, men are so...angular. More suited for crushing rocks than caressing someone.
Comforting? Men's strength is the first thing Mejarians are warned about as girls. "Never let them catch you."
Therein lies the difference between Earth and Mejare. You see men's strength as a partner's protection--we see it as an enemy's weapon.
...Maybe if I trusted a man enough, that imposing strength would be a comfort. We were all spun stories about how they'd restrain us...
..."Comforting." Even as pirates, we're warned to never engage in hand-to-hand combat with men if we can help it. They're such burly animals...
I suppose that's true...I've learned men aren't all the same beast. Some are shorter, some serious...some cowards.
...You're right. As a girl, I was taught men were all the same beastly, hulking monster. But some are actually intelligent...or handsome.
...I was hoping for general advice, but perhaps men are just as complex as women...each one requires a different approach.
Surely there's general characteristics men share. I was always taught that there was nothing that made them different from each other.
I appreciate it. ...Out of curiosity, how many of your videos fit what I requested?
...You didn't consider that for long. Just how many of your videos feature you...taking a man's seed?
...That's the subject of most of your work in the first place, isn't it? How many videos have you and a man starred in?
...That was a rather paltry request, wasn't it? How much of your work features a man penetrating you?
..."Birth control"? So Earth women use some sort of device to prevent pregnancy... that can't be flattering for the man.
"Birth control"? Oh, I see...you have a means of blocking men's seed. Still, that must put an air of mistrust over the encounter...
...So not only does sex with a man have a looming threat of unplanned pregnancy, but you can employ "birth control" and show you don't trust him.
...I see. I can't imagine there's much of an emotional bond with a man when you're desperately blocking his attempts to impregnate you.
...Sex and pregnancy...that connection just doesn't exist on Mejare. And what kind of message does "birth control" send to your partner?
You could've killed someone!
Barnette's a gun nut, too...but she has the sense to go to the firing range.
Men's kinetic weapons are so uncivilized.
I hope you're proud of your reckless disregard for safety.
Danger is not something you joke about!
Sweater...puppies? Earthlings and their vulgar sex slang...
Well. Look what you were hiding away,
...Oh. They're larger than they look. Great.
Well, my theory's confirmed...they're bigger than mine.
...I should've expected this. The suit made it obvious...
...Your suit was very form-fitting.
A revealing suit...a bigger bust.
...I actually own a swimsuit like that. Gascogne gave it to me.
...I actually own a swimsuit like that. But we all use the hot springs naked anyway.
I actually own a swimsuit like that. But mine isn't covered in blood.
Bloodstains...menstrual issues, or just a murderer?
...I'm sure your syringe-arm is also in perfect condition, and that you'd mock me for acknowledging it.
At least now I know not to ask about your mechanical arm, since you'll just interpret it as an insult and retort.
I was going to ask about your mechanical syringe-arm next, but now I know you'll just insult me again.
I was actually curious about the syringe-arm you have, but it seems you're not here to engage with anyone.
...For a second there, I was about to lose all respect for you.
...Well, that's more acceptable. I don't know why you'd play this game if you found stripping so disagreeable.
You shouldn't have made such a fuss in the first place. It's just a game.
See? No reason to hide your face. You look fine.
Why were you hiding your face in the first place? Are you some kind of outlaw?
Celtic hid her whole body for a while...because she was afraid of men's germs. Why were you doing it?
The shirt, too? The least you could do is practice before forcing us to watch you.
...Was the shirt supposed to come off, too? Was that a subtle apology for wasting time?
I thought you were just doing the vest. How hard could that have been?
...If losing the shirt was a mistake, keep making mistakes. It's more entertaining than whatever you had planned.
...You were keeping food in your pants? That's unsanitary...and wasteful, which is even worse.
Am I supposed to find rotting food amusing? Meals aren't a given in my line of work.
...It seems Earthlings have the luxury of wasting food on parlor tricks.
Bananas are a rarity on Mejare...food in general is, actually. We're lucky to have stolen enough to create a reserve stock.
You're a..."superhero"? I don't follow...
You looked like you were made of Paksis energy for a second there...you're a "superhero"?
...I'm sorry, you're a "superhero"?
I've heard of ladybugs...but Mejare doesn't have any. "Superheroes" I'm not sure about...
Mejare doesn't have any ladybugs...neither does Earth anymore, in all likelihood. And what does a "superhero" do?
Oh, God. I--didn't realize.
Oh...I'm sorry.
I'm lucky. I've been in a lot of battles, but suffered no permanent injuries.
I guess I shouldn't have brought up the Second Impact...that was rude of me. I'm sorry.
I almost died in a battle once...a piece of the Paksis got lodged in my head.
If your goal is to lose, why are you even playing?
Just trying to expose herself...this girl is wasting my time and hers.
...If you're only interested in throwing the game, you can strip on the street corner.
I'm assuming your shorts are next? I don't appreciate someone throwing the game and wasting my time.
So you do resemble a woman. Is that what women of Planet Hyrule look like?
...So are you a typical resident of Planet Hyrule? You resemble a woman, but you're much smaller...
...You claimed earlier to be from a "Hyrule" planet. I assume you're an average woman from there?
...It would seem the typical woman of Planet Hyrule does not grow very large. At least you can fly.
You didn't have to be ashamed of your face.
Why hide your face? You look perfectly fine.
I didn't know Earth women had skin colors like that...
Someone's not shy about pubic hair...I find it distasteful, but it's your choice.
We can already see your pubic hair...why you'd want any at all is beyond me.
Pubic hair must be popular on Earth...and some of my crewmates don't have the diligence to stay shaven.
The rambling drunkard claims I'm the agitator...
You really would get along with Jura...especially if your sexual comments are anything to go by.
You and Jura would have a great time thinking up new ways to make fun of me.
I'd be happy to leave you alone. If only you'd do the same.
You're drinking so much...don't you have to work tomorrow?
I can't be drinking like you...I don't get days off.
You don't have the height to be knocking all those drinks back.
Alcohol...empty calories.
Compared to you, Jura's downright temperate.
My bodysuit is tight enough...I'd never wear that underneath it.
Doesn't that make it hard to breathe? Mobility is important, you know...
...OK, nobody on Mejare wears that.
And you've even got underwear underneath it. So do I...it's more necessary than it seems.
I was hoping you'd have the presence of mind to have underwear on. So do I, underneath my suit...
There's nothing like the women who think you wear nothing underneath the suit, is there? ...I guess that spoils things for me.
And you've got underwear...I have some under my suit, as well. It's ridiculous how many women are surprised by that.
Jura would get a kick out of you. Such an extensive look into alien women's wardrobes.
Well, you're certainly keeping us on our toes.
Hm? Actual progress? Maybe I misjudged you...Jura would love seeing all these outfits.
You are, without a doubt, the strangest woman I've ever met. Living your whole life up to chance? The universe is dangerous...
What exactly do you wear on a regular basis?
Life is uncertain enough. I'd like my outfit to not be up to chance.
This is one of the few outfits I have...can't imagine leaving that up to a dice roll.
...Are you going to explain what a "Stand" is?
Our commander, Buzam Calessa, came up with the name. But I have no idea what a stand is.
..."Stand"? Jolyne, don't just throw out Earth terms like I know what they mean.
...I have no clue what a "Stand" is, but our crew has definitely taken to the Nirvana's name.
Good to see you had underwear on...and even better, it's supportive. You're more sensible than you look.
You might be more embarrassed, Ochako, but that supportive training gear tells me you're a smart woman.
A bodysuit and athletic underwear? I had no idea our fashion senses were that similar...or that you were so sensible.
Maybe I can't fly like you, Ochako, but we're not so different. I like women smart enough to wear something supportive.
And you've even got underwear underneath it. It's more necessary than it seems, isn't it?
I was hoping you'd have the presence of mind to have underwear on. I did, after all...
...Never mind. I can see that you have an exceptional figure...you're bursting out of that bikini.
...Well...there's no need to dwell on the subject here. Seeing your entire figure now...you're quite well-endowed.
...It's not your doing, so don't worry about it. On another subject...your swimsuit looks fit to burst. Your hips are stretching it...
...Never mind. You may not have access to space technology, but you've certainly eclipsed me in terms of...shapeliness.
You've got a good build.
You're built well, ~name~. I'm impressed.
Nice build. I think you may be letting yourself go, Jura...
It's the cards that save you, not the clothes.
Believe in yourself. No one else will before you do.
Come on, give me a challenge.
You're looking a little bare, ~name~. Maybe you should take her to the hot springs instead, Jura?
Even Dita would have given me a better challenge...
Sorry, but you can't give your opponent an inch.
I don't go easy on my pilots, and the same goes for you.
Dita really does have potential, but her head is in the clouds. So she's useless at cards.
You didn't play this game just to strip, did you? I have Jura here for that sort of thing...
Barnette doesn't wear much more than her underwear...
It's the cards that save you, not the clothes.

You're one to talk, Jura. I haven't shoved his face into my cleavage.

Woo.

...You must be very proud.
Woo.

Isn't that bad for your back?

Ugghhh...

state.text: To be honest, Elizabeth, this seems a lot more awkward for you.

case.state: Uh...what are you doing to Marinette?

Was this game just an excuse to shave yourself? You're so positive about it, I can't even be annoyed.

For a woman with an exposed midriff, you seem uncomfortable stripping your pants.

Is Barnette alright with you being here? You did tell her, right?

I'm ashamed of my breasts...but I wouldn't give that away by hiding them longer than needed.

Mejarians are taught to preserve our reproductive organs above all else...
You sure aren't shy about it. You really would hit it off with Jura.

Part of me applauds exhibitionism. I tolerate being nude, but I don't like it.

Just leave already. You're clearly not interested in the game.
Would you stop wasting all of our time? Just throw the cards down and strip...or better yet, leave.
Earthling or not, no woman should be this obsessed with sex...can't you leave?

Do it.

No woman does disingenuous quite like you.

How a woman reacts to loss will usually tell you what you need to know about her.

No different than our changing stations.

~name~...you look beautiful, and I'm sure it's fine.

...Amalia, what is this woman referring to? You wouldn't really let her--use tentacles?

..."Wakfu." Isn't that where Amalia is from? ...Well, yes. I can see her agreeing to tentacle penetration.

Damn it--Tharja, undo your magic at once! If you don't relent, I will subdue you!
Tharja! I won't tolerate acts of aggression against my subordinates! Now, restore her!
Tharja! Disfiguring my crewmates is crossing the line--if you want to leave this place alive, fix her breasts at once!
